Reviews.Title: “St Patrick's Day!”
Reviews.Author: Ann985
Reviews.Content: This small, boutique hotel was great for a weekend in the city. Very close to theatres, Millinium Park, art museum. Not a bad walk to Navy Pier and the shops on Michigan Ave. right in the heart of the loop shopping and restaurants. Very friendly staff. Don't panic when you see the el right outside the door. Sounds from it were not a problem. Our room was not large. This is an old hotel,recently renovated, so that was not a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old Hotel of the John Burnham character of architecture”
Reviews.Author: western59
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel is old oak walls and furniture. The Lobby is very Arts & Crafts era and so elegant. The rooms were small but very clean & modern amentities. Since it is located in the Loop and across from Jewler's Row the parking is valet. Very expensive. The doorman and staff are all very polite and knowledgeable of the area. The EL trains are right there and very noisy. There is a restaurant on the premises with a great breakfast. We enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raesin
Reviews.Content: We originally had a reservation at the palmer house but they overbooked so they comped our room at the silversmith. We were pleasantly surprised and the staff was extremely friendly. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AndyBD_917
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed staying at this gorgeously decorated and clean hotel. The staff was very friendly and eager to please, and the location next to the L made the entire city convenient for whatever we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Wow -- good for a splurge, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: T_R_Grant
Reviews.Content: Once you get inside, the Silversmith is an impressive hotel. We booked a suite for three nights; while you can see where the cost of suites comes from (c$400/night), it still seemed a bit expensive for what we got. Nonetheless, we had an excellent stay. The lobby area is very plush and nice for lounging. Our room was huge, with a bathroom bigger than some hotel rooms, with a jacuzzi tub and walk-in shower. The room was well-appointed and comfortable. There was some noise from the L but nothing that disturbed our sleep. The Silversmith is convenient for the theatre area as well as many downtown attractions. If the price was right, we would consider a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem on Jeweler's Row”
Reviews.Author: TGiF01
Reviews.Content: You may never know it's there if you don't go looking for it, but this is a gem. If you are planning to come into Chicago to shop or go to a show- this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Midrange, acceptable, missing the finer details...”
Reviews.Author: SanRafaelChick
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Silversmith when I was in town for a conference. It's in a great location, near the Art Institute and downtown, and is only a block from the swanky Palmer House Hilton, where you can get a drink in one of the most stunning lounges I have seen (painted ceilings, gorgeous architecture). But the Silversmith itself is not particularly high-end when you look at the details. The sheets, fixtures, etc. weren't much nicer than any major chain motel. Our shower wouldn't get hot enough, and had an old showerhead. The bath amenities were spare- shampoo, lotion, and a soap, unlike nicer hotels. And the decor attempts to be arts &crafts, but actually is more like a spruced up 70's room. They had installed granite counters in the bathroom, which was nice, but it's like they only went halfway in renovating the hotel. It masquerades as upscale, but is actually just basic, midrange. No major complaints about service or anything. If you want a clean, basic room to sleep in, it's just fine, but don't expect to be wowed. Go outside into the city to get that.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: Cathy T
Reviews.Content: Great location, Terrific staff, The rooms were luxurious (Granite in the bathroom), comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JaneMP
Reviews.Content: We came into Chicago via the South Shore Line and this was just a short walk away. We were more than pleasantly surprised by the spacious lobby, the friendly reception from both the bell staff and front desk. Our room was quite large as was the bathroom. We have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Hole in the Wall”
Reviews.Author: Dale M
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome place to stay - if you can find it! Located along Wabash between Madison and Monroe the doorway is easy to miss when walking down the sidewalk and the 'walkway' to the elevator is not impressive, but when the elevator door opens on the second floor your eyes will 'bug out' at the sight of the expansive lobby complete with complimentary fruit water and grand piano. The rooms are all redone with beautiful oak accents, comfy beds, unusual window treatments and bathrooms you'd be proud to take home! The location is great for theatres, dining and only a few blocks from the train stations and Millenium / Grant parks. We spent the weekend without taking a cab!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: annnbear
Reviews.Content: Pretty much a perfect stay. Minor mistakes were handled great. Excellent customer service. Although the staff was unusually swamped, a warm smile and a "thank you" made a difference. I had no issues with the train, although I could see how a light slepper would. Also, I am not a TV watcher, but the non-flat screen and limited cable channels might be an issue for some...I will stay again, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “As far away from the L track as possible... please :)”
Reviews.Author: bobdigi33
Reviews.Content: Solid value play in Chicago. Room spacious and clean. Property and rooms in general may be a hair dated but not bad, seems well kept. Overall happy with my stay... With one exception. When you check in, tell them you want your room as far away from the L track/platform as possible. Of a presumable hundred or two rooms, I may have had the worst room in the building. I could have extended a stepladder from my room and walked onto the train platform. Noise and vibration every few minutes during most of the day.. Awesome. So not cool that I made it like a personal challenge to deal with it without complaining and/or requesting a room change. That's weird, I know.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Charming!”
Reviews.Author: indybug
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. Upon arrival the staff called up to our room, to ensure our needs were being met. It was the perfect location in the city. We were able to walk anywhere we needed to be. Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Affordable Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MemoryMaker2011
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith Hotel is in a hard to find location of the Loop that I would not have come across on my own in the Jewelers District on Wabash Street. However, Hotels.com had a great deal that convinced me to give it a try. I am very satisfied with my stay in a standalone king room. The accommodations were clean, nice and simple. The room had a small but adequate television, refrigerator and safe. I had a good rest on a higher floor. The staff was very accommodating. The complementary fruit infused water, hard candies and USA Today newspaper in the lobby were nice touches. The lobby also had a piano and fireplace, but they were not in operation on the 2 days of my overnight stay. The location is fantastic - near the L train, Millennium Park, The Art Institute, State Street and the Theater District, with many good restaurants and stores within a short walking distance. Bring a camera and go on a sight seeing walk around the Bean sculpture (officially named Cloud Gate). Dine out at a nice restaurant like Petterino's. See a Broadway in Chicago show like South Pacific. Watch the local television news from the street level studios at CBS or ABC. I did it all, and this is Chicago at its best! I recommend this hotel to people who don't need and want to pay for an expensive Michigan Avenue address with their lodging in downtown Chicago. You will like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Silversmith ... historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda36508
Reviews.Content: I had never even heard of this Chicago hotel until a family member booked it for a weekend get-together. I would ... and probably had walked by it many times. The price was very reasonable so I was unsure what we would find. The staff was so friendly and helpful from the moment we entered the property. They really made you feel like they were just delighted to see and help you.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel for architecture buffs”
Reviews.Author: TacoD
Reviews.Content: The Burnham firm designed this building at the end of the 19th Century. It has been beautifully restored to its present use and is on the National Historic Register. The staff has been especially courteous to us on our three visits. On the 7th floor the El noise was minor and has not bothered us at all. An advantage is a fine view of several late 19th or early 20th century facades across Wabash avenue including the oldest Adler and Sullivan building still standing in the Loop. The Orange Line El from Midway lets you off at the front door and a multitude of Chicago landmarks are within walking distance. .

Reviews.Title: “Clean and a great location”
Reviews.Author: barbarino2000
Reviews.Content: My room was so clean, and the rooms are a nice size. Good location right by the El, in the Loop, and walking distance to the park/lake. I don't know if it is ideal for families, but for someone going solo or in town for business: thumb's up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean, comfortable, good stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: margozinha1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Silversmith three times now for work and have found it to be a good deal for the price. It is very nicely located (2 blocks from Mich Ave & Milennium Park), clean and spacious. The bathrooms in particular are quite large and towels and beds are fluffy. The hotel staff are amenable, friendly and efficient. The only downsides are it is close to the L (you can hear the trains rattling by...not a good place for the light sleeper), there is no mini-bar in the rooms, complementary toiletries are flimsy, and the rooms are a tad dark. Otherwise, I have always had a clean and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “gem-ish”
Reviews.Author: LordKelvin
Reviews.Content: I booked the Silversmith frankly because there were no other options. However, I found the place intriguing. Far from luxurious but rather well-located and with a sense of purpose and history. The National Register Building is quite beautiful, so do take a few moments to appreciate the facade. Our room did not face the L so in that regard we were fortunate. Yes I would stay here again and I would not let the location scare you in the least. My colleagues spent twice as much around the corner at the Palmer House and from what I can see all they got for that was a shmancy-er lobby. Spend some time in the Silversmith Lobby and enjoy quiet and architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling gem in the Loop!”
Reviews.Author: Alan E
Reviews.Content: For location, value, quality and friendliness, I cannot recommend the Silversmith Hotel highly enough! Typically, I stay at a chain hotel, but an attractive promotional rate got me to stay at the Silversmith. What a great find in Chicago's Loop!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: iac0n
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith is in a really good location, just off state street and a short walk to millenium park and shopping on michigan ave. That being said, I was a bit disappointed with this place. When a hotel self rates at 4 stars I do expect a more modern hotel and a shower that drains when being used. The first impression I got when I walk in was very good. Friendly staff and a quick check-in. The room was very large and clean. I liked the bed and found it to be a very quite place to stay, I could hear the L going past but not a big deal. The shower head is awful, very little water comes out no matter the setting and the water sits in the bottom of the tub for over an hour after being used. Also, no mini-bar! This was the only major issue here, over all it was a good stay but not 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “A previously overlooked gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tennisgirl54
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were greeted, welcomed cheerfully, and helped efficiently! Upon check in, I learned that we had been upgraded from a Standard King room to a lovely suite. I mentioned that it was such a nice surprise since we were celebrating my birthday, and less than an hour later, Ezelier (I think that is his name), one of the bellhops who had greeted us and helped me get luggage to our room, brought a large slice of German chocolate cake up to our room! Later, he helped us get a taxi and, for the remainder of our stay, was attentive and thoughtful. But, everyone who we encountered went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. It was a great value ($106 without tax), a great location, and definitely a hotel where I would stay in the future. My only complaint was the "fitness room"--2 treadmills, and a small weight area, very dinky and unsatisfying. Wish there was a hot tub too :), but you can't have everything! Really enjoyed our stay at the Silversmith!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TijuanaJuan
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith had very large well taken care of rooms with high ceilings and nice furniture. The hotel is in a great location just a block away from Millennium Park. All the staff was very friendly and we got a great idea for dinner from the doorman. The Silversmith will be on the top of my list to check into if I return with Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super staff”
Reviews.Author: treveller2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and clean and in a great location. All the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Excellent overall value - we will stay again. Free WiFi was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Loop!”
Reviews.Author: francis54
Reviews.Content: Shared Thanksgiving weekend with family at The Silversmith! Helpful staff, top-quality rooms and convenient to the L. Safe and a great base for shopping, exploring architecture - and if you're a foody!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: GreatEngineer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silversmith for 3 days in January 2012. The room had oak mission furniture and the hallways had a similar style. The room was clean and comfortable. The downtown elevated train loop runs right in front of the hotel. I would strongly recommend that you ask for a court yard side facing room. The staff was professional and helpful. The hotel did have a restaurant and bar. Neither was fantastic but were not bad either. With many great restaurants in a very short walking distance, you have many options. The Art Institute for Chicago was a stones throw away. Only suggestion is to replace old TVs with HD flat screens. I will have this hotel on my list when I visit Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “A great value on a very nice hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: ymibhdu
Reviews.Content: Bought my wife theater tickets for Christmas, so I needed to find a hotel for the evening. We make it to Chicago once a year or so, but we haven't stayed overnight in a while. After some internet searching, I found the Silversmith hotel. Was only three blocks from the Chicago Theater. One plus. The Arts and Crafts style of the decor is something my wife and I like. Second plus. They were running a special, adn it was cheaper than just about any other place I could find on the timeframe I had. Third plus. Took the Metra in from Waukegan, so we ended up taking a cab from Ogilvie Station. The cab ride was $10 with tip from the station. We thought about driving into Chicago and parking at the Millennium Park garage as it was much cheaper than the valet at the hotel, but we decided the train/taxi would add to the experience. We were greeted by a doorman when we arrived at the hotel, and he directed us to the elevators to access the second floor lobby. At check in, I requested a room away from the El tracks, and we were given a king size room on the opposite side of the hotel. Perfect. We only heard the trains when we were trying to. The room was spacious, much larger than we had experienced in previous stays in older Chicago hotels. The bathroom was large, and the bed was comfortable. The window view was of the backs of other buildings, but we were prepared for that. IN all honesty, the Arts and Crafts theme of the room was largely stuck on accents and furnishings, but the room was clean and well kept. There is a 7/11 right around the corner, a Dunkin Donuts across the street, and Garrett's Popcorn is a block away. Just fine for low rolling tourists like ourselves. Just a block off of State Street, and a couple blocks from Macy's. Check out was smooth, except after I turned in my key, I could not take the elevator back up to our room to help my wife with the bags. The elevator access is controlled by your room key. Would gladly recommend The Silversmith to friends and family, We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Uskottumies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silversmith in June 2011 for 12 days, so this review is a bit overdue. The location was convenient (at the corner of Madison and Wabash), the El stop right in front of the hotel. The windows were properly insulated, as the noise from the trains was very muffled. You could hear a faint noise from the passing trains, but it didn't bother us at all. Our room was on the 8th floor. The room was spacious and comfortable, a 1-bedroom suite. The bedroom and the living room werenâ€™t completely separated. The bathroom was very spacious, probably the largest I have seen in a hotel room. There was a refrigerator and a microwave in the living room, and they were handy. The location was good, State Street shopping (Macyâ€™s etc.) was just one block away, Millennium Park was a block away and the El stop was practically in front of the hotel. Millennium Park was very pleasant for walking, plenty of people, gorgeous architecture and warm weather. Thereâ€™s plenty of restaurants near the hotel. The lobby was large, and the hotel (lobby, hallways, rooms) were tastefully decorated, in a sort of an old-fashioned way (for example metal fixtures on the doors). Wi-fi worked properly. The staff members were polite, and everything went smoothly. During our stay we had only one minor problem, it was with bathroom, but the problem was fixed within five minutes after we informed the front desk. Overall, we were very pleased with the Silversmith, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They are not honest”
Reviews.Author: Cedric E
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Silversmith on Dec 17 of 2011. I booked it through a third party travel agent. Parking in Chicago is a really big hassle. When I booked the room, I asked the third party agent is parking included in the room numerous times. They assured me that parking was included. I even called the Silversmith personally. I asked them is parking included with my room. They said yes, complimentary parking. When I get to Chicago, the story changes. Parking is not complimentary, I would have to pay $47.00 for valet parking. That was unacceptable to me considering I asked, and asked, and asked about the parking. I asked to cancel my room, they told me I couldn't because it was after 6:00pm. The Silversmith really ruined my whole vacation. I had to drive all over Chicago like a lost soul looking for a reasonable room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in great location with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TXcatlover
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this hotel especially for the price and location. The room was well appointed with a large spacious bathroom including plush robes. Beds were comfortable. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to request a higher floor due to the El being just outside, but it didn't bother us. The front desk staff was extra helpful with directions and any other questions we had. I am amazed at the value for the price. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at a great location for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Kate C
Reviews.Content: I was in Chigago for a couple of days and needed a hotel that was in a central location. The location of this hotel can't be beat, it's right in the loop and only a block away from shopping on State Street and all of the museums/Millennium park on Michigan Ave. My room was very large and clean, with a soft bed, free Wifi, and clean bathroom. My room was quiet, and I got a great night's sleep while I was there, although my room was at the back of the hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would recommend this place to anyone, and will stay there again when I come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: Gdubya2000
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed overnight at the Silversmith for business and was blown away by the value. The King Executive room was spacious and clean, the bed was comfortable, the craftsman style furnishings were nice, and the staff was exceptionally helpful. You could pay two or three times as much to stay down the block at the Palmer House and still wouldn't get a better experience. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel as welcoming as it is beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: HoppyGirl
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. A landmark Burnham building with all the fine Arts and Crafts movement details. But it is the staff that makes this place so special. Very friendly and accommodating. Yes, there is noise from the L. But that is a given anywhere in the Loop where the sound bounces off the tall buildings. Earplugs work fine for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Silversmith Hotel in Chicago is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gypsymari
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after I had a recommendation by another Tripadvisor member. I just was able to spend 1 night, December 9, 2011. The staff members were all nice and helpful. The entire hotel is clean & comfortable. I was informed that the owners will be revamping the hotel next year, so it will be even nicer; I am hoping not much more expensive. I was fortunate to be able to get a AAA rate of $89. That was an excellent value. The hotel is 2 short blocks from Millenium Park and close to public transportation. Next time I return to Chicago, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a homerun.”
Reviews.Author: Robert J
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Silversmith this weekend. We were very pleased with the room and the property itself. It was a great value, and if it wasn"t December in Chicago, we woould have taken more advantage of it't great location. Staff was mostly very helpful. The room was spare but comfortable, very large, high ceilings and great bathroom. We were thankful the room was in the back of the building, becauuse the El runs on Wabash. The only complaint about the room was the pillows, which seemd to have been scrounged off a sofa. Small, hard and square. Not at all what I wouold have expected. The only other issue was the valet parking fee quoted by Hoetels.com was 50% less than the actual charge by the hotel. Explanations were not satisfactory for the discrepancy. All said however, I would go back and take my own pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, old and tired facility”
Reviews.Author: LukeOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Just one block from Millennium Park. I booked the Executive King Suite, top floor, supposedly the best accommodation. Room was very spacious, free wi-fi, with a sitting area, yet didn't feel like a four star accommodation. Room was scarcely illuminated and rather old. The whole building, the forniture, the carpeting are all quite old, and not perfectly kept. Also cleaniness was unperfect, as you could easily spot dust in the corners.

Reviews.Title: “All about the details”
Reviews.Author: Maximumca
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Silversmith for 6 nights. Check in was uneventful.......arrived early and had to wait until 3pm to get room, but considering it was a convention week this wasn't a surprise. Room was very spacious with lots of closet space, sitting area with TV, small bar sink, microwave and bar fridge and single serving coffee maker. Electrical outlet for the coffeemaker didn't work so I had to move it to the desk. I asked for a repair on day 1 and fixed on day 5. Although the room came with a microwave, there was nothing supplied that could be used to heat food. The paper coffee cups clearly stated non-microwaveable. A couple dishes and some utensils would have been a welcomed addition. Bathroom was well equipped. Tub drained very slowly. I used the fitness facilities the first day to find that the TV was "out of service". Facilities included universal weights, stairmaster, eliptical and treadmill, with no free weights. Felt a bit crowded. Wi-Fi was available and free, however, every time I turned the computer off, or was inactive for a short period I had to log back in. This became tedious after the first few times. At $275 a night, this hotel has great potential if they can pay more attention to the details. The little things make the difference between an average and excellent place to stay. Staff were very warm and welcoming throughout the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in a really great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer V
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011. We really enjoyed the hotel. The room was very large, the bathroom was huge. It is in a great location. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Even thought we didn't stay in The Silversmith Hotel, we had a very positive experience.”
Reviews.Author: Shibafu
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay in this hotel. However I had an experience that is worth to share. A couple of weeks ago I travelled to Chicago with my husband for the week-end. We chose to spend the night in The Silversmith Hotel. We booked our room via hotels.com a few weeks prior to our visit. When we got there, they told us that the hotel was overbooked so that they would place us to another hotel, a few blocks away. They paid our taxi trip to this other hotel which was a very nice hotel as well. We didn't pay for that stay, and Silversmith gave our money back. In conclusion, we spend a free night in Chicago! Even thought we didn't stay in The Silversmith Hotel, we had a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: hidrocarbin
Reviews.Content: Took a little break after Thanksgiving to enjoy "Black Friday" and stayed at the Silversmith based on its website and online reviews. We live in the Chicago Area and didn't have to deal with a car so parking wasn't an issue. Was worried about noise, but stayed on the 7th floor on the Wabash side and the room and bed were so comfy that I didn't notice the noise of the "EL" at all. Really. Beautiful lobby and tastefully decorated through out. Staff couldn't have been more friendly. Quick walk to Millennium Park, shopping, Cultural Center and more. The Silversmith is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: pedro4440444
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in October 2011. As suggested by reviews here, I asked for and got a room away from the Wabash Avenue (el) side; it was not noisy. Room very spacious and well appointed, the price was well below what the conference hotel was offering, and the location was convenient -- I walked to the conference (Swissotel), the Opera, and the Aquarium (a bit longer walk), Used the lobby for Internet access the final afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel cancels reservations at the last minute!”
Reviews.Author: Dana H
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting in downtown Chicago at 8:30 a.m. on Nov. 16, 2011, so I booked a room at the Silversmith, two blocks away, through hotels.com on Oct. 12. My credit card was immediately charged, and I received a confirmation number. I received another confirmation email four days before the arrival date assuring me that all was well. On the appointed day, I traveled to Chicago by train. An hour before arrival, at about 6 p.m., I received an email telling me to call hotels.com. I did and was told that my reservation had been canceled because the hotel had overbooked. I then called the hotel, talked to the manager and was told that a group had overstayed their booking, so the hotel had canceled some incoming reservations. She said they would try to find a room for me somewhere else but were not having any luck doing so for other canceled reservations. I never heard back from them. I then called hotels.com several times over the next hour, and they said the best they could do was put me up in a hotel in a suburb 30 MILES AWAY! This was at 7 p.m., and I was arriving at Union Station downtown. I told them that was unacceptable -- I didn't have a car, was unfamiliar with public transportation and a cab ride would cost $50 or more each way and take well more than an hour in rush hour traffic the next morning. They said that after an hour of calling around, that's the best they could do. I told them to cancel my reservation and reimburse my credit card, which they did. I then intruded on someone 10 miles away and slept on their floor. Even then, the cab rides were $25 each way, and I arrived at my meeting the next morning exhausted and upset. I have booked hundreds of rooms over the years and have never been subjected to this kind of treatment. How can they not honor a booked, paid-for and confirmed reservation and then tell me I would have to travel 30 miles on my own for another room? Obviously, I will never book again with the Silversmith or hotels.com, and I want to warn other potential guests that a reservation with them apparently means nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with good services”
Reviews.Author: lelou18
Reviews.Content: The location of the SIlversmith is wonderful so close of all the nice places. Easy to grab a bite or eat in fancy in any close area. walking distance from many attractions. Most staff are friendly however, one thing that I though is a drawback is thatthey do not have in room dining after 9:00 or 10:00 pm also on Sunday even shorter time. They have a nice restaurant Ada's. Friendly Jamie made the stay and breakfast a good experience. Its proximity from the metro station is not as drastic as I thought if we ask for a room that is away from the street, the npise is minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and hotel in the loop”
Reviews.Author: GWV1
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith is an awesome historic boutique hotel within feet of great shopping, restaurants and local attractions. My wife and I spent 4 nights there vacationing and were amazed at the quality and value of The Silversmith. The building and furnishings are very nice but the staff makes it great. We reserved a standard queen room and were pleasantly surprised when we got to our room and found it was a 2-room suite! As other reviewers have said - it does face the train but the soundproofing was incredible. It sounded like a rush of wind periodically and never kept us awake. The room was comparitively huge; A separate living room with small sofa, a mini-fridge, table and desk in the bedroom, two televisions, granite countertop in the bath, etc..... LOVED IT! The lobby is beautiful and serene and the glass dispenser filled with chilled, citrus-infused water is a great added touch. (Yes, I actually got out of bed and came downstairs JUST to get a refill a couple of times - and I'm lazy!) But what made the stay even more special was was the staff; They were all professional, courteous and genuinely personable. In particular, the bartender (Milan or Mila?) was great. He mixes a mean beverage and is a great conversationalist. But above all, Peggy - the Concierge - is FANTASTIC! She knows where everything is, how to get there, and can tell you what to look for and, just as important, what to avoid. Peggy helped us with everything; transportation, sightseeing, finding the best locals' (non-corporate) restaurants and even getting our boarding passes printed for our flight home. She gladly helped us navigate our way through our stay with a cheerfulness and expertise which are a credit to The Silversmith. The hotel on its' own was great, but the people made out stay outstanding. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: Hodoiporos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and very well located, though the CTA station just in front of it does make some noise. But I slept facing the station and didnÂ´t find the noise too annoying. In fact, it was quite tolerable and did not interfere with my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JackieSC
Reviews.Content: Our room was very large, with a separate "living room" area and spacious bathroom. The location of the hotel, just steps from an el station, was very convenient, but our room on the third floor literally looked out right on the tracks. Still the train noise was not TOO loud. I slept through it relatively easily; my husband was more bothered by the noise than I. Also, since it is an older hotel, the bathroom pipes made clunking noises any time anyone in the hotel adjusted their water or flushed their toilets. I'm guessing that a room on a higher floor and away from the Wabash Avenue side would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of a hotel--great location”
Reviews.Author: adharman12
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location for business and culture. Great value. Very clean rooms, spacious for a city, and all in all I'm happy to have found this place and will definitely stay there for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Khidhala
Reviews.Content: Our family spent a night here on our way through Chicago. The hotel is wonderfully located just a block away from Millenium Park and right in front of an El station. I'd read reviews that said the El was loud when it passed, but our room was on the far side of the building from the tracks and we never heard the trains pass. The entrance did have a slightly funky aroma, like someone had not bathed in a while, but after passing the inner doors everything was clean and delightful. The staff were helpful in clearing up a billing mistake (I have a common name, and someone else with my name had booked a room that night as well). We found a great price at their website- better than anything quoted from the services, so check their own page for rates as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, good value and location”
Reviews.Author: dbuzzy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent some time in Chicago eating, drinking and getting away from our "normal lives" for a few days. It was a bit tough to find this place because of the one way streets, so after missing it once and going around the block, I made sure not to make the same mistake twice. After getting the car valet parked for a smooth $46/day, we took the elevator up to the second floor for check-in. Check-in was a breeze and the people were very nice. The room was clean, and although there was virtually no view from our room, the experience was quite good. The location was solid, but it seemed as though it was a bit of a walk to most of the major shopping, attractions and the restaurants which we visited. This isn't the exact area you may want to stay if you're looking for some nightlife with a short walk back to your hotel. I would book here again, but would definitely need to consider what we were looking for in our experience before pulling the trigger.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: NorthEndBos
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of friends for a long weekend in September. The location is great. Near the L and one block from Millennium Park and all the shopping up Michigan Avenue. Coffee shops and restaurants all within walking distance. Somehow ended up with a one bedroom suite. Full living room with separate bedroom and huge bathroom. Rooms were very clean. Furniture could be updated but functional and clean. Hotel staff very polite and helpful. You can't beat the price. I'd stay here again. Take the blue line subway from direct from O'Hare and get dropped off two blocks away for $2.50 (better than sitting in traffic in a cab and paying $40).

Reviews.Title: “Charming Building, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike_8530
Reviews.Content: Having booked a queen room through Expedia, I was upgraded on arrival to a King bed suite, including large bathroom with separate tub & shower. This was a nice, unexpected touch. There's no question that you can hear the L trains as they rumble along Wabash, but from the seventh floor it was a periodic dull hum that, as an urban apartment dweller, did not bother me. My guess is this would be more significant on the lower floors, especially for light sleepers. The L runs until about 2am, so it won't be a problem for the night owls either way. The mattress was great, and the furniture in general was fine all around. The TVs (there were two) in the room are indeed older tubes & not LCDs, but who'll be wasting their trip watching them anyway? The clock radio was nicer than usual, with two alarms and a CD player built-in. Room overall was quite clean, a couple of notches below 'sparkling'. This didn't bother me, but the guest who wants to see their reflection in the toilet bowl might take issue. For some reason the rubber latch on the shower door appeared to have been broken for some time. Draping a towel over the door kept most of the water from splashing out, but why it was in this condition I can't imagine, as the part couldn't have cost more than $4. I had intended to mention this on departure but forgot. Staying at a hotel on the east side of the Loop, one block from Michigan Av, you're ideally located in a safe area that's an easy walk to many sites of interest, and situated amidst many of the buildings Chicago is known for. Transit access couldn't be much better, and there are plenty of places to eat during the daytime. It's true that the Loop district does somewhat empty out after the close of the business day, but I never felt unsafe walking around in the wee hours. Late night dining options are relatively few in the immediate vicinity though. For the price I paid, I'd stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspired but quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mdefilip2010
Reviews.Content: Spent couple nights while on business. Upgraded to suite, but nothing worth writing home about - extra space was nice I suppose. Location is great - block off Michigan and near millennium park right at Wabash/Madison station. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and well maintained. The rooms and decor were very uninspired. Room had very little natural light and internal lighting was too soft and incandescent. With high ceilings and fully lit still seemed a little like a funeral home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for couples - convenient when flying in to midway”
Reviews.Author: allisonb11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Silversmith for the Chicago Gourmet Festival. It is very convenient to get too from midway and really close to millennium park. Overall the hotel is clean and the daytime employees are very nice. The nighttime desk help is not as friendly. We really enjoyed the proximity to pretty much everything and we liked how close it is to the L train. The orange line will take you right from midway to this hotel. Ask for floor 7-8 because of the L train. We could vaguely hear it and didn't have any problems on the 7th floor. It sounded like the AC coming on. Families - this would not be convenient for toddlers and parents with strollers. In fact, I didn't see any parents with strollers while enjoying the loop. This was our first trip without the little ones and we will wait until they are older to take them to downtown Chicago. I am sure there are a lot of family things to do, but this area is not one of them. The restaurant in the hotel is good for breakfast. The free computer/internet was nice. We were able to look up various restaurants for dinner. Would definitely stay at this hotel again when in with the hubby. Will wait a few years for Chicago with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: SmileyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Silversmith Hotel in chicago on a romantic get away with my boyfriend and to also meet up with old friends. This hotel is close to everything. The train is practically attached to the hotel. Millenium Park is just a coulpe of steps away. I loved it. If you need a midnight snack there is a 7 11 next to the hotel also. The hotel was very comfortable and you felt safe. To get to the floors in the hotel you had to use your room card key; I reall felt safe about that.. The room was very comfortable and we could ajust the temperature to our liking. Great plus for a Chicago Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Boogiegirl18
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find! Compared to the price of most hotels in the area, it was a great deal. Since it was less expensive, I was nervous about booking because in my experience you typically get what you pay for with hotels. However, this place exceeded my expectations. Upon arriving, the room I requested was booked, so they gave me a complimentary upgrade to a suite. The room as clean, spacious, and quiet. It was a great location for sightseeing and shopping was very close. Safe neighborhood and public transportation right outside the hotel. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit! (The only reason I didn't give it a "5" is because this hotel is not super luxury. However, it is above budget and a great value.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Historic Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JQ16888
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith hotel is centrally located in downtown Chicago. It is a historic building at least 100-year old. All rooms are huge and have high ceilings. Every room is different. The hotel is clean; staff are friendly. The equipment in the fitness room need upgrade. It is noisy if your room is one Wabash Ave. side because of the elevated CTA trains. Otherwise, it is an excellent hotel close to all Chicago attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: belisaH
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel located in the loop steps from the el-train and a few blocks from Millenium Park and Michigan Ave. The hotel is located in an old building and the decor reflects this-oak, oak everywhere and our suite on the 8th floor was a bit dark and dim. Accommodations are comfortable, however, and the staff is helpful and friendly. There is a great restaurant located in the lobby, Ada's, and the food is great. Free internet access was also much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the Loop!”
Reviews.Author: nanwie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel right in the heart of the Loop and just 2 blocks from Millennium Park. We had a king executive suite on the 8th floor ... got a great rate from hotels.com, but I think we would have probably had the same from the hotel res directly. Very clean!!! Front desk extremely helpful and congenial. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great locaion”
Reviews.Author: bigcanuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silversmith during the first week of September 2011. I selected it based on price and the proximity to the office I was working out of. While it was about a 10 minute walk to the office, I preferred this location as it was closer to North Michigan Ave for walking/shopping. The room (queen standard) was nice - clean and big enough for myself. The view was non-existent but that's okay as I didn't spend much time in the room staring out the window anyway. The building is an old heritage building and is reflected in the lobby styling. The staff I encountered were all pleasant and helpful. The complimentary high-speed and wi-fi was also nice when I'm used to being charged $10+ for access. Even though it's not a flashy touristy hotel, I would still recommend this hotel for any traveller who does not plan on spending a lot of time in their room. There was also a complimentary desktop/printer available for printing a boarding pass if required.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Staff Ever! I had an emergency situation in Chicago and the staff was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Chicago for Labour Day weekend. Everything was going great until I had my entire purse stolen in a restaurant! (Ladies, watch your purses). The Silversmith Hotel staff were excellent to me in my crisis situation. They were very understanding. Besides that, the hotel itself is charming and comfortable. I would recommend it to everybody!! Thank you very much Silversmith Staff for all your help!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Canada1631
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to the reviews on tripadvisor and because we got a great rate on hotels.com. The location was fabulous. The EL was super close, but you could also walk to many attractions (mag mile, sears tower, millenium park, river cruises). Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby too. The hotel itself is nothing special. We did have a nice two room suite. The bathroom is very large. However, the TVs need to be updated (also have annoying habit of going to the same 'hotel' station whenever you turn the tv on). The airconditioning is extremely loud. Although this hotel is right next to the EL, the noise was not an issue at all (or maybe we just couldn't hear it over the crazy loud A/C). There is a free in-room safe which is handy and a fridge in the room (be wary of brining in your own alcohol as they will charge a corkage fee - ridiculous). The free computer in the lobby is nice, but it is SUPER slow. The staff are not overly friendly or helpful. We saw the same dirty tray of room service left in the hallway for 2 days! The room keys are a huge pain as they keep getting demagnified. The clerks said if you keep your keys near credit cards or cell phones, they become demagnified and have to be reprogrammed. Even though we kept ours in a separate pocket, they had to be reprogrammed almost every day (over 5 days). Annoying. You have to use your card in the elevator, which at first I assumed was a security measure (meaning, unless you were staying at that hotel, you could not access floors with rooms), but it turns out you can access any floor from the stairwell, so not really a good security measure, plus a real pain when your keys don't work. Since this hotel is near the EL you can just take the EL to get to/from the airport which is handy (45 minute ride). We arrived early and our room was not ready, but they put our luggage in storage, so we could go explore the city until the room was ready, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Oh I dont think so!!!!”
Reviews.Author: msluv2travel23
Reviews.Content: Moved my daughter back to school this weekend and stayed here based on the wonderful reviews. This is one DRAB hotel. They stuck my daughter and I in a corner room on the third floor( magnificent view of the El and a pidgeon's butt) you practically had to maneuver around the furniture. Trash was on the floor the bed was not comfy, really thin blanket on the bed and no extra in the closet we were freezing even tho I turned off the thermostat it kept coming on!! The parking is a total rip=off 46.00 for valet with in and out privileges but if you self park it's 36.00 with no in and out priviledge...Grrr... At least at the Palmer House you can self park with in and out. The bathroom was cool Too bad I could'nt sleep in there. Oh yeah and the room is SO drab the decor is depressing all gray and brown to go with the Cheeeep brown furniture the gray smog on the windows and the el train (lovely) I like going away and no I am not a total snob when it comes to hotels but if an establishment is rating themselves 4 star it should be 4 star! I give this a 2 star and ! am really stretching it. Stayed here for a night and we could not wait to leave!! I stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Rosemont on my last day to be close to the airport and I can definitely say without hesitation this is a nice hotel nice staff comfy bed My tip: There are plenty of nicer hotels in this area stay at one of those... Palmer House, Hotel Monaco..i am sure there are others

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: thatdingo
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, with a large bathroom. Comfortable bed, all was very clean. The hallways are wide and inviting, although the elevators are somewhat small. There are three of them, however, if one gets too full. Many have mentioned the noise from the L, which runs right outside the hotel. We could hear it from our ninth-floor room on the back side, but it was not too disturbing. Located very close to the Art Institute and Millennium Park, where there are frequent free music events at noon and in the evenings. There are a few interesting restaurants nearby, but most are popular chains (Starbucks, Panda Express, Subway, etc.). Plenty of shopping within walking distance. No major problems with the service. Our towels were replaced every day even though we hung them up to reuse. One day our coffee was not replenished, which was disappointing. Also, the coffee maker in our room was one of the single-cup types, which is probably not best for a double-occupancy room. There are of course several Starbucks nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems with room”
Reviews.Author: Pholman25
Reviews.Content: Key rarely worked, toilet broke, iron broke. Too many hotels in area to get a bad review

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel”
Reviews.Author: chef0308
Reviews.Content: Went up for a baseball game and stayed here for the first time. Great historic hotel in a convienient location. Although a little close to the L.

Reviews.Title: “They have a "no bicycle in your room" policy”
Reviews.Author: SwimGal40
Reviews.Content: I am a local Chicago suburban resident that decided to stay at the Silversmith due to my participation in the Chicago Triathlon on August 28th. The race course opens up at 4:15 am and it is easier to stay as close as possible to the race so I can get my gear situated and I donâ€™t have to leave my suburban home at 2:30 am and be exhausted before the race even begins. I should also mention that I have stayed at this hotel with my bike before and I have never had an issue. So as I was checking in the young man at the front desk said I could not take my bike to my room and would need to store it with the bellman as it could be a fire hazard. The good thing was there were other triathletes also waiting to check in with the same bike issue so having others to back me was essential. Can you imagine having dozens of people (or more) at 4:00 am trying to get their bikes out of the storage area? Plus we all need to gear up our bikes with water bottles, food, pump up the tires etc, should that be taking place in a crowded lobby? Besides, I would need to leave my bike unattended to run back to the room to put my pump back, who in their right mind would do that? Road bikes are not cheap! So the concierge saw that there was a small group of us having an issue and stepped in. She basically made it happen but the young man at the front desk basically said I would not be welcome back again. I will look for other options in the future. I know for a fact that the Hilton will let you take your bike without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: acemartino
Reviews.Content: I really didn't know what to expect but this place was Awesome! Everyone that worked at the hotel was super nice and very accommodating. Our room was big and real clean. I would definitely stay here again. If your looking for a great and reasonably priced hotel with out he unneeded glitz, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable, great value!”
Reviews.Author: lpoel
Reviews.Content: I liked the reviews I read about this hotel so I booked my room through the hotel's website as it was actually the best rate I found online. With my CAA/AAA discount a suite was the same price as a regular King so we had a very spacious room, with a nice sitting area. This hotel is very close to Grant/Milennium Park, Chicago Board of Trade and easy access to transit. We enjoyed that most other travellers we met in the lobby/elevator were from around the world. We saved about $15 by parking overnight at Grant Park instead of the hotel valet. The train was just outside our window but neither my husband or I were bothered by it at night.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Luciedog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night to be close to a family event. Great location, clean, really comfortable bed, large room with little living room area. We didn't use the TVs but they do need to upgrade them. Staff was pleasant if not overly enthusiastic. Gym was adequate, although if I'd gone in during early morning hours it probably wouldn't have been, with only 2 treadmills & a handful of other machines. For a first-time visit to Chicago this hotel would be great, since it's walking distance to what you want to see and the price, at least on http://hotels.com, was very good. And it's walking distance, without having to change trains, to the Blue Line to O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Bags-R-Packed-MN
Reviews.Content: Good central location, beautiful large Craftsman style lobby/lounge, helpful staff. Despite close proximity of L, I didn't detect any noise and slept like a baby. Variety of nearby places to eat and easy walk to Michigan Avenue and the Magnificent Mile, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, theaters.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of room...for little money”
Reviews.Author: Wonderkitty
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I'm incredibly impressed by how spacious our room was! We had a room with 2 double beds. The height of the ceiling really made it feel grand. The bathroom was also surprisingly large, which is plus. Often in big cities you have to give up space if you want to save a little money, but this wasn't the case at the Silversmith! Some people are complaining about the noise from the train. I don't know where their rooms were, but from our room we barely noticed. Every now and then we'd hear what sounded like a gust of wind, but that was it. Actually, the sound was rather soothing. Other people have commented on the "outdated" furnishings. With an emphasis on solid wood and an earthy color palette, the design of the hotel recalls the Arts & Crafts Movement of the late 19th and early 20th century. This is very appropriate considering the building's history. If you're a history/design/architecture person like I am, you'll really appreciate it. Otherwise, I can see how some people might simply write-off the furnishings & fixtures as "outdated." There are many things I liked about this hotel. Our room had a nice closet so we were able to hide all of our bags & luggage away. I think it always makes a room look unnecessarily cluttered, so having a closet is great. The room was very clean. Each day we came back to our beds neatly made. The sheets and bedding are comfy, and there are plenty of pillows. The refrigerator came in handy for storing leftovers. Cold pizza in the middle of the night? Yes, please. The price and the location of the hotel can't be beat. The 'L' train is only a few steps from the door, and there are also several bus stops nearby. The hotel is within walking distance to Millennium Park, the Art Institute, and dozens of restaurants. If you like to eat late, there's a pub just down the street that serves food until 2 am. There's one minor thing I didn't necessarily "hate," so I'll be brief. When you walk in, you have to take the elevator up to the 2nd floor to get to the lobby & check-in desk. The doormen are nice though. The ground floor smells like garbage, not sure why. Don't worry, once you get up to the lobby, it doesn't stink anymore. Overall, I was more than satisfied with the Silversmith. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: RedScourge
Reviews.Content: We rented two king suites for the weekend of Lollapaloosa. The location was perfect and the staff were friendly and helpful. We paid circa $400/night per room. This is not unusual for Lolla weekend. There were a few downsides. First, the bed was a bit too soft for me. Tastes differ but I sank in and tangled with the sheets all night. Second, the pillows are sorta like napkin-wrapped cotton balls. I asked for an upgrade to the pillows and they sent up more of the same. There is a Filene's/TJ Maxx next door. I spent $20 to buy my own pillows. The rooms are clean but a bit dated and worn. Each room comes with a bath and a separate shower. The hotel is close to a a red-line metro stop. It is also right next to the El. However, the soundproofing was excellent. Our rooms faced Wabash a little above the level of the train and we could barely hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my daughter on a girls trip for a few days. We loved the hotel. From the moment we arrived everyone was very helpful. The bellman took our bags from the taxi and stored them for us until we could check (and promised my 6 year old to take care of her American Girl doll!) and promptly brought them back after we did check in. Our room was very quiet, clean and a good size for what we needed. The location of this hotel is amazing. We walked to Millennium Park about a dozen times in our 4 day stay to check out the bean or play in the fountains. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and it's steps away from transportation. The price was amazing for the location and we would without question stay here again! If I had any complaint, we would skip eating in the attached restaurant. We had breakfast there once and it took a really long time to get our food and then to get our check. We were anxious to start our day exploring and it just took too long, especially when the restaurant wasn't crowded. It was also a little pricey for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... however the fine print is just a little too small!”
Reviews.Author: MomofMoms
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean... however the "fine" print is just a little to small. The hotel charges $50/day for incidentals (no mention of this upon check-in... it is in the small print on the page that you sign - if the font is a size 5... I would be suprised). Also, the hotel is a little high on valet parking $46/day, but there is a great parking garage nearby that is about $20/day less. Hotel also does not allow you to bring in your own alcohol to your room, if you do, you will be accessed a $4 corkage fee per item... So, why is there a refrigerator in your room? Hotel is "green" which is nice, but I don't reuse my towels... housekeeping took the towels but did not leave any clean towels. We then had to ask for additional towels twice. Seriously, it is a towel! All in all a nice hotel and very clean - just some staffing issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: liswes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times and it has been a great experience both times. One was for work and one for pleasure: the location cannot be beat. Two blocks from Millennium Park; 3 blocks from the blue line train from O'Hare; and close to lots of other goodies. The rooms are nice, clean and the hotel is quiet. Scanning websites, this hotel always comes up with the most affordable rate. I will stay here for future visits...(and this is a "historical" landmark hotel with some history). The restaurant attached to the hotel is just fine (seems better for a breakfast or lunch).

Reviews.Title: “A Fair Price, A Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lumbar2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silversmith for 6 nights. Location was great for getting around Chicago on public transportation, employees were always helpful, the hotel and room were clean, bed was comfortable, room/suite was spacious and the price was fair. We would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Waddlerstrikesback
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, large and comfortable room and great value. Right at the Loop and within yards of Macy's and Sears...ideal. Free use of computer and printer. Large room with abundance of towels and great air conditioning. We had a room at the back which was away from the Loop and this may be advisable from a noise persprctive. Staff were excellent and helpful. Downside? The bar is a little removed from the reception which is located on the 1st floor and seems to close a little early. Breakfast is fine but we did not eat dinner here as it seems to be directed towards the casual 'snack' type diner. Loads of restaurants nearby and Michigan Ave. is around the corner. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Scoop on the Loop”
Reviews.Author: drdig
Reviews.Content: Right downtown in the heart of the loop. Idea location! Short walk to Millennium Park, Michigan Ave, and the museums. Also right next to a variety of public transportation. This is an excellent value for the location. It was very clean, rooms are spacious, desk help are very friendly though not all are well versed on Chicago tourist info - but they try very hard. Second time we have stayed here and will continue to do so in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Location Worth Price”
Reviews.Author: sunandsand_8
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a nice hotel in the heart of the loop and I found it. It's is a tiny place with a magical feeling. The price was a little high, but we were very happy with everything. I jus wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT FIND”
Reviews.Author: dudly2rite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice location if you want to stay south of the river.One block off Michigan Ave.,two blocks from the park and "the Bean".We had an interior room which was very quiet. The room was very clean and up to date with coffee pot,iron,safe,tv with all the features,etc.It doesn't occupy much street space on Wabash Ave, so it's easy to miss. El stops 1/2 block away.Lots of shopping if that's waht you like.Midweek rate was $158 total.Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good.”
Reviews.Author: IndyKM1
Reviews.Content: Our experience was good and met our needs for a one night stay in Chicago. We did not opt to park near the hotel. Parking rates in Chicago are crazy and we have a good spot. We parked and walked everywhere during our stay and the location was good. We walked to the Shedd Aquarium and Charter One Pavillion. It was also close enough to walk to good restaurants. Service was OK. Nothing stands out and nobody seemed too interested in us. This stands out to me as unimpressive while the hotel itself was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GolfJim
Reviews.Content: We checked in Friday and left Sunday. Everything was first class and I would highly recommend staying here. The Loop location was excellent and we were steps to Michigan Ave. All of the staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was extremely clean and quite large. There was a bureau for the TV - coffee pot - frig so it was an old TV and not a new wide body. The lobby was quite large and the free wi-fi and desk computer came in very handy. The concierge was one of the best I have ever met - funny, friendly, and quite helpful. She went out of her way to give me honest answers to my question. Check out was smooth and efficient. For the price, it was great. PS. Be cautious about Ada's deli on the ground floor. The food was excellent but the srevice was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for Chicago-first-timers!”
Reviews.Author: CKayE1215
Reviews.Content: I am so happy I chose the Silversmith for mine & my husband's first trip to Chicago. The location was perfect, in the loop & near lots of transportation, making it easy for us to explore the city. The hotel itself was extremely clean & very charming. The late nineteenth-century style Arts & Crafts interiors were very pretty and comfortable. Our room was very large, and the king bed was heaven. It was a nice quiet stay, which I really appreciate since my apartment building at home is extremely noisy. The Silversmith really helped to provide us with an excellent vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: RishuDeepak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the jeweler's street just a block away from Millennium Park and two blocks away from Union Street. There is a CTA station just next to the hotel. So, the hotel is at great location. There is a deli restaurant in the hotel which has great sandwiches. The hotel staff is very friendly. We really had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, convenient to EL, could be noisy.”
Reviews.Author: tampasteve
Reviews.Content: Summary: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. Our room was right above the metro/el station, which some people find to be noisy but we did not have a problem with it. The hotel is very convenient to transit, shopping, restaurants, etc. We got our room on Priceline so we got a good deal. The Hotel: The restaurant was kind of dead, but we did not eat there. The actual lobby is on the second floor, so you have to walk up stairs or use the elevator to get to it. One can tell the hotel has been around for a while, but everything is well kept and in good order. Rooms: Our room had a bathroom, sitting area with a table for 2 and a couch, and TV. The bedroom had a king size bed with a TV and two night stands. Overall it was comfortable, clean, and well kept. Some complain that the metro station next door is loud, but it does not run all night, and I did not have a problem with it, plus not all rooms face the metro. Location: Ideal for anywhere within the loop. The Adams/Wabash metro station is directly beside the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants close by, and shopping is about a block away. The location is probably one of the best parts about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and affordable for chicago!”
Reviews.Author: hambrrrglar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was 1.25 blocks from the Millenium park and the bean. Close to the metra and magnificent mile. Hotel staff was friendly and willing to help. Lobby was huge (the entire second floor). Room had the historic charm without being outdated. Bathroom was spacious and modern. Great hotel and location. Paid $110 which was fantastic for this time and Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you get an excellent price AND do not care about noise or expect helpful desk staff”
Reviews.Author: CraftsmanTraveler
Reviews.Content: The website shows remarkable images, but beware these are accurate images of the lobby, but not of the rooms. While the renovation of the rooms was good 15 years ago, they are dated and showing their age now. The desk staff seems uniformly uninterested in any special issues. You should know that the entrance is a narrow hallway on the street level, and the lobby is on the second floor. The L runs directly outside the front of the hotel, and the noise from the trains never, ever, stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago hub!”
Reviews.Author: JasmineRice
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Silversmith for a week traveling solo and it was a great jumping board for everything there is to see in Chicago. It's a few blocks walk from the Washington-Blue line (if you're taking the El train from the airport) and it's right in front of Madison station! Also super close to Millenium Park. My room was very clean and bathroom was humongous. Bed was really comfortable. I read previous reviews about train noise but I hardly heard the trains. I asked for a room away from the tracks though and was on the 9th floor. Staff was very courteous and friendly.Wi-Fi was fast! I got a great value for this hotel at hotels.ca. As a female solo traveller I felt completely safe! Patrons need a key card to get to their floor. TV is old-school but I didn't mind at all. There are too many things to do and see in Chicago to be spending your time watching TV!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great space but dated furnishings”
Reviews.Author: Oinkeater
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located only a few blocks from millennium park and many restaurants and shops. The room was clean, staff was friendly, furniture was very dated however, but overall an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Decent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mwbdc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group of friends while in Chicago for a wedding. Overall it was a pretty good experience given the price of the rooms. I think we received a really good deal on the rooms because it was December in Chicago- not exactly the height of tourist season. The Room: My friends and I stayed in 2 conjoining rooms right across from the elevator on one of the upper floors. There was no view out of our windows other than the building next door. I'm not sure if any of the rooms have a view at this hotel or not. The furnishings and overall vibe of the room was that it was quite old, but nice enough. The rooms were decently spacious and comfortable, but nothing special. The bathrooms especially felt very old. The Service/ Hotel Overall: There is a very nice lobby on the 2nd floor with computers, a piano, and lots of seating. This was convenient because we arrived early and our rooms weren't ready yet. The concierge and the other staff were all very friendly and helpful. The one thing that was "off" about the hotel was that the street-level interest consistently smelled very bad. The location: This was the BEST thing about the hotel other than the price. The hotel is about 2 blocks from Millennium Park with great museums and entertainment. Most attractions are walkable from the hotel. However, for the things that are not within walking distance, the hotel is located HALF a block from the El- Chicago's transit system. This was extremely convenient, especially because you can ride the El directly to both of Chicago's main airports! We saved a lot by not taking a cab! So, If you want a hotel that is not expensive and is in a very convenient location- stay at the Silversmith. If you are looking for luxury, look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location for Shopping and Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: ntz4bbl
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Silversmith over Memorial Day weekend. We had a roomy 1 bedroom suite. The king bed was very comfortable ~ can't vouch for the sofa bed. The bathroom was huge. It would have been nice to have had a door in the middle of the bathroom to separate the toilet from the shower sink. The only real down side to the room is that there is an open vent between the living room and bedroom. So, the sound carries right into the bedroom. I finally out that is why the living room tv was so loud in the bedroom the morning we were checking out. If I had figured it out sooner, I would have covered the vent (which is located at the bottom of the wall) with a couch cushion. The location of the Silversmith is outstanding! Lots of great shopping along State and Wabash. Also, just one block away from Millenium park and the fantastic museums.

Reviews.Title: “This was an Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ktiesman
Reviews.Content: We went for the holiday weekend and I was very happy with the hotel. Everyone was helpul and prime spot for going everyway in the city. Eat at Miller Pub and have a few beers (Craft Beers) or a bloody mary. Theres a pork chop in that glass!! Bartender Mike fits the scene. It was a very nice man. Rudys has awsome burgers rated #1 and there is Italian place right next door to Rudys looked good didn't eat there should have. Look on line for deals at the Silversmith it is well worth it. I looked at the reviews and people need to get over their own issues. We had a blast going back in a few months to do again. We had rainy weather so the only thing we did was go to Navy Pier , All the boat rides looked fun , dang rain. Everyway we went in the city beer was decent price mixed drinks over priced. Looking forward to our next trip to the city, we took metra downtown, walked and rode cabs now that a great weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nebufan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. Great location for parents with students at Columbia College. (about a 10 minutes walk down the street). Very close to the red line Monroe Street stop. If going to Navy Pier, #29 bus around the corner on Monroe Street drops you right off at the Pier! Service was great! We had a late flight out Sunday and the hotel bellhops kept our bags until 3pm after checking out at 9am. Would definitely stay agin. No hottub or pool, older TV's (no flat screens) but if you don't need all the bells and whistles it is a great place to stay! Looking to eat, Millers Pub down the street has excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel in the loop/chicago”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller boutique hotel in the loop/Chicago. Located on Jeweler's row next to the train tracks. Great location, near many great restaurants, the lake, museums etc. Easy to walk to many locations. Parking is $46/day plus tax so I took another traveler's advise and parked in the Millenium garage several blocks away as it was "only" $23/day. Not a bad walk really. The rooms were roomy and rather plain but served the purpose. It was built in 1897 and has historical information all over. Would highly recommend this hotel. Check in is on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in every regard”
Reviews.Author: mkelly43506
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful. Old world elegance and very well maintained. The staff is the best ever. The suite was huge. You could have had a party in the bathroom!! We were celebrating our 44th anniversary and they sent 2 complimentary tickets for breakfast to our room after we checked in. The concierge was great. She got us into a comedy club that was packed and tickets to a great musical and reservations for dinner at a 5 star restaurant. At each one, we were treated special because of the anniversary--special seating at the club, and a personalized menu at the restaurant and a glass of champagne. I told the hotel manager about how well we were treated by the staff and later that night, we returned to find a bottle of wine and a nice note from him thanking us for letting him know how his staff was doing. What more can you ask for? And the place was not expensive by fine hotel standards in the area and located near the museums and parks.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ashleyhottelster
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel average in everything but value. Everthing downtown is expensive so if you are staying downtown Chicago don't expect value expect it to cost an arm and a leg and be happy when you leave with your body intact. There are nicer hotels there are better locations but all in all I like this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: sspnica
Reviews.Content: We found an excellent deal for this hotel on travelzoo. The location is great; right in the middle of the downtown area with shopping and restaurants just around the corner. Many of the famous attractions of Chicago are also a short walk away. The room was very comfortable and nice. The staff at the hotel were all helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Bertorph68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here dec 2010 along with another couple. Rooms were clean and big. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great! Value very good, $110 a night and included parking. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I guess it didn't ruin our trip...”
Reviews.Author: epicwin3
Reviews.Content: The good things? The bathroom was really nice, the staff was friendly and the location was perfect with easy access to buses, the L and Michigan Avenue. And that's about it. Upon first entering the hotel, the ground floor reeks (and the lobby has a faint smell too!) of sewerage. Once in the elevator, the smell faded and the rooms were clean, but the stench was enough to make me wonder. In the elevators you must use your room key to go past the lobby (which is on the second floor). It wasn't a huge problem, but it was really inconvenient. There's also no wireless internet in the room, you have to go down to the lobby for an average, sometimes unreliable signal. It doesn't seem like a huge issue, until it's late at night and all you really want to do is look up directions to the next day's destination. Also not a deal breaker, but the restaurant connected to the ground floor of the hotel isn't worth the price. If you're staying in the area, there are far better places to eat that are just as convenient, with much better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal Perfect Location Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: rifoodie
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Chicago for 6 nights on a business trip. Could not have picked a better hotel and location. I got a room for $69 a night on travelzoo which was hundreds of dollars less than other hotels in the area. The front desk staff and doormen were very helpful and accommodating. I felt very comfortable as a solo female traveler. Yes, the rooms were a little outdated, but spacious, clean, and comfortable. Its an older boutique hotel and had more charm than generic chains in the area. I requested a room at the back of the hotel which did NOT face the L train. It was very quiet. At the end of my stay, the airport shuttle came a little a early and the lady at the front desk printed out my boarding pass for me and ran out to the street to give it to me...If you read this thank you! They really went above and beyond. I was thrilled with the value and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Dad's 80th Birthday - Couldn't have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Nbythelake
Reviews.Content: Fabulous stay! Chief Consierge Peggi is awesome! One call and she got to work. A very special birthday weekend with my 80 year old father was made even more special by Peggi's touches. She arrange for adjoining rooms, made lunch reservations close by, a special dessert - on the house - was presented after our meal. Hints on how and where to see the city from atop a skyscraper was very helpful, avoiding lines and standing. Dinner reservations near the Chicago Symphony were made and again, another birthday dessert - Happy 80th Birthday! Arriving back in our room, we were surprised with a platter of chocolate brownies and fruit. WOW! My Dad is still talking about the great trip and the great hotel -- "How did they know it was my birthday everywhere we went?" The rooms were very comfortable, clean and quiet. Many, many thanks again! Rod and Nancy

Reviews.Title: “This was a great location, the hotel room was comfortable."”
Reviews.Author: ALS002
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is that the valet parking is $46!
