I would recommend that you drop your things off in your room and then drive 2 blocks to the Grant Park garage (under Millenium Park) and save yourself some money ($30/24 hours). The Art Institue is free on Thursday night, the archictectual tour of Chicago via the river (hosted by the Architectural Foundation) is $32/person for a 90 minute tour- well worth it, and the view from the Lounge atop the Hancock building was worth the $13 drink. I think that the hotel cost was about $140/night . The room was quiet, the view of the building next door wasn't good, but we were in the room for sleeping only.

Reviews.Title: “The guy in the front desk was rude. That was Sunday Oct.24, 2010”
Reviews.Author: IamaSanDiegan
Reviews.Content: You can hear the train. It was loud. If you're not used to hearing noise, do not stay in this hotel. The front desk was really rude. They charge me more than what was in their website. They overcharge me during my stay. I hope the management from Silversmith will read this comment

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: fastdan
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel in the middle of the loop. Rooms a bit outdated, but HUGE ! Room was clean. Staff friendly. Nice and pleasant older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable beds, moldy smell, poor service, very loud, dark and dank rooms, had to use inhaler to breathe”
Reviews.Author: traveldox
Reviews.Content: Invited friends and arranged for a suite ("private bedroom and separate living room with comfortable pull-out couch, sleeps 4"). Great location is about all I can say that's positive. The smell was bad in the room when we went in- moldy and musty. Windows didn't open, and anyway they were overlooking a brick wall and HVAC units and into someone's bathroom. We turned on the AC which sounded like a freight train, but cleared the air a bit. The bathroom was large, and looked and smelled clean. The "suite" consisted of one cramped, dark room, separated into two spaces by a partial-height semitransparent partition that didn't in any way block sounds or light. There was a 1.5-inch gap between the bottom of the front door and the hallway, meaning that one could clearly hear (and see the shadows of) people walking past the room in the hallway. The bed in the living room was- well- I wouldn't really call it a bed. Three inches of wire springs covered by oddly discolored canvas, overlying three hard metal bars and some wires for the "bed frame". Sitting on the bed between metal struts resulted in dipping down at least a foot. We took the mattress off the couch frame and put it on the floor so at least it would be flat. It actually hurt to walk on it with bare feet due to the metal springs. It compressed to about an inch-think pancake. I called downstairs and asked if they had any mattress pads or another mattress and they said "no". They did not offer any assistance. I padded the mattress with all the towels and blankets I could find, and called down for some more. After several calls, two towels and one blanket arrived, 40 minutes later. The king size bed in the "bed room" was very hard but otherwise manageable. Pillows were nice and plush. I have dust mite allergies and had to use my inhaler throughout the night. After a long and uncomfortable night, (btw LOTS of noise from the train, didn't bother us so much but if you were sensitive to that stay away from the train side of the building), we checked out. The front desk person charged my card for the night we didn't stay, claiming there was a "penalty" for early check-out. I explained the situation but she said "that's the first complaint I've ever heard about the bed in the living room". Given how bad it was I simply cannot believe that to be true. In any case, the front desk person said there was no manager reachable for another 26 hours and there was nothing she could do. We paid and fled. I will never go back and don't recommend to anyone else. BTW, i did see another room on a higher floor. Similarly dank gloomy and musty, wouldn't want to stay there either. Other points: Wireless had poor to non-existent service in the room. Breakfast downstairs was fine. Parking was $40/day.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: H_Ray
Reviews.Content: Some of the pros of this hotel is the proximity to the park which was very nice since the weather was nice. Also, it's located right next to the el, which might have seemed noisy, but in the back of the hotel you couldn't hear a thing (although we had no view to speak of). The hotel was relatively clean and the service was okay. No real qualms but no real kudos either. A decent hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a block from Grant park. The staff was very helpful. The room was big and very clean and comfortable. The TV was old, but if you're planning to be out and about, that shouldn't matter. There were plenty of restaurants nearby. The "L" is right out front, so you may want to request a room away from the tracks. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and convenient - would absolutely recommend”
Reviews.Author: AmyLeigh827
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my 2 night stay at the Silversmith. I booked this room for over $100 less than other business associates spent on 4 star hotels in the loop (same travel dates) and really didn't see any difference in the quality of the rooms. (I think the money at the other hotels went towards their lobbies rather than their rooms.) The Silversmith is conveniently located, with plenty of restaurants and theater within a short walking distance. Plus, the L is close by, so all of Chicago is easily accessible from the Silversmith. The rooms were very spacious, with all the amenities I could ask for: window seats, entrance hall, armoire, large desk, large bathroom, full length mirrors, and bathrobes. The beds were fabulous. The elevated metro does run on the same street at the hotel (about every 15 minutes) and while I could hear it during the daytime, it never disturbed me at night, and I am a light sleeper. I did have a 10th floor room facing the inner courtyard, and that may have helped. This hotel was the quietest hotel I have ever stayed at in Chicago, which was a welcome reprieve from the bustling city. The staff deserves a mention - at every opportunity, they went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and convenient. I really only have three complaints about this hotel, and they are VERY minor. First, they do not provide conditioner - just "moisturizing shampoo". Not a big deal, since there is a CVS on the same block. Second, the internet was a little slow, and it was ethernet, not wifi, which was a little inconvenient. But it was free, which is a rare find in nicer hotels. Third, the hotel is difficult to locate between the jewelry shops. I walked up and down the street twice before I finally called the front desk for help, and they patiently stayed on the phone with me until I found the front entrance. Other than those tiny inconveniences, this hotel was superb. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the loop, regardless of the purpose of your stay. This is where I will stay when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hard bed and lots of noise.”
Reviews.Author: bigbird1
Reviews.Content: I checked in and was given a very large room, bedroom, sitting room and huge bath. Avoid room 301. The elevated train outside my bedroom window went all night and on the other side of the room, the elevators went all night. Hard to sleep. It was also a very hard bed. the hotel is great location, clean, friendly staff, but I did not sleep well between the hard bed and the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Terrible View”
Reviews.Author: Frendrew
Reviews.Content: I am traveling alone across the US and decided to stay here on my short trip in Chicago. The hotel is very conveniently located within walking distance to Navy Pier and Millennium Park. The street is busy and the train goes right by the hotel which can be a bit noisy. I asked for earplugs and they went out and got some for me. The hotel staff are courteous and very attentive. And the room was HUGE. I absolutely loved it but it was facing a terrible brick wall. I felt quite safe as a female traveler on my own and had an overall satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Lmarsh4444
Reviews.Content: We bid for this hotel on Priceline and paid $89/night. What a great location! We were able to walk to Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue. About 2 blocks from the Chicago river. I think we were upgraded to a suite as the room was very large, with a separate living room with refrigerator. Make sure you ask for a room on the opposite side of the "el' tracks; still could hear trains go by a little while sleeping. The only downside of this hotel was the parking; $46/night! But 2 blocks down, toward the river, there is a public parking ramp for $26/night. Next time we'll park there.

Reviews.Title: “RUINED trip right from the start!”
Reviews.Author: km0001
Reviews.Content: We open the door to a musky smelling room with a double sized "king bed". Ok the staff were nice enough so we can deal with it. Then the bell boy brings up the luggage. He casually claims that the bag was too heavy and that it caused the handle to break when he picked up the bag (because he didn't have the sense to use both handles that were available). When asked about the insurance policy in such a situation, he became very rude claiming "It wasn't my fault!" Great acceptance of responsibility I must say. The manager was nice at first before basically saying sorry there is nothing we can do "It sounds to me like the bell boy didn't do anything out of the ordinary". All i can say is I'm glad we only have to spend one night in this musky smelling room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this unique hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: DakotaTraveler10
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a sightseeing family vacation. This hotel was excellent for us--convenient & safe for kids. No worries.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jonathand1018
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Silversmith Hotel & Suites with my partner. We arrived very early on Friday morning and although our room was not yet ready, we left our bags with the bellman and toured the city. Our room was ready before Noon, which was a big plus. Overall Location The hotel is directly located next to several L lines, but none of which we took during our stay. The Blue and Red line are within a short walking distance, however. Several previous posts included comments noting that the hotel was hard to identify. I'm not sure how that could have been the case since there are several flags hanging outside the building with the hotel name on them. In addition, the awning over the front door says The Silversmith Hotel. Also, I found downtown to be bustling the majority of the day, including late at night. We stayed at the hotel Friday through Sunday. The hotel is located very closely to Millenium Park (a must see) and about a 25 minute, fast-paced walk to the Navy Pier area. Room Our room was on the eigth floor overlooking the L and Wabash Avenue. I did not find the L noise to be a problem at all. I noticed that there are two sets of windows, probobly to seel out the outside noise. Room furniture was very nice, but the mattress or boxspring (not sure which) was quite squeeky. Not too big of a problem because we were extremely exhausted whenever we were ready to sleep. I did think the armoir/tv piece of furniture was way too big for the room and sorta stuck out like a sore thumb. Room was otherwise very clean and had no issues. Staff / Front Desk I was happy not have to pass the front desk every time I walked in an out of the hotel. I see having the front desk on the second floor as a plus rather than a negative. I reached out to the front desk for a restaurant recommendation, but we opted for another restaurant. The bellman were okay and asked if we needed any recommendations or directions when we left the building at night time. Stay Again I'd likely stay again if I were able to secure a cheap rate, but if not I'd prefer to be more north. Chicago is a huge city and L trips can be a little time consuming. I'd rather avoid as much L time on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, super convenient”
Reviews.Author: RockCatWichita_KS
Reviews.Content: I feel fortunate to have found this hotel as part of a fly/stay package on American. We flew into Midway, took the Orange line downtown, and the "L" stop must have been 100 ft or so from the front door of the hotel. 2 blocks from Millenium Park, nice deli/bar on the ground floor, friendly and helpful staff. The only reason we might not stay there on our next trip would be if we want to be further north.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, close to shops, transport & culture”
Reviews.Author: DebbieIancu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the silversmith for four nights on a buisness trip with colleages. The rooms were confortable, we didn't have any meals there (no breakfast included) but the rooms were spacious and clean and the staff were helpful and polite. The location was just the best - I had set aside time for shopping and on the block around the hotel were all the shops one could desire. Across the road was the art museum and the incredible cloud gate - It was my first time in chicago and I went to millenium park every day - It's so beautiful and so close. The price was very reasonable for such a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: claymorekc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel just off of Michigan Ave. The "L" is right in front of the hotel, but it just gave it a true Chicago flavor. The Frank Lloyd Wright-inspired interiors were lovely. Very friendly staff but very unobtrusive. Yes, parking is expensive, but it is everywhere else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Find”
Reviews.Author: TomWilson
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in the heart of The Loop. I always have stayed on MIchigan, so this was a nice surprise. Entance is a bit shabby as the real lobby is on scond floor. Rooms not overly large (the bathroom is huge), but clean and quiet. Staff is OK. It took about 30 minutes to have bags sent to room, otherwise nice. Location is great. Minutes to the Art Institute and Grant Park. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: DavenGVAR
Reviews.Content: Room - Clean, no problems with noise Bed - Comfortable Staff - Polite Location - This hotel was a 15 minute walk from the Megabus stop, near almost all the rail lines (it's at the Loop - Madison/Wabash stop for brown, pink, green, purple, and orange lines [red line also nearby]), and a short walk from many attractions. The area felt relatively safe and we were never harassed for money. Tip - The exterior isn't obvious. Maybe look it up on the street view of Google Maps first so you know what you're looking for. Also, I think their rate for parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: eobri
Reviews.Content: I booked the Silversmith for a last-minute trip to Chicago for the July 4th weekend. The rate was the cheapest I could find for a downtown hotel, and represented an excellent value for what I got. The location is great -- only a few minutes walk from Millennium Park, and the El is right outside that can take you anywhere you may want to go in the city. The entry is a bit odd, as you come in on the first floor and have to take an elevator to the second floor lobby. It's too bad as the lobby looked inviting but nobody was ever there! Checkin was smooth and I was given a King suite (an unexpected surprise). The room was one of the largest I've ever stayed in! There was a sofa and sitting area, along with the king sized bed. The bathroom was big enough to sleep in, and had both a shower and a jetted tub. Everything seemed fairly clean, although the furnishings were a bit dated. Being in the Loop, there were not a lot of options in the evening, but if you walk a few blocks north (towards the river), there were plenty of nice eateries to choose from. In the daytime (or I suppose during the week), there was lots of activity in the streets around the hotel. I didn't feel unsafe at any time, and we returned quite late in the evening. I also was surprised it wasn't noisier considering how near it was to the trains. Overall, I would certainly return to the Silversmith for the location and value it delivered.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, location, and service...”
Reviews.Author: butchartd
Reviews.Content: Given the high rates in the downtown area, we were very pleased with the rate ($380 taxes incl. for 3 nights) and quality of room. The room was clean and fresh; nothing was tired or worn. Be sure to ask for a room that does not face the train tracks. Service was very helpful, especially Barbara at the front desk. And lastly, the location was perfect - in the center of everything. Millennium Park is just a 2 minute walk away and is the most reasonable place to park overnight at $24 instead of $46 for valet parking (the only shortcoming of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “A great location with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: millieg2
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago by myself on business. I wanted to stay in walking distance of the Millennium Park and downtown and found this hotel at a very reasonable rate ($160/night including taxes) which is definitely on the cheaper side for hotels around the Loop. The location was perfect for what I wanted to do and see - only a short block away from Cloud Gate. Finding the hotel was a little tricky - buried among dozens of similar looking buildings in what is known as Chicago's Jewelers Row, they only have a small door with no distinguishing features indicating they are a hotel as their entrance. I was only directed to it by the valet guys standing across the street. Check-in: The lobby is located on the second floor with the hotel restaurant and store on the first floor. A bit of a weird layout choice but ok... Check-in was fairly quick. I booked a double room, asking for a king, and received a triple. The room: The room was extremely spacious. The dÃ©cor was far from modern but the ceilings were extremely high with floor to ceiling windows and overall a clean room. It had two separate rooms, a bedroom with a small desk and a living room. Each room had a TV, which was nice. The bathroom was probably the largest Iâ€™ve seen in a hotel room. The tub had bad drainage issues but otherwise the bathroom was clean. All-in-all, the room was fine...it had the basics and most importantly was clean! Negatives: 1)The hotel does provide free internet but the lobby is the only area with Wi-Fi. Computers had to be hooked up to a cable at the desk in the rooms. What made it even more inconvenient was that the cable was just a couple feet long, forcing you to keep the computer at the desk. 2) My room was facing the trains and unfortunately, could be heard loud and clear all day and night. 3) I used the valet service at the hotel for $47/night with unlimited usage throughout the day. I called the valet extension to have them get the car in the morning but no one picked up for 10 minutes. I finally called the front desk where a gentleman answered. He reassured me that heâ€™d call down and take care of it and to allow 15 to 20 minutes. I went outside about 15 minutes later to find no one in sight. I figured someone was getting my car. Unfortunately, that wasnâ€™t the case. About 5 minutes later a valet guy shows up, says hello and asks if i needed help. I asked if someone is getting my car and was told that no one had called, including the front desk. After mentioning it to the front desk when I got back, I barely got an apology. Nice! Overall, decent hotel for a good price and a great location with a few issues.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: vikkij1980
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location! It is right in the center of Chicago and next to Millenium Park! If you are looking for a reasonable price and the main aspect is location, then stay here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I got upgraded to a suite, which was lovely! The furniture was a bit dated but all in all it was a nice hotel and I would stay here again. You also get free internet connection, which was a plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hard to Find”
Reviews.Author: candsyao
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights for a business conference. Located right in the heart of downtown Chicago (near Millennium Park), the Silversmith hotel is surprisingly difficult to locate, at least for me. The hotel staff & valet are very helpful and outgoing, and the room is clean and comfortable. The hotel was a tough find because it's located near the train and has a very undistinguished front door (on South Wabash Avenue between East Madison Street and East Monroe Street next to the TCF Bank). For this meeting, I was deciding between the Silversmith and Holiday Inn Mart Plaza, and I think I'll try the Holiday Inn next time for comparison. The Good 1. Great location. Walking distance to Millennium/Grant Park, State Street (shopping), and Intelligentsia Coffee. 2. The hotel and valet staff are friendly and helpful; even at midnight. I had an 100 lbs product shipped to the hotel, and it was brought to my room when I checked in and brought back down in the morning. While I had no other alternative but to use the hotel's valet service, I felt the valet service was very professional and courteous. Each morning, I would called down for my car to be readied at a certain time and it was always on-time and ready to go. Look it up on Google Map's "Street View" before heading there. The Not-So-Good 1. The complimentary internet is extremely slow. Think 28.8k dial-up speed. This was very annoying because I was kept up trying to access emails and vendor info because only one would operate at any given time. 2. While on the highest floor (10th), I can still hear the train operating directly in front of the hotel. 3. Parking is Ã¼ber expensive: $42/day, but I doubt other comparable hotels in the area are charging less. From previous posts, I read about a nearby parking garage that charges less, but I was told that the nearby parking garage charges each time you enter and exit the garage. Since I was constantly in-and-out, I reluctantly paid the hotel's parking fees. 4. The room's decor is dated.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing... and a great deal to boot!”
Reviews.Author: DairyQueenWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We took the train into town for the weekend and picked the Silversmith because we wanted to be close to everything and got a great deal on the room (under $100). We walked into the hotel and everyone was incredibly friendly. The concierge was happy to direct us to a non-Starbucks coffee shop as well as help us find a restaurant for dinner. Even the housekeeping staff we met in the halls greeted us with a friendly "Good morning!" The room was great and had a separate living room and bedroom. The bathroom, too, was huge, with a separate tub and shower. Everything was spotlessly clean. Yes, the furniture was a bit old (but still comfortable) and the TVs were not flat-screen HD-this-or-that, but they worked just fine. We were right next to the elevator, but we heard no noise at night. The hotel was a 10 minute walk to Michigan Avenue, and 5 minutes to the Chicago Theater, where we had tickets for a show. It was also walking distance to Millennium Park, the Art Institute, Union Station, and a ton of great restaurants. In short, this hotel was a great deal, a central location with friendly staff and spacious rooms. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel needs some basic upgrades- not for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: soldelmar
Reviews.Content: careful not to be close to train line! large rooms, very basic, dated furniture, old carpet but all very clean. clearly run with extreme cost cutting measures in mind. large safe in room. beds are too old, pillows too high and stiff. got back and neck pains after 3 nights. No coffee machine. At least a kettle would be nice. Free morning coffee in lobby is practically coloured water (good thing starbucks is nearby). They should replace the slow inkjet in the lobby and add just one more computer to relieve the log jam in the mornings for printing boarding passes. Free internet is overrated and always overloaded, i would rather pay for a decent connection but you don't have the option. Not a good deal for business.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Hotel with Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: jsojo
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, but the service was terrible. Their broadband cable internet did not work so I called the front desk and the only response I got was that I could come down to the lobby and use the public wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased. Expensive parking solved.”
Reviews.Author: gmorahg
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights and agree with the general praise. Excellent location, quality and comfort. Only complaint: no coffee-maker in rooms. We had an inward facing room on 8th floor and could hear the El faintly. It did not bother our sleep. THANKS TO THE REVIEWER WHO SUGGESTED PARKING AT THE MILLENNIUM GARAGE. It's a short walk from the hotel and almost half the price. Check it out: http://www.millenniumgarages.com/garages/millennium-park-garage.aspx

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: alostyankee
Reviews.Content: THe SIlversmith is a decent, basic hotel. Not too many frills. The room decor is arts and crafts and fairly basic, but not boring. The bed was average in comfort. The bathroom like many other hotels. The staff was friendly and helpful without being overbearing. Room service was prompt. The location is excellent- walking distance to many attractions and also the transit. I thought I would be bothered by the noise from the El, but I was on the 8th floor and the noise was more like white noise. Price couldn't be beat-I paid $105/night.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: bertha1223
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Silversmith. the service was excellent and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. We were impressed by how quiet it was. It also is fairly charming and a lovely atmosphere. It would be tough to beat the location if you are visiting Chicago. It's practically right on top of the L and near some yummy deep dish pizza. It was an incredibly short, easy walk to the Art Institute and Millenium Park, and easy access to any other part of the city that's accessible by public transit. This was our first visit to Chicago and we loved it! I would stay in the Silversmith again. We had a King bed and the pillows were small and not my kind of pillows. I also would have preferred two double beds (so I could have one to myself, versus sharing the huge king bed with my friend), so my sleep was not as high quality as would merit a 4 or 5 star rating, but that's not really the fault of the hotel. However, the bed was comfortable, the shades darkened the room very nicely, and the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: MissWisc
Reviews.Content: I booked the Silversmith because the conference I was attending had made a deal to get a discount at the hotel. It was a bargain. The room was HUGE. A sitting area with sleeper sofa that would be perfect for 2 kids and a separate bedroom with king size bed for the adults, each with it's own TV. The bathroom is big enough to hold several people, if you're not too modest. There are a refrigerator and a safe too. The Madison/Wabash train stop is about 20' from the front door. I was concerned about the train noise, but thick curtains dampened the sound. I slept very well. Loop theatres are 4-6 blocks away, so if you're coming to see a play or musical with the family, this is a perfect place to stay. Lots of shopping and restaurants to fit all budgets are close by. The staff was wonderful. It was a perfect visit! I'll stay here when I'm in town again and bring my family next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: cyberbes
Reviews.Content: My wife and two kids stayed at the Silversmith March 14-17 and couldn't have been more pleased. We had a large room with a seperate sitting area and two comfortable chairs. There are many restaurant options steps away and getting a bus to the museums or N. Michigan Ave. shopping is a breeze. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We will stay here again when we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Really great price, great size room and comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: 13ll
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silversmith while on a 2 months holiday in the US. It was one of the best hotels i stayed in. When I checked in I couldn't believe the size of the room. A nice living room area with couch, tv, microwave and coffee maker (coffee not provided) and desk with free wired internet (which worked great). A very large and very clean bathroom, and a huge bed in a good size bedroom which was sepetate. My room looked over the railway and at first I was a little worried about noise... it was not a problem. I could hardly hear a thing. And i didn't even notice the train. All the door staff were fantastic, they gave me some great advise on where to eat and were very friendly. They could see I was travelling alone and kind of looked out for me. The building was secure which also made me feel safe. And then theres the price which was great. Chicago seemed to be a bit expensive and this hotel had a great size room in a great location for a fantastic price! What more can i say! Oh and the bed are so comfy which is something you don't always find in a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “An Arts and Crafts Movement Gem!”
Reviews.Author: HoppyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silversmith for a weekend getaway. The hotel itself is a beauty- a wonderfully restored 1896 DH Burnham firm building with National Landmark status. Our room was full modernized, yet reflected its art and crafts movement heritage in its furnishings, wall coverings, and carpet designs. The room was surprising spacious. The lobby was a comfortable place to relax by the fire and access the wi-fi (in room there was a data port). The location was great- close to the art museum and just steps from the Madison/Wabash el stop. As with any hotel in the loop, there was the sound of the el. The well glazed windows helped minimize the sound, but if you are a light sleeper, you may want earplugs. We heard no other city sounds (ie- sirens, car alarms, garbage trucks). There is no in room coffee and the coffee shop downstairs closes on Sunday. There are several chain coffee shops withhin a block, but your best bet is the The Pittsfield Grill in the Pittsfield Building just a block away. Good breakfast, great value, and in the atrium of another classic old Chicago building.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill for few bills”
Reviews.Author: sherman46
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith was just right: convenient to things in the Loop including art venues, near the El as well as the Blue and Red lines so you could get anywhere, huge room (bigger than my NYC apartment), restaurant on first floor, free wired internet access in the room worked well enough (didn't try the lobby wireless), door guys friendly. Oh, the price was only $89 a night, reserved on the hotel website. (The only reason I'm not rating the service above is I didn't really use it; the desk clerks were fine but I didn't ask anything of them other than check in and out.) (My room was on the front of the building and I could hear the trains; if that bothers you, you might ask for an inner room.)

Reviews.Title: “The gem on Wabash”
Reviews.Author: JanetQ62
Reviews.Content: My gal pal and I have traveled extensively over the past three years within and outside of the United States. So far the Silversmith has been one of our best finds for the money. Just a few of the highlights were cleanliness of private and public areas, helpfulness of the staff, conveniency of location and quality and cost of the food within the hotel's deli. It was surprisingly quiet considering it's location next to the L Really, we hated to leave but took comfort in the fact that we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Missing in-room coffee and ADA compliant remote”
Reviews.Author: FormerChicagoGal
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago (my home town for a funeral) - I flew in that morning went directly to the funeral and finally checked into the hotel at around 8 p.m. All I wanted was to have a cup of coffee and watch TV - I was scheduled to fly out early the next day. I was amazed not to find in room coffee and that the remote for the TV in my room did not have the closed caption option. I am deaf and cannot watch TV without it. Fortunately the desk clerk was familiar with the problem and was able to direct me to a convenience store for coffee and explain to me how to set up the captioning on the TV. The bed was wonderfully comfortable - and the staff was very pleasant. For the price and the convenience the hotel is a great deal and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great”
Reviews.Author: king_leo1
Reviews.Content: I say surprisingly because this hotel doesn't have an overwhelming amount of great reviews. Nor, does it have a brand name, so I knew what to expect. Friendly, quiet and centrally located. We got our rooms on a deal, so I'd say this hotel was easily worth the money. The room was big. The first room was a "living room" with tv and couch. Then a bedroom separate from that. I don't think I would pay the top dollar though. We did not use the gym. No cont breakfast. Best deal: free internet connection. This is the kind of hotel you sleep/wake up early to work out/leave. No frills. It's not hard to find but it's hard to notice because there are no large signs/displays. And if you pass it, you'll have to go around the block to return. My only real complain is the amount of the valet service - it seemed excessive. Because we got the room on a deal, I went for it.

Reviews.Title: “Girls' Trip!”
Reviews.Author: leander_hero
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, but it took us a while to find it. It's close by to a lot of places. We had a problem with the payment. They charged me for everything upfront, even though they had told me earlier they wouldn't. This left me with barely any money left in my account, but we eventually got it fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price - Very Family Freindly”
Reviews.Author: lizzie03
Reviews.Content: My husband visited Chicago with our daugher and her 9 month old baby to visit with family and friends. The hotel staff were extremely helpful with our grandson and couldn't have been more friendly. First trip alone without Grandmother or husband and they had a wonderful time. Good value, very clean rooms and so close to everything they wanted to see. Both a quite fussy about hotels so their total thumbs up is a real plus for the Silversmith. Absolutely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: c1defence
Reviews.Content: Great location, but after booking I checked the location with the orange suited guy on Google Maps, and realised there was the elevated metro on Wabash. E-mailed and requested a room away from the street, which we got. Background whoosh of trains, but did not disturb our sleep. Checked in with hand baggage so really never used any of the hotel services, except was able to use their internet facility and print our boarding cards back to Houston. Would have been nice to have a microwave, even with the ice machine and automat. Rooms at the rear would have been quieter, other than traffic. Great location with CTA train station at the front door and buses one block away.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY QUIET, Comfortable Bed with 6 pillows, & Easy to find!”
Reviews.Author: shtzngigglez
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is located on a street where the train runs right out front....it was so unbelievably quiet! When you think about why you go to a hotel in the first place, it's usually to get a good nights sleep! You will here. If you are looking for a room with a view...don't stay here! If you are looking for a good nights sleep...this is it. We did have breakfast in the dining on the ground floor and it was a nice breakfast. Staff was very friendly and helpful, parking and valet was a breeze! Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at the Silversmith!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysMexicoDreamin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silversmith in Chicago for 2 nights on Sept. 13 & 14, 2009. I loved it! I was looking for a small boutique hotel and it was perfect. Great location within walking distance to everything downtown. I thought the room and it's furnishings were very nice. And we were shocked at the fact that you couldn't hear the El even though it was right out the front door. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible, Horrible”
Reviews.Author: lequani
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with friends on the night of September 11, 2009. The valet person was lazy and took his time to move our cars and picked them up when we had requested for them. The front desk was untruthful in where to park which caused one of the guests to have her car ticketed and towed. The housekeeping was very unprofessional. We had requested more sheets and blankets at 4am and they took an hour to bring it to my room. I will never stay there again nor recommend anyone else to do so.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: KennyandKenny
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the Silversmith and couldn't be any happier with the hotel. We planned the trip primarily to visit the Art Institute, only a few blocks away, and the hotel was perfectly situated. We were very pleased with the room, the staff, and the especially convenient location. Great area to stay in, with plenty of attractions, wonderful and reasonably priced restaurants, and shopping if you're into that. We will certainly stay at the Silversmith again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, deceptively quiet but gym and Internet weak”
Reviews.Author: techconfgoer
Reviews.Content: Paid about $170 a nite for three mid-week nites, which seems high but was the cheapest that week, it seemed. The Silversmith is a historic-registered downtown building that faces a noisy elevated L train. Don't worry: many of the rooms face rear-ward. Mine did, and it was dark, but totally quiet, did not hear the L at all. Room and bed was comfortable but smallish, which was emphasized by the large Oak furniture...happy I didn't stub my toe :) The gym was tiny, as many hotel gyms are. The wired Internet was very slow, made it hard for me to do my work. And I was disappointed by the downstairs Ada's deli...friendly wait-staff but food was only so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - terrible internet”
Reviews.Author: jd1234567
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, spacious, and clean. Fridge and coffee maker in unit, but no microwave. Good location and a good place to stay. Amenities were nothing special. Internet was free, but virtually useless - I'm a network person and clocked my speeds consistently at 1/4 of traditional 56k dial-up. If you need to use the net (ie. business travelers), you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, poor internet connection (hey, it's free)”
Reviews.Author: Thalina
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Silversmith for two nights during a recent business trip. I was pleased with the size of the room and the bathroom. Very spacious, especially for downtown Chicago at this price point. Pillows were a little lumpy. The internet was very, very, very slow. Many sites failed to load after five minutes. The hotel restaurant isn't anything to write home about. Hoof it about a block and you have plenty of fast dining options (Chipotle, Jimmy Johns sandwiches). Bell hop was friendly and efficient. Lobby area was huge but deserted. They've got lots of chairs and tables to relax in, but no guests seemed to hang out in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Besitos22
Reviews.Content: I used "hotwire" (crossed my fingers) and this was the hotel we got!! I could not have asked for more. The "EL" is right outside the door which made it very easy to get to/from Midway Airport. It was very clean, comfortable and very spacious. Also, the higher the better.. Our room was on the 10th floor so we really didn't get bothered by the noise. The hotel is located on the loop on Wabash and Madison, only one block from Michigan Ave. and Millennium Park. The staff was just great, they stored our luggage and were of great help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Concierge Service!”
Reviews.Author: Verti94
Reviews.Content: I had booked a couple days at the hotel with my mom, sister, and young nephew. We had two very nice rooms and greatly enjoyed the pleasant reception and warm cookies! My nephew was very happy chatting with the friendly staff. Most importantly the manager handled a potentially disastrous situation unbelievably well. I was leaving with my mother to attend a funeral in Mississippi after 2 days and we had to get an early start. I had sent my bags with the bellman on duty (5 AM) and the valet brought my van around. As the bellman was outside already and had opened my door, I assumed he had already placed the bags in the back and off we drove. We didn't notice they weren't there until we were many hours away. I frantically called the hotel and the manager assured me they would get our bags to us in time for the funeral. He had my bags flown down to me that very day and I was not charged at all for the service. It was the most unbelievable concierge service I have ever experienced. They really take care of their guests and are conscientious about getting things done quickly and accurately!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: OkahumpkaGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silversmith with a friend for the weekend and had an excellent time. The room was incredibly quiet and comfortable, and the staff was very nice. They went out of their way to greet us in the hallways, and the desk staff was very courteous about our needs (arranging for a taxi, FedEx, etc.). I have absolutely no complaints. I haven't slept that well in a hotel room in a while! One thing to note -- the internet is free (a lot of hotels in the Loop charge extra for wireless) but it is wired, so you will be chained to the desk (they provide the cable). I was very okay with that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSSEvansville-IN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were concerned about the negative reviews, but were pleasantly surprised when we found the hotel to be very nice and the staff were excellent. I approached each staff member with a smile and they were very kind in return. The room was large and the bathroom was very trendy and huge!! The room was clean and linens and coffee were replaced daily. The only negative was the computer speed was very slow. We plan to stay there again next year when we return in August.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nital
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 3 teenagers & myself (the Mom) to Chicago, from Toronto, recently just for a few nights & days. My goodness! not even bottle water in the refrigerator....how cheap! The staff were very rude!....They thought we were all kids...I Iguess!....Myself the Mom looks like a teenager...so I guess no RESPECT! I will never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of the Loop”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelSeries
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent several days here celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary, and finishing the research om my book about Chicago. This hotel is a gem. First of all, the price was fabulous. I found a very low rate on a popular hotel-booking website, then called the Silversmith directly and they matched it -- just over a hundred dollars a night. NEVER pay rack rate! The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and immaculate. Elevators were quick, public areas were comfortable -- we enjoyed our 4-night stay enormously and will certainly return next time we are in the city. Two tips: 1) If you are very sensitive to noise, ask for a room away from the street. The L runs right outside the hotel and you will hear it. In interior rooms, however, the trains sound more like a whoosh of wind than a clattering train. 2) There is a large parking garage half a block south at Wabash and Monroe. If you park your car there yourself, you'll save about $7 a day extra the valet parking costs. We just parked our car and left it, and used the L and buses -- order visitor travel cards in advance from the CTA website for great savings. The hotel is on the east side of the Loop, very close to Macy's (nee: Marshall Fields), Grant Park, the Art Institute, theaters, restaurants, and all sorts of public transportation. If you're here to shop the Mag Mile, Michigan Avenue is one block east, a 2-minute walk, where a five minute bus ride on just about any bus that goes by will take you to that shopping Mecca. All rooms in the Silversmith have access to free high-speed internet via an Ethernet cable provided in the room. It worked flawlessly. The restaurant is open from early morning until 10 p.m., but we didn't eat there, having our own favorites. It's not cheap. An inexpensive breakfast option is half a block south at Wabash and Monroe (across from the parking garage I mentioned) called the Corner Bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with the exception of one rude front desk clerk.”
Reviews.Author: pko60
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I traveled to Chicago for a weekend getaway and stayed at the Silversmith for two nights. The hotel was a bit tricky to locate from the street due to only a small sign at the hotel entrance. We called the hotel and the front desk clerk was able to provide us with exact directions. We opted to park in the Self-Park garage located on Monroe Street (just around the corner from the hotel) instead of valet parking. The garage fee was $36 a night versus the $42 fee that the hotel charged. We checked in without any problems and went to our standard room with two double beds. Overall the room was clean and appeared to be spacious with very high ceilings. After a few minutes of getting settled in, we noticed a very foul fishy/urine smell on one of the beds. It was not only on the bed spread but also on the sheets. We promptly called the front desk to notify them and the front desk clerk, Rossi, was more than rude to us. He told us that it was unlikely that he had any other rooms with 2 double beds and he didn't know how soon a maid could come to take care of the bed. He then called back and in a rude tone of voice told us that he could give us a room with a king sized bed and a sleeper couch. We agreed to take this room. When we went back down to the front desk to get our new keys, we asked to speak to a manager. Rossi, snickered and shook his head at us before getting the manager. While the hotel manager listened to our complaint about the room and the rude treatment we had received, he did not offer an apology. After we left the hotel for a few hours, we returned to find a nice gift package with bottles of water, wine, snacks, and a card from management. The room we were moved to was a very nice suite. It had a refrigerator, microwave, and a tub with jets. We had no other problems with the hotel. The shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. While you could hear the "L" train, it was not an annoying sound by any means and did not bother us at all at night. This hotel was certainly not the nicest we have stayed in but for the price, it was just fine. All in all, we did have a decent stay at this hotel with the exception of our encounter with Rossi. All of the other hotel staff were pleasant. I think if we were to return to Chicago we would probably stay in a different location that was closer to the Magnificent Mile or the Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...terrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: pkirchgessner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were going to a very nearby theatre to see Jersey Boys. The hotel was very nice and clean but the staff was the most rude and unfriendly we have ever run across! We passed a bellman three times in the course of our first day there, spoke to him and he just looked right through us. He is the first person any guest sees and he was extremely rude! Bad start! The young man at the desk when we checked in was a little better but not by much. The room was very nice and clean but you had to walk sideways through it because there was so little space between the end of the bed and a huge cabinet that housed the tv. Once you managed to get past the bed and cabinet there was a ridiculousy large office space. Tiny room with close quarters but an oversized office and desk?? Not a good thing for leisure travelers! We were awoken at 5:15 am by several 20 something women, obviously drunk out of their minds running and screaming off the elevator and down the 8th floor hallway. I called the front desk only to receive a response of "What do you want me to do about it?" Excuse me, is it not your job to make sure the patrons at your hotel are safe and comfortable? I could not believe his response!! We did talk to the front desk clerk about this when we checked out, but based on the simple response that "she had no idea who that would have been that answered and spoke to me that way, but she would look into it" I highly doubt it will even be repeated. It was a nice hotel and in a location very close to many things to see, but the terribly unfriendly staff made it a place we would not recommend or stay again!! Parking was $42 a day!! (The internet stats it is $30!) We chose to walk a couple blocks and pay $20!

Reviews.Title: “A Positive Surprise”
Reviews.Author: nmtourist
Reviews.Content: We booked The Silversmith based on the reviews of others, but more than anything based on price/location. We make at least annual trips to Chicago, and have tended to stay somewhere along North Michigan. This was only our second shot at staying inside the Loop...and it was terrific. The location is, indeed, exceptional for Grant Park, Art Institute, downtown shopping, theater, etc. And El stations are literally at your doorstep. The entry of the hotel is almost hidden, but the rooms ar grand (we stayed in two.) You will read complaints about El noise, but city noise is part of the downtown Chicago experience. Don't stay here if you prefer the quiet, suburban chain hotels. This is older but in nice shape, large rooms, convenient to everything, and a real Chicago "immersion." And the staff treated us remarkably well. It is our new favorite Chicago hotel. Note that parking is very pricey, but why are you driving into Chicago's Loop?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: clbd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit understated as far as the entrance goes since it really only has a doorway with little indication of what is there (I have stayed at the Palmer House a couple of times so compared to the big cheery entrances for the Palmer House, the Silversmith entrance is bizarre). Anyway, the staff was quite nice and the doormen (and they were men) were always friendly. The room (910 I believe) was great. A king bed and a longish padded window seat. A nice chair and good desk set. Our view was not that great but the room was quiet, clean and comfortable. I stayed here to attend a conference at National Louis University. Very close to the University so that was great. I also liked that it was so close to the institute of arts and Millennial Park (I think that is what it is called). Lots of nearby restaurants and shopping too. We especially like Gage for drinks in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Refused to honor Priceline quote and receipt”
Reviews.Author: librarianista
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith has a certain amount of deco charm, and the location is very convenient to Millenium Park and the L train, but those are the only things it has going for it. Our room faced a brick wall, but I think the only other option was to face the noisy L train, so perhaps we got the best option of the two. We also asked for a high floor when we reserved the room 6 months ago, and we were put on the lowest floor. Most frustratingly, the hotel did not honor our Priceline quote. After quite a bit of haggling, they were only willing to knock $50 off the price of our entire 7-night visit, though our Priceline quote was much less. There were also a lot of small things that let you know that you weren't staying in a 3-star hotel, like the fact that they only order a few copies of the newspaper, so you have to get up early and rush downstairs to try to make sure you get one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; friendly staff; average on the rest”
Reviews.Author: UofIx3
Reviews.Content: Silversmith Hotel is an average hotel in a great location with a friendly staff. You are only a five minute walk from the Art Institute and Millennium Park and ten to fifteen minutes from Wacker Drive and the Chicago River. In terms of getting there, you are right next to multiple L routes and a couple of blocks from the blue L line that takes you to O'Hare. I drove my car to the hotel to drop off and pick up my luggage and the valet parkers and busmen were very friendly and allowed us to park our car short term in the valet parking area. Check in and checkout were handled smoothly and other questions were answered by friendly people at the main desk. The room was good-sized with the sleep quarters in a separate room from the bathroom and a pretty small living room. I liked the Arts and Crafts furniture. Bathroom had very good water pressure and was just fine, as were the bath towels. They followed their stated environmental policies and did not wash our linens or towels as requested. So what makes me give this an average rating? Even though we were on the side away from the L, we could still hear it from our bedroom (that doesn't bother me, but it did bother my wife). There were no shades to pull closed so the light came pouring in. The mattress was not very supportive, nor the pillows. The Internet was free and was available both wired and wireless. Unfortunately, the service was kind of poky and spotty. I tried going back and worth between wired and wireless, but had to give up a couple of times because it was taking too long. Business office was pretty sad. There were two pretty old computers that inexplicably used the wireless signal and not wired access. That limited its speed. In addition, only one computer could use the printer at any one time. As cheap as computers are at this point, I couldn't figure out why they didn't just buy some newer computers with better capabilities. The T.V.s in the bedroom and living room were 25" CRTs and the remote didn't really work for one of them. It also turned on at a bracingly high volume. There were no recycling options in the building for paper, plastic bottles, plastic bags, etc. The power went out on Friday morning (utility issue, not their fault) and an elevator got stuck. It was still stuck when we left on Monday. All in all, I would stay at the hotel again, but given it was in the same price range as much nicer conference hotels, I would think twice if I could get into a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and value, as long as you stay on courtyard side”
Reviews.Author: Foster32
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith is in the Jewelry District (about two blocks from Grant Park), and is immediately in front of an elevated train stop on the loop. The stop connects to four lines, which makes it very convenient to anywhere in Chicago. It also makes all street front rooms very noisy, not just from the passing/stopping trains but the train announcements, too. I stayed on the courtyard side and could still hear the noise, and the wind surges, created by each train. But, enough of the negatives. The hotel was very attractive, with rich oak furniture and paneling. The prairie dÃ©cor was reminiscent of Frank Lloyd Wright. The L-shaped room was approximately 600 square feet, with twin queen beds, a large bathroom and a large foyer. Lots of quality, small touches in the room. The service was first rate. My rate was only $122 (not including breakfast) thanks to hotel.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a few downfalls.”
Reviews.Author: bromion
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith is very promising -- good location, nice big rooms, right price. A few issues make it a bit less than ideal, however. The good: we had a gigantic room with a king bed and pull-out sofa, along with a huge bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi tub. The price was right at $90/night from Priceline. The bad: The hotel is right next to the El, so it is a little noisy, even on the other side of the building. Of course, this is also rather convenient if you want to take the metro. The staff was fine, though at times they seemed patronizing (talked very slowly, described everything they were doing -- it was odd, though perhaps a Chicago thing?). Worst aspect of the hotel was the "business center" -- a pair of seriously underpowered PCs and a low-ink inkjet printer that probably came free in a bundle. Trying to print a boarding pass for the flight home was an exercise in patience at best. Overall a fine stay for the price, but nothing particularly great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: josebtesh
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel through Priceline for 80 dollars plus tax. Price was good when I booked it. Then afterwords, I started receiving promotions for 4 star Hotels for 100 dollars. Pros: My conclusion is for the money 80, is good. Clean, good bed, good towels, good and large bathroom. I 've got a room in the back, no L noise. Service is excellent, check in and check out ( they gave us a late check-out ). Cons: Although location is good, the Hotel is "under the L rails" which appears sad, odd and scary. Lobby is old, very old, big and dated. However, if you do not mind about it, it's fine. If you go during a weekend, I would recommend a more northern ( Michigan North) location....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was pretty happy with the room, the location and the price. No complaints or anything. I enjoyed my stay here and would return to the hotel. It's not super fancy but you need to ask yourself what you're looking for.. The hotel is located near the base of the L train and my first impression was that the area seemed a bit dodgey (and that was during the day) but the Hilton (Palmer House) is only a block away. Having walked around though the area a few times it seems totally fine. Also, the L train is right above the hotel and it's pretty noisy (I could hear it inside at the reception desk) The room is pretty large but rather dark (I was facing inward to a closed off area in the hotel complex. But if my option was facing the street and listening to the train, I'd prefer the inward view (and you could hear the train from this room but very faintly). The bathroom is large, the internet is free but they have an older tube tv. The fitness room comprises of two treadmills, a step climber, an elyptical machine, a bench and a small universal type machine. This is located a few doors down from the E. Madison subway entrance. I took a shuttle bus to the hotel and given the ride (over an hour and a half) I would recommend taking the subway/train. The hotel is also near the "bean" and the Art Institute of Chicago. Everything seems pretty walkable (Wacker street is probably a 15 minute walk away). You're within walking distance of deep dish pizza (Pizzano, Giordano's) and a bit farther out but walkable blues music (Blue Chicago).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Doorman is a treat!”
Reviews.Author: jland5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family while visiting Chicago. The rooms are clean, the bathrooms are of a decent size, and the people were wonderful. However, the doorman, Vincent, was the real treat! He greeted us, escorted us with our luggage to our room, and recommended some great places to eat (none of which included the restaurant next to the hotel.) On the way back to the airport, we decided to take the el, which drops off right in front of the hotel. He packed our bags (50 lbs each) to the platform for us! This hotel is clean, and nice. The lobby is a great place to hide out if you want to get out of your room and read. Be aware that if you're looking to spend a great amount of time in your room, there isn't much of a view - it's surrounded by buildings and the el runs right in front. Don't be too afraid of the el, though - from the rooms we were in, you couldn't hear it unless it was really quiet, and then it sounded kind of like the ocean. The location is great - it's surrounded by everything within walking distance. However, I would avoid two things: 1) The restaurant downstairs - it's pricey and not very good, and 2) Room service - it comes from the same restaurant. There's a corner bakery a 1/2 block south which does a great breakfast and lunch, or a diner called B&B's that's on the west side of the next block south that is much better and has a great breakfast special. In all, it's a pleasant place, and great if you're on vacation or planning to do other things besides sit in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest but ok”
Reviews.Author: LivinginTo
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Silversmith Hotel on Friday May 15th. We had a suite and it was spacious and suited our needs perfectly. We ordered room service the next morning so that we could sleep in a bit longer before our tour. This was most likely the worst room service I have ever had. We normally let things slide and hardly ever complain about service. They forgot one breakfast, cutlery, drinks and napkins. The food they did deliver was barely luke warm. I called down and was told that if I wanted it fixed I would have to come down to them, they only had two waiters on that morning. Finally my husband went down and the person in charge was not going to do anything to correct the error. The manager happened to walk in and when told about the problem he said he would correct the bill. To add insult to injury they automatically add an 18% gratuity to the bill. Our tour operator told me that we had a great place for breakfast and was astounded when I told her about the service we received. We checked out on Monday and the bill had not been corrected, the person at the front desk did so though. The location is good but for the money we spent I would go else where. Chicago is a great city to visit and we had a great time and good memories. I just wanted to share this so that others can avoid the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Dishonest Manager”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr58
Reviews.Content: The manager lied to us. We tried to check in twice at 10am & noon. We checked our bags with the staff and were told both times that our reservation was in order but we should check in later in the afternoon. At 5:30pm, we were told that Silversmith had no room for us! They said that they could not give us a refund, because "Expedia" had our money. My sister had booked the room and prepaid in full through Hotels.com. They sent us a mile away (as we were walking everywhere, it was not a convenient location) with no compensation other than $10 for cabfare. We called Hotels.com and were told that they couldn't refund our $ because Silversmith already had it!

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend - Great Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: libworld
Reviews.Content: Booked through Groople at a decent rate (for Chicago). Was a bit worried after reading some of these reviews. But, no problem. Hotel rooms were spacious and furnished nicely. Great location, near the theaters, park, and restaurants. Only wierd thing was no glasses, only mugs, in rooms. Staff were all gracious and friendly. Kudos to Shannon, Patty and Vincent especially. Already planning next girls getaway for the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Silversmith”
Reviews.Author: SACH
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a wonderfully convenient location. My only real complaint would be that the hallway doors are very loud so that you hear all your neighbors comings and goings. Could get annoying with the wrong neighbors! At the moment access to the front door is awkward due to sidewalk construction but it was not a real problem. Valet parking needs 20-30 minutes advance notice to get you your car. Several alternative parking areas within two blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkWing
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here for two nights with family. This is a beautiful restored landmark. Hallways are beautifully decorated and clean. Our room was immaculate, well-decorated, very pleasant. The main thing to be aware of is that this is a typical urban center hotel, which means the rooms are small. It's a tight fit for two adults and two teenagers, but the location and pleasantness of the hotel make up for that. If you are driving to the hotel, be aware that there is no parking adjacent to the hotel. A valet service is available at the entrance, but you may have to call the desk or send someone inside to let them know you are outside. Currently, there's some construction on the street in front of the hotel, which makes this a bit more difficult. Overall, a wonderful place to stay. A great value in the heart of the city. It's only a short walk to the Art Institute or Millennium Park.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret In Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: jegaPentwater_Mi
Reviews.Content: WOW!! This great hotel is the best kept secret we have found in Chicago. This is a charming place with beautiful rooms. The suite we had was great with plenty of room. A huge bathroom and beautiful bedroom were an added bonus. We surely were not expecting such a surprise. It is close to the L on Wabash but if you ask for a room toward the back you will have no problem with any noise. The rooms were large, clean and the staff were extremely friendly. The price is much more reasonable than any place we have found in Chicago. We definately will be going back when we visit Chicago again. Another convenience is the fact that it is located in the theater district so many theaters are within walking distance. Great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: ckron79
Reviews.Content: Silversmith is tucked away on Wabash - in the center of downtown, walking distance to Millenium Park, Michigan Ave and State St. Plenty of places to eat and bars around. The room was pretty basic, but nice. The hotel itself seemed very empty, not much going on. Great place downstairs for breakfast - Adaâ€™s - and drinks at the 14 Karat Lounge. Millerâ€™s Pub is a few doors down - great place for drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: PlakaCt
Reviews.Content: Don't let the reviews fool you, when the low price seems too good to be true, it is. We arrived and were very disappointed with the condition of the hotel and the neighborhood, and when we saw our room we decided we were out of there. The manager, Jeremy, said that since we booked on the internet (on their website, not some third party) they would not refund our money even though we were dissatisfied and were moving. He was obviously used to having this arguments with unhappy guests. Luckily we booked with AMEX and will dispute the charges but what a terrible start to our trip to Chicago. I even offered to let them keep the money for the first night and refund the second night, but they wouldn't do it. Can't deal with people who take your money for something and won't give it back when you tell them you are unhappy and won't be using their facility.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: DragonKaty
Reviews.Content: It seemed like such a promising start: they had a room ready for me when I got there very early. Sure it was a queen, and I'd paid for a king, but I could put up with that. Sadly, it was all down hill from there... After heading out for the day I returned to the room for the evening and tried to set up a wake up call, but for some reason the phone in the room was set to 'rotary' and while I could hear it churning, it wasn't connecting with anyone. I gave up and set alarm on my watch and went to bed. But I couldn't sleep because of the stratchy things in the bed: turn out they were toe nail clippings. Yep, the bed had only been made after the last user, the sheets hadn't been cleaned. Disgusting. In the morning I went for a shower, but the setting on the shower head was stuck between two settings and wouldn't move. All I was getting was a dribble by the one cluster of massaging jets: the other two clusters were too full of gunk to send water out. DISGUSTING! I told the Front Desk this (again, phone not working... had to go down in person), and when I returned for my second (and thankfully last) night the shower was working properly and the phone working. And the sheets appeared to be clean. Unfortunately the rest of the bedding wasn't so good. I had noticed it was cold the previous night, but there was a major cold snap on in Chicago so I just put it down to that. That day, however, had been mild and so there shouldn't be a problem. That is when I really looked at the bedding (other than the toenail-ridden sheets) and discovered there was only one blanket on the bed. A summer-weight blanket. And the bed spread was also a summer weight blanket. Also, no extra blanket in the closet, as you'd expect in most hotels. I spent the first half of the night waking up every hour, getting up and turning the heat up in the room and then tucking myself back in and hoping it would get better. Finally, around 2 am I got up, maxed out the heating, folded the blankets over a few times and got fully dressed before returning to bed. I managed to sleep the rest of the night until my early wakeup call. When I tried to check out using the on-screen process it said that it could not be done. Great! Another stop when I am trying to rush out... I go to the front desk and am told that I couldn't check out that way because I had prepaid the hotel through a third party, and I had to pay for the incidentals. I said, yes, but I gave you a credit card for the incidentals at check in. It is the credit card that you just finished saying "should I just leave it on your ...... card?" I am treated to a lecture on how if I had gone through the hotel to book my room this wouldn't have happened. Way to punish your customers! To add insult to injury, I am coming off the elevators on the first floor and the bell man walks by, heading away from the front door. I am almost at the front door (a good 30 feet away) and I hear "Hey you! Do you want a cab?" yelled at me. No, I don't want a cab, what I want is something to help me forget the horrible stay I had at this disgusting hotel. P.S. It is a day later and I now have a major head cold. Wonder why...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinGal_08
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in January. Got a great last minute rate through the hotel's website. I took the "L" from Midway airport, got off at Madison station, and was literally steps from the hotel entrance. The location absolutely cannot be beat! Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, comfortable and spacious, esp. the bathroom. The noise from the "L" was not bothersome to me. I would definitely stay at the Silversmith again -- very highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and price!”
Reviews.Author: LauAnnNor
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came to Chicago for a girls getaway weekend/30th birthday party. We found the Silversmith hotel on hotels.com. The price was very attractive at $80/night and the photos looked really nice. We knew we didn't need a large hotel because we wouldn't be there very much so we went with the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly upon check-in, thanking my friend three times for booking at the Silversmith. The concierge was more than helpful with our bags, hailing us cabs, welcoming us back to the hotel, wishing us a good day when we left, and giving us accurate information about the city. The room was much larger than expected and the high ceilings were a plus. The bathroom was large enough for all 3 of us to get ready in the same mirror at the same time. Most of you girls know how difficult it is to get ready at the same time in one bathroom! We found that very convenient. We are already planning our next weekend trip hopefully in April and we would book here again in a minute. There is a cafe attached to the hotel called Ada's. We ate breakfast there on Saturday morning but wouldn't recommend it due to pricing. The food was good - service was slow - but the prices were outrageous. $4.50 for ONE egg... a block to your left is Dunkin Donuts and a block to your right is McDonalds. All in all though - we were very pleased! Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Silversmith is Good as Gold!”
Reviews.Author: PAMiAM43
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults, 11- and 13-year old girls) along with another family of 4, recently returned from a 2-night New Years stay at the Silversmith. We booked on Priceline...2 standard rooms were $86/night (each). Super value. Stay was excellent all the way around. Rooms and beds were very, very comfortable and spotless. Had two corner rooms at the back of the building, 4th floor. No hint of train noise (of course, our windows were closed at this time of year). Bathrooms are huge, towels plentiful, shower function was perfect. Lobby is spacious and gracious, but not overbearing. Very good coffee/tea in the a.m. Staff were polite, helpful and prompt. Walking distance (even in 25ish degree weather) to State St. shopping, Milennium Park and Mag Mile. Attentive door staff and bell captain. Good elevator security. Building itself has been carefully renovated...very lovely. Will stay here again without question. A really sweet oasis. Note: check out nearby Pizano's for delicious, cozy, family-friendly Italian and Chicago style pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Silversmith Hotel & Suites is Great”
Reviews.Author: bjbruno
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a comfortable smaller hotel (only 140 rooms/suites), in a great location, consider the Silversmith. We just returned from a long week-end at the Silversmith, and we couldn't have been more pleased (our second visit to this hotel). We had two young granddaughters with us (7 and 9 years old), and the location was such that we didn't have to walk more than a few blocks where ever we went. Silversmith is on Wabash, which is between Michigan and State, and Monroe and Madison streets. Millennium Park is only a block from the hotel. The orange line stop is almost at the door, and the red line is about a block away. Yes, there is some noise from the orange train line, and yes, you can hear it in the room, however, we didn't find it to be a problem. During our stay we walked through one of the larger hotels, and it felt like we were in "Grand Central Station". The Silversmith lobby is spacious, warm, welcoming, and very quiet. Monday through Thursday they serve evening desserts from 8:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. They also have a complementary computer center which we used. We parked at the Millennium Parking Garage; cost is $22.00 for 24 hours. The parking entrance in on Columbus off Monroe, and about three blocks from Silversmith (we had no problems driving into the city). Just be certain you know exactly where you parked your car; the parking garage is huge with several entrances. The visitor center is located in the Cultural Center located at the corner of Randolph and Michigan (only two blocks from Silversmith). There is a CTA machine at the visitor's center (for multiple day transit passes), which can be used for the bus or trains. 3-day pass was $12.00 for unlimited rides. We used buses on Michigan as well as State streets, and the red line. We had a wonderful time showing our young granddaughters around Chicago, and look forward to a return visit. If you have any questions about the hotel or what we did with our two young granddaughter (don't miss the Children's Museum at Navy Pier, it was wonderful), please know I would be happy to respond. Chicago is very easy to get around, with so much to do, and by all means consider staying at the Silversmith!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tutupr24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the silversmith with my parents over the summer, and over all the hotel was a good choice. ***TIP*** We had a discount bc my father works for the government, you have to mention it during booking and then show proper ID, at the web site there is a part where they mention this, which is easily missed, so be sure to use this to your advantage The hotel is practically steps away from the train stop Good and Bad depending on where ur room is, i had already read reviews mentioning this so i made a point on telling the person on the front desk to get us a room away from the train!!! At the lobby...which is very nice...there is a hidden buisness center with two computers and a printer which came in handy, so i was able to use it to print out the flight tickets and other web surfing stuff...but i must say the connection isnt that fast...but the access to computers was very convinient The room was very clean...which is always one of my biggest concerns...and the view was not great...unless u consider looking out into an aley amusing...but overall it was good the bathroom was huge and that was really comfortable when you have 3 people wanting to use the sink in the morning the beds......oh the beds....thats the only negative....there were two double beds...which really r not that comfortable for two persons to sleep in, and the beds where kind of stiff as in very stiff.....but everything cant be perfect!! at least the sheets were clean The hotel is at a really good location....i already mentioned the train stop....and the bus stop was i think about two blocks away....there was a wallgreens 3 or 4 blocks away...there were places to have breakfast subway, dunking donuts...a nice cafe place that i cant remember the name...and it was really really close to millenium park!! Ohhhhh!!!!! and i dont remember exactly where but i know it was to the right if u have the hotel entrance in front of u and taking a left there is Jareds!!!!! the popcorn place....u must go if u hadnt been there best popcorn!!! the cheddar one and the caramenl one are superb!!! Also...when i stayed the hotel had like a midnight snack going on...get there early and take advantage...they have cheescake, cookies, cake it was really good...the coffee...not so good , but it was nice really overall the hotel was a good choice!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with The Silversmith”
Reviews.Author: DB418
Reviews.Content: stayed at The Silversmith for a few days in Nov. Loved it. Was convenient to just about everywhere.
