I was initially concerned about the noise with construction going on but it was not a problem for us. We stayed on the 10th floor in a king size suite and was very pleased with the room. Bathroom is huge! Two minor complaints: the fitness room was pretty tiny , but for a few days, the 2 treadmills were fine....and natural light is limited due to where the hotel is located..but with such a great city to explore, enjoy the natural light outside! would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sara1363
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Silversmith Hotel & Suites the weekend of Oct 17th with my boyfriend. The hotel is so perfectly located. Just a short walk to Millennium park, Sears Tower, most of the major attractions, great shopping, and eating. The staff were extremely kind and went out of their way to be helpful. Especial kudos goes to Ms. Peggy at the concierge, and Frank at the front. They were the most wonderful, warm, helpful and amazing people to talk to. The hotel was extremely clean, quiet, roomy, and comfortable. It was the perfect weekend with the perfect place to stay. I absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a wonderful time in Chicago. This hotel is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: HappyHappyH0lidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Silversmith for 4 nights in July 2008. We thought this was an really good place to stay. The location was excellent - a very short walk from Millenium Park. The room was very clean, had excellent air conditioning, was very spacious, and had use of a free internet connection. Although the hotel is right on the road, we couldn't hear any noise from our room. Overall, I thought this was an excellent place to stay at a reasonable price. I would stay there again, and it is an easy place to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ok to stay but difficult to get into...”
Reviews.Author: wolfinscotland
Reviews.Content: Let me start with something positive: the location. Situated in "The Loop" it makes it a top overnight accommodation for a tourist trip in Chicago. Most of the main tourist attractions are just a stonethrow away. Unfortunately, this has its downsides as well: There is no parking, so if you travel by car, you depend on one of the public garages or the hotel's valeting service, both rather hefty in price. At the time we travelled, there were building works on the streets around the hotel, which didn't make it easier. Second downside: getting in. We had booked our one-night stay via Orbitz in advance, but somewhere along the lines the hotel had lost the relevant paperwork. So we had to prove to them that we had actually booked our place there, which was annoying to say the least + we weren't necessarily treated with the utmost respect. After re-iterating that we booked via web and getting the reference number out of the publicly available computers there, they finally found the booking. The rooms were nice and there are pretty much all facilities you would expect, including a ice cube and a soft drink vending machine. All in all: If you have all your booking references with you and are prepared to drive into a public garage to go to the hotel to check in, then a stay at the Silversmith should be pretty much ok.

Reviews.Title: “Loved out stay”
Reviews.Author: blatz911
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I went for a "girlfriend" long weekend getaway. We found that the Silversmith fit our needs perfectly. We had a small suite style room which allowed for space yet conversation as well. The beds were extremely comfortable, the bathroom was huge, and the room was perfectly clean. The location of the Silversmith was perfect with Millenium Park, the Art Institute and shopping within short walking distance. Everything else is either a somewhat longer walking distance or a very short cab ride away. The staff was great--all very friendly and helpful. There were many restaurants in the area that we wanted to sample but we did have breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was cooked to order and delicious. One note of caution: We easily took the Orange Line from Midway to exit right in front of the Silversmith however as of 9/27 the El station in front of the hotel has been closed for construction. We took a pleasant cab ride to Midway for our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Light Sleepers Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: littleones28
Reviews.Content: I had read about the noise problem due to the trains running next to the hotel and I had requested a room in the back. This did not minimize the noise problem. I couldn't sleep because I heard the trains go by every 5 minutes or so. The rooms are suites and are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your vacation...Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Chelledan03
Reviews.Content: We booked thru hotels.com (Mistake #1). When the 4 of us got to the Silversmith they did not have a room with two beds for us. They had a choice of two VERY small rooms with one bed and a roll-a-way bed. They did not even offer for us to have both rooms. When we said this is not acceptable they said that they couldn't do anything about it since we booked thru hotels.com. We were only guaranteed a room, not a room with two beds. The L train is right in front of the hotel and kind of loud. The night we were there there was a shooting in that neighborhood. We only stayed there one night and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ClydeeCat
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs! I booked a suite for my husband, nephew and me at this hotel in February. When I arrived on Friday, Aug. 1 at 11:00 am to check-in, I was told by the front desk clerk that they didn't have early check-in, which was fine -- or so I thought. I told the clerk that we wouldn't be able to get back to the hotel until after 9 pm that evening and she said that would not be a problem. However, when we returned at 9 pm,we were informed that no rooms were available, despite the fact we had arrived early, checked our bags, and valet-ed our car. Why did the front desk clerk tell me my later check-in would be fine? To their credit, they had reserved a room for me at another hotel eight blocks away, which seemed promising, but they weren't sure what kind of room it was. So they had to call the hotel and discovered the new room had only one bed. Where was our nephew going to sleep? They refused to pay for a second room to accommodate him. Throughout this interaction, the manager was decidedly non-sympathetic and non-empathetic (the desk clerk did the best she could under the circumstances). He never admitted the hotel made a mistake, he never said he was sorry for our inconvenience, he never offered us additional compensation beyond paying for the inadequate room at another hotel. In fact, he had quite an attitude. He did not seem to care in the least that he had ruined our trip, which was a Christmas gift to our nephew. The only empathetic people were the valet guys, who were very nice. We found out that at least two other parties had also had their reserved rooms given away that evening. Because of the rude management, deceptive (or, at the very least, incredibly uninformed) front desk staff, lack of professionalism, lack of customer service and general sense that they don't really care if a customer has a positive experience or not, I will never, never stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ajb1207
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith Hotel was in my humble opinion a fantastic place to stay. The hotel offers great accommodation in a historical building right in the heart of downtown Chicago without having to pay extortionate downtown prices. We stayed in the city at the beginning of July 2008 on the way to Las Vegas. The hotel is ideally placed to explore this wonderful city. I had read many reviews stating their was noise from the loop. This is the historic overhead railway. All I can say is I slept like a log every night and didnt hear a thing. Granted when you walk out onto Wabash Avenue the loop is directly in front of you and YES it can be noisy but tell me any city centre in the world that isnt noisy. A little tip as well...for a great meal take a right out of the entrance, walk two blocks and you come to Millers. Fantastic food with a great atmosphere. Would definately stay here again. My next trip to Chicago cant come soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything”
Reviews.Author: T_Norton
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled to Chicago for 4th of July weekend for the Taste of Chicago. Let me just say that the location of the hotel was outstanding. It is literally 2 blocks from Michigan Ave and Millenium Park, approx. a 5-10 min. walk from Grant Park and 1 block from State Street shopping. There's a Garrett Popcorn shop around the corner in addition to several other restaurants, shops, etc. Also the El is right outside the hotel door. Here's a tip, for convenience fly into Midway Airport and take the short train ride (orange line) to and from the hotel for $2 each way to save money on transportation. Great for downtown Chicago access!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: taxman1234
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. We had a king suite. The extra room, with the sitting area was nice after a long day of walking in Chicago. Location was excellent. We rode the El in from O'hare, take the blue to green and you get off a stones throw away from the entrance. If you do take the El, there are no elevators at that stop so luggage might be a problem for some. The El tracks were outside our window, but the noise was not too bad. The complimentary desserts at night were excellent. We booked our trip through priceline, no problems we stayed for eight nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ourlabs
Reviews.Content: I chose this property because of its downtown loop location. I wanted to be within walking distance to The Art Institute and the Harris Theater. I was only staying in town for a couple nights and was not trying to see it all! My room was very large, well furnished, clean and quiet. In spite of it being right under the El train; my room was very quiet - I had a view of a brick wall but it was quiet. All in all, I would stay there again. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom is really spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Silversmith for Chicago Blues Festival”
Reviews.Author: sanmig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silversmith over the week-end of Chicago Blues Festival and before embarking on Route 66. We arrived at O'Hare and at the suggestion of others on TA took the public transport option, easy access at airport, journey was swift and cheap, with just one change at Clarke and Lake, the train stopped at Madison and Wabash which is just about outside the doors of Hotel, slight difficulty in bumping suitcases down the wooden stairs but not a real problem. Check in was swift and efficient, room located on seventh floor. Room was spacious, v. well decorated and spotlessly clean. Bed linen, towels and robes were of excellent quality. The 'fridge was a useful addition to the room for keeping drinks cool, store for soft drinks, beer, wine and snacks just across the street. The deli which is attached to Hotel was convenient for dinner on our first night, good selection of American cuisine at a v. reasonable price. There are a selection of restaurants in the immediate vicinity from steaks to burgers to pizzas. Despite ongoing work around Hotel and the train line just outside we weren't disturbed by any noise what so ever, you may just hear a swoosh! in the distance as the train approaches, which probably wouldn't wake the lightest sleeper. Alltogether a very good option for a Hotel in Chicago, close to Grant Park and all City centre attractions, we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Considering the Alternatives”
Reviews.Author: JonCllns
Reviews.Content: If you want a downtown hotel in Chicago and not go completely broke this is probably the place for you. It is literally a block away from Millennium Park and just a few blocks down Michigan Ave. from the Magnificent Mile. My group made the mistake of booking through Expedia, so we were not guaranteed to receive the two double beds we needed. All they had was a room with a king bed, but they gave us a roll-away without charge. The hotel is in a rather shady part of town (right under the L-train), however, the hotel is very secure and we did feel safe there. As other reviews on this site have indicated, the L-train is right outside the front of the hotel. They informed me that one way to avoid being booked by the L is to request a room with two double beds. All of those rooms are on the opposite side of the hotel from the L. Our room was off to the side, so we could hear the L, but honestly it sounded more like a quiet rain storm. We actually didn't mind it. The staff is a bit stone faced, but once you engage them they open up and are very nice. Maybe that's just a Chicago thing! Very nice hotel. If you are looking for a hotel downtown that is lower on the continuum for downtown hotels, than this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: volleyflavor
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Expedia, and, because it was important to us to have 2 beds, confirmed with Expedia, and with the hotel, that we had booked a room with 2 beds. When we arrived, however, all they had was rooms with one bed. After some discussion, the front desk person booked us into a suite, with a king and a pullout couch, which was nice. Admittedly, I pulled the "I am 6 months pregnant card" to get them to do it, but hey, at least it worked. Our room was on the 6th floor, about 3 floors above the train. It was much noisier than I expected, given the other reviews I have seen. I imagine if you lived there, you would get used to it, but since we don't, it was distracting and noisy. The hotel is located 1 block from Millenium Park and one block from the huge Macy's in the old Marshall Field's building. All in all, a great area, although not super close to the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Patricia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days in June 08. This was probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We were a little concerned about some of the previous reviews concerning the train noise, but did not experience it. The entrance to the hotel is only a single door and small canopy on the west side of Wabash, so it is easy to miss. The lobby is up the elevators on the 2nd floor. Rooms start on the 3rd floor. The hotel is horseshoe shaped, open to the south, and our room was on the inside. There are about 15 rooms per floor. On our floor (6th), rooms 601-605 faced east to Wabash, and the 'L' train is right outside, so I would avoid those, especially on the lower floors. The only train & street noises we heard, and only when the A/C was off, was a short, muffled, 10 second sound every few minutes, kind of like what you hear sitting in the airport terminal when a plane takes off in the distance. The room was fantasic. Very tastefully decorated in classic Frank Lloyd Wright art deco style. The details of the room were absolutely perfect, like is was completed yesterday. Houskeeping was extraordinary. The bed was very comfortable, but the pillows were thin. All of the staff was very nice and professional. An overall excellent experience! You have to eat breakfast at the Pittsfield Cafe, in the lobby of the Pittsfield Bldg, one block north of the opposite side of Wabash. Closed on Sundays. How about two eggs, bacon, & two big pancakes for $5.55? We will stay here again on our next trip. The train to/from O'Hare stops 2 blocks west (Madison) and costs $1.75 from the airport. Hope you have as great of a stay as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NonReven
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Chicago for our 15th anniversary. A friend at work suggested we stay at the Silversmith as they had a $99 deal on Travel Zoo. It was a great experience. The Bellman and Front Desk are very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Even though the hotel is right next to the L train, we could not hear it in our room. The location could not be better. We went to go see Wicked - the play, and could easily walk to and from the theater. It is easy to get anywhere down town with the Visitor Pass for the publick transportation. We would definitely stay there again and highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: worktravelin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for work on May 20 and 21, 2008. We were brought in by a bell hop that took our luggage for us. We had excellent service at the front desk. The room was very nice and clean. The bed and pillows were very comfy! The hotel is located right by the train tracks, but I couldn't hear the train from my room and it didn't bother me at all. My coworker could hear it in her room though, so I guess it just depends on where you are in the building. They offered free internet on two computers in the lobby, which I greatly appreciated! Most hotels that I stay in charge for the internet. They also had a dessert hour both nights of my stay and offered cheesecake and freshly baked cookies. The hotel is located near a lot of great shopping and the theatre district. We were able to get a cab right away whenever we needed one. I really don't have any complaints about this hotel. I would recommend it and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FYI: Major Construction”
Reviews.Author: bierdude
Reviews.Content: While I agree with the positive comments posted here, beware that this hotel is located on Wabash with the "L" loop train tracks right outside. Currently, there is round-the-clock construction going on (rail replacement, etc). Heavy construction noise all night (trucks, jackhammers, chainsaws, etc). I don't know if this was just over the weekend (we were there May 9 - 11) or if it will continue during the week. Might be better if you have a room on the backside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Nonprofit_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation via Orbitz for an out-of -town guest, which requires the full payment of the reservation. However, I received a call from Orbitz at 3:30 p.m. today saying that the hotel couldn't receive my guest and that a full refund was my only option. So my guest was left homeless and I didn't get an explanation or apology from the hotel for the inconvenience. Please don't stay here unless you want to be without a room when you arrive. The hotel won't care if you paid in advance or not.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: octscotts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just lovely. From the moment we arrived, the service was wonderful. Everybody was so pleasant, helpful, and quick to offer suggestions. I read some reviews that the hotel was outdated. After staying there 5 days, I'm trying to figure out where that was. The hotel is furnished in beautiful old oak. Perhaps they don't like that look? The room was immaculate. The bathroom has gorgeous marble floors and countertops and is quite large, which was a nice surprise. As others have mentioned, the beds were fabulous. The pillows were fluffy, and the bedding was soft and warm. The comforter was more like a down comforter as opposed to those dreadful "cotton flower bedspreads" you get at a lot of places. Our room faced Wabash and the El is right there. We were never bothered by it and we were on the 10th floor, so we were pretty much even with the tracks. The location is fine depending on what you're there for. You're in the heart of the loop, where the financial and theatre districts are located. You're also only about 4-5 blocks west of Millenium Park. If you want to go uptown, it's a good little walk, or a $8 cab ride. Your best best, however, is to walk one block on State Street and take the redline to Michigan Avenue's shopping. This is my 4th stay to Chicago because of business and I've stayed at 4 different hotels in 4 different areas. This was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could go back everyday...”
Reviews.Author: CreveCoeurSam2008
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean. The staff was so nice. I think that this hotel was phenomonal. I had a great stay. They were very nice to children. The lobby was very nice and relaxing. It was a great weekend stay. Ask for Patty or Shannon because they were so kind. Bob was a great bellman. The Doorman was also very nice. I think the Silversmith Hotel is a great choice when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, clean, friendly and convienient”
Reviews.Author: KCinKY
Reviews.Content: I loved the Silversmith! The location was convienient. It is just a few doors down from the Palmer House. The whole hotel is decorated beautifully. The celings are at least 9 ft tall. There are floor to celing velvet drapes in the guest rooms. I loved all the light fixtures in the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bed was VERY comfortable and had lots of pillows. The bathroom was very spacious and clean. The entire hotel was immaculately clean. Even the ice machine, vending room was spotless. There was a desk area in the room and the hotel offers free wireless internet access. The street outside is under construction and the EL train is located right outside the front of the hotel. Neither of those bothered me during my stay. We had a total of 3 people staying in the room. The sleeping part of the room was not really large, but adequate. The comfortable feeling made up for the less than large space.

Reviews.Title: “No resolutions to problems by hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: ConventionLady
Reviews.Content: We called well in advance to request a room overlooking Wabash on the 7th or higher floor and also requested an early check in. When we got there we were told no early check in and they gave us a room overlooking the top of the building next store which was overgoing some kind of noisy construction. When we call the desk and asked to be moved we were told that they had no other rooms available as there was a convention going on and all the rooms had been reserved. We were attending this convention and had reserved a room????? Teleprompter in room said free bottled was available in the room, when I called because no water was in the room they told me the service was no longer available. The room was clean, the bathroom large. The hotel itself was somewhat dated but not upleasant. The location was fantastic, just around the corner from the theater district, which is probably the only thing that would make me go back. There is a deli and small bar on the lower lever. The bar is small and with very uncomfortable seating and windows looking out onto the street. Certainly not the type of lounge bar to relax in after a long day. The deli was nice. There was a nice gas fireplace in the check in level, however the room was so dark it was hard to sit and read the newspaper. Just o.k. with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagogirl112
Reviews.Content: We used some "Thank You" points to stay at this hotel for a little getaway in the city. We live in the suburbs, so we were familiar with the area. What a great hotel! It's tucked away, so you may walk or drive right by and not even notice it. But that would be a mistake. The room was beautiful, clean and very large. The bathroom had a beautiful jet-tub and separate shower. The front desk staff was fabulous and had great recommendations. Don't be afraid of the L-tracks, we didn't hear them at all. This hotel is actually only a block away from the Palmer House Hilton, so it's close to shopping and the theater district. Overall, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “This place is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: B0pper
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a hidden gem right in the Loop! If you blink you'll miss it, but what a find inside! There is no concern about being right on top of the El tracks, I couldn't hear a thing! The rooms were clean, the bathroom was huge! The location is fabulous, walking distance to many things right in the loop, theaters, shopping , art institute, millenium park etc. Convenient, undergound parking in Millenium park (1block away). I'd highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but billing NIGHTMARES!”
Reviews.Author: jen2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Silversmith over Easter weekend, March 2007. Booked a Travelzoo special via their website. Upon checking in, was first told they could not locate my reservation, then they insisted on payment despite my reservation receipt showing I had paid in full at time of reservation. I was told their were only taking card for incidentals but after returning home noticed I had been billed again for entire stay. Front desk refused to provide at checkout stating the "third party site" I booked through would have to provide receipt. Calls to resolve duplicate billing were ignored and eventually filed dispute through cc to resolve. Having said all that, I really liked the hotel. Concierge Peggy was great, rooms were very clean and nicely furnished. El station was directly in front of hotel. King suites are good sized and deli on site had decent food. I tried to give the hotel another try and booked for Easter 2008 but then cancelled over a month in advance due to change in plans. Hotel again billed my credit card as a no show, despite my cancelling through their website and having a cancellation number. So nice hotel, but DON'T STAY HERE unless you want to be billed and billed and billed. Read other reviews, it's not just me!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dryad-fw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silversmith for a girl's weekend in February. Everything about our stay was pleasant. The room was exactly what we reserved, it was very clean, especially the bathroom, and very spacious, as we had a suite. Check in and check out was a breeze, with friendly and professional front desk attendants, and no problems with the billing. We liked the added security of needing a hotel key card to access any floor above the lobby. I visit Chicago three or four times a year, and usually stay at the Palmer House Hilton (basically next door) but for the value and positive experience beginning to end, this is now my preferred hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a jewel....shhh, don't tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Kimfor7
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith Hotel in Chicago was pure delight. This hotel was found by reading online reviews of about 40 hotels in the downtown Chicago district. I had stayed at two of the major hotels, meaning large chains, on prior trips and was looking for something a bit different. The reviews that people write are difficult to understand at times, especially the ones that had written about not finding the front entrance to the hotel. It couldn't be more obvious! Flags flying overhead with the name Silversmith printed on them, and the brass in-lay on the threshold as you open the front door reads SILVERSMITH! This hotel offered so much style, character, and class throughout. I stayed for 2nights, during the week. The room, with 2 double beds, was gorgeous, and roomy....very roomy! Ceilings were 12 feet tall, and there was plenty of closet space, a frig to use with bottled water in it, big screen TV, and a gorgeous bathroom with marble everywhere and white robes! I will stay here again. It was right around the corner from the theatre showing Jersey Boys. The L was NOT, in any way, a huge noise issue. Slept great as the beds and linen were first rate. Staff and help all very helpful! Am looking forward to another stay in December!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: AK_biz_traveler
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith was a wonderful find through Tripadvisor for a girls weekend in Chicago! We all went to college in Chicago and know the area well so a hotel in the loop was very convenient. After reading reviews of other hotels we decided to spend a little bit more for a hotel that goes just beyond the basics, to make sure we weren't in mold, mildew and bad service. What we got was much more! Upon checking in, the room we requested, two double beds, was not availble in non-smoking so we had the option to have a suite with a pull-out bed. We took it and were very pleased. The room was spacious with two small closets, two TVs and a very spacious bathroom with plenty of lighting and a large, beautiful granite counter top and imported toiletries. A wired internet was available at the desk and offered a quick connection, although wireless was not available in the room. The El stop is just outside the hotel and we walked to Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park, Auditorium Theatre, Macys and more. We only took a taxi to save time when traveling far. I asked for assistance on two occasions and the hotel did not fail. Upon my late arrival on a Friday night after 11 PM I asked for a late-night restaurant recommendation and the front desk suggested a few in the area. When I mentioned that I was pregnant and looking for a milkshake he offered to walk to the store and bring it back for me! When I checked out and asked the doorman for the closest El stop to the O'Hare blue line, with an elevator, he thought for a while and could not think of a stop with an elevator. The valet parking guy was next to him and said there was only one flight of stairs at the stop 3 blocks away and he volunteered to walk me there and even took my bags down the street and down the stairs. This was a very kind gesture, and I don't think he even noticed that I was pregnant.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience until we got the bill”
Reviews.Author: chicagoshopper08
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience with the hotel and staff until we received our credit card bill. Our bill at check-out time was correct but when we received our credit card bill they charged us twice for one night during our stay. After about 2 weeks of calling the hotel and conveniently the person that we needed to talk to was never there and never returned any of our messages, we finally turned it over to our credit card company to take care of, thankfully it was on our American Express. It is now February and we stayed at the Silversmith in November and the credit card company has still not been able to reach anyone at the hotel who can resolve the charge. I wouldn't recommend staying here unless you are willing to pay double price, in the already overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Experience”
Reviews.Author: SpicaFI
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent a Saturday night at this hotel. We were in Chicago checking out SAIC and this proved to be an ideal locaton to walk to the Art Institute of Chicago as well as Millenium Park. Extremely easy to take the train from OHare to a stop no more than three or four blocks from the hotel. Hotel was clean, attractive, and the staff where competent. The staff at the front entrance gave us lots of good advice on food and getting around. Great experience overall. I plan to go back sometime to visit Chicago with the rest of my family and will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid service, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: silverthief2
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed here about a year ago, but I just had my first stay since the Silversmith became independent. All was fine; the room (916) was clean and had a great bed, the front desk folks and bellhops were courteous and attentive, and the internet worked fine (though not wireless). I also paid for several rooms for my colleagues and the front desk made the process easy. The location is fine although it's right under the El tracks; request a room away from the train if you're concerned about the noise (I was on the opposite side of the hotel and didn't hear anything).

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateLovr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location. This hotel is on Wabash, a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue. If you don't mind walking (which if you are visiting Chicago, it is assumed you will be doing a lot of walking), the location is great. It is attached to a deli which has a wonderful menu. Even if we don't stay at this hotel next time we visit, we would definitely eat at "Adaâ€™s Famous Deli and Restaurant ." Check in was a breeze. Our room was very clean and roomy, however we were located directly over the El tracks and it was very noisy. We went back to the front desk and asked to be moved and they were very nice and moved us to another room away from the El. We had a suite and it turns out they upgraded us to a larger suite. Each staff member we encountered was very polite and courteous. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: skeeterintexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silversmith in October. Yes, there was construction out front but the location can't be beat and we got a fabulous rate. I believe they said construction was supposed to be completed by Nov. 15 but call to make sure. It holds an old world sort of charm. The rooms were nice size with tall celings and the bathroom is HUGE! There were plenty of pillows and towels which can sometimes a problem at other hotels. The staff was sweet and attentive and don't forget Dessert Night w/cheesecake and sweets. YUMMY! If the price is right, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendylynn68
Reviews.Content: I booked the Silversmith on a special rate and was pleasantly surprised that they upgraded us to a suite. The room was very nice and quiet. We were on the 10th floor and could hear the EL train as only a low rumble. I can see where someone on a lower floor might be bothered by the noise. The bell captain and the front desk attendants were very nice and very helpful with questions. The location is close to Macy's and within walking distance of the Art Institute and other places. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mold and Mildew Problem!”
Reviews.Author: sharla
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this property and, I wanted to wait for a response from the hotel before I wrote my review but, 3 weeks later and no response. The Silversmith is a beautiful property in a very convenient location with a gret bar and deli on the property. The room and bath were large and nicely updated but we just couldn't get past the horrible smell in the room. This was not the 'room closed too long and a little musty' smell. This was a 'knock you to the floor when you open the door' smell! Overpowering mold and mildew stink! We told the front desk as soon as we checked in but they had no other rooms available. We asked that it be cleaned or sprayed and they said yes but, when we returned from dinner it appeared to be exactly as we left it. We went across the street to CVS and purchased 2 cans of Lysol spray and attacked the bath, carpet, drapes, bedding, etc. then left for the evening. We returned to a slightly better smelling room but, really, got very little sleep all night. Mold can raise very serious health problems for many people with any kind of respritory issues and should be taked very seriously! I understand that issues occur when you are running a business but what really bothered me is the way we were just waved off with no compensation or appologies. The staff was polite but ineffective in offering any type of resolution to this problem - even after I completed the 2 surveys they sent me - no response from the hotel what so ever! When booking a 4 star hotel such as the Silversmith, you should be guarenteed a clean and comfortable room. The Silversmith did not meet my expectations for the basics and my valid complaint was not handled well at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor view”
Reviews.Author: mocho
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Silversmith and asked for a quiet room after reading the TripAdvisor reviews. The room was exceptionally quiet but the view out the window was a brick wall. The room was clean and the bedding very nice. The bellhop, front desk, and conciere were very friendly. We booked through Hotwire and paid $89 which for downtown Chicago is a great deal. One hint is to watch for the entrance on the right hand side of the one way street. It is not an easy hotel to find.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you have any choice.”
Reviews.Author: gregsmom_7
Reviews.Content: I would not stay at this hotel again under any circumstances. I was given a card key to my room. However when I got there, it was clearly occupied. Fortunately the person was not in the room at the time, however it was quite unsettling and the hotel had no understanding of why this might bother me. I asked what steps would be taken to insure that nobody would then go into my room. None were given. I was supposed to be in a suite. It was a room. The street is sketchy, and while there are hotel security personnel on the first floor at times, there is no 24 hour coverage. We came back late from a business meeting to find nobody there. Anybody could have followed us into the elevator at the second floor. When my colleague phoned downstairs to arrange a wake up call, nobody answered. This despite the fact that I had called for one seconds before she did. The street construction makes it difficult to get dropped off with bags and the El is noisy to say the least. Do not stay in this hotel if you have any possible options.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: GreakLakes3695
Reviews.Content: There is still construction going on in front of the hotel, making it difficult to find the valet. L-Train runs right outside the hotel - not sure how it could be listed as 4-star hotel with the noise? After checkin we went to our non-smoking room to find someone had just been smoking in the room. We went downstairs to the receptionist to request another room and were told there were no other rooms available. She insisted that we got what we reserved "a non-smoking room." And would not conceed that it was the hotel's problem that someone had just smoked in the room. She offered to spray the room down - but we wouldn't be able to enter the room for an hour. At this point it was 11pm and we were tired from traveling. When we told her we wanted to cancel the room she said we would not get a refund, even though it was the hotel's problem they are not enforcing the no smoking policy. We eventually got a refund through hotels.com, but the Silversmith could use a lesson in hotel management and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “The Silversmith Is An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: tkbama
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend getaway to The Silversmith. After researching the many hotel options in Chicago we settled on the Silversmith for location, value and overall features. When we arrived there was some confusion regarding the room type we were assigned (a standard double) versus the room type we had booked (a suite). Unfortunately there were no suites available for our first night. The manager on duty, Jeremy, was very apologetic and blocked a suite for our remaining 3 nights. He also offered us breakfast at the hotel restaurant for our inconvenience. Since we are a family of four, with college/high school children, this was a reasonable compensation. After breakfast the next morning (which was very good) we moved to our suite which was excellent (featuring a very large bathroom which apparently is not the norm for downtown Chicago). The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The general manager, Jason was very responsive to our needs and also apologetic for our first night inconvenience. Peggy, the concierge, was very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly (calling us all by name after our first meeting). The room was clean and housekeeping was respectful of our schedule. The beds were extremely comfortable and the toiletries were first class. The location is outstanding, within walking distance to shopping, parks and a convenient cab or train ride to many other attractions. The lobby is comfortable and relaxing. I enjoyed the complimentary coffee and paper each morning. The dessert reception the evening we arrived was a nice touch (the cheesecake was delicious). The only negative is really beyond the hotel's control - construction. The sidewalk is torn up in front of the hotel making it a bit difficult to find and unattractive from the exterior. However, I understand that when it is completed it will resemble the look of Michigan and State Streets which are on wither side of Wabash. Even with the construction I would stay at the Silversmith again. It was a minor inconvenience. If you are looking for a good value in a great location with a comfortable, unpretentious setting and the personal attention characteristic of a boutique style hotel this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Super Location”
Reviews.Author: AustinBarb
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay. I had read some reviews and was a little concerned about problems with the reservation based on some of the prior reviews. When we checked in, they thought we were only staying 1 day while we were staying two but they corrected it quickly and with no problems. The room was fabulous. Yes, we could hear a faint rumble of the train but certainly not enough to detract from the room. The location was perfect being so close to both Millenium Park and various train stations. The player piano in the lobby was nice. It would have been nice to be able to get a drink in the hotel somehwere. The restaurant was OK although my husband loved it as he was able to get a sandwich for breakfast. We would not hesitate to book a stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago and the Silversmith Hotel made a perfect mini-vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Iwanttoracebicycles
Reviews.Content: I found and booked a three night stay at the Silversmith Hotel for the last weekend of July through Travelzoo.com. We loved the location downtown and the conveinence to Millenium Park and the transportation options. When we first saw the hotel we thought it might be a little noisy because it is located next to the elevated train downtown loop. Our King Suite on the eighth floor facing the elevated station was very quite and exceeded our expectations in every way. The room was large, clean and modern with a large bathroom, very nice furniture and a great bed that made us feel pampered. The staff was friendly and helpful and made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel lobby was functionable and nice but not a place where you would want to hang out very long, and the fitness center was small but adaquate. I did bring my laptop and was never able to get a wireless connection. It might of helped if I had asked the front desk for assistance. Overall we had a excellent experience at the Silversmith and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dvbrad
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at The Silversmith. Reading the reviews we asked for a quiet room away from the El and I guessed received it as we barely heard it. The construction was a little awkward getting in but that's certainly not the hotel's fault and it's really not that bad. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The room was great. Very clean room, comfortable bed, large bathroom and high ceilings. A really nice room and great value for the price. Centrally located and close to most that Chicago has to offer. Called for some additional coffee and it was brought very promptly. Upon checkout we asked the bellman if he could hold our bags for a few hours. He jokingly said we had 30 days and after that the hotel would have to claim them. Just a nice friendly touch. Based on our experience I would highly recommend The Silversmith. It's our new home when in Chicago. And with our daughter and son-in-law there that will be pretty often.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: clh622
Reviews.Content: I received a notice that the hotel was offering a special rate on rooms for August and I booked online with no problem. This hotel is great. It is in a good loop location with access to the buses and trains and the room was wonderful. Plenty of light, big bathroom, great amenities and comfortable beds. The staff is responsive and very pleasant and even though the hotel is right by the "L" train, you cannot hear a thing in the hotel room. I would highly recommend you consider this hotel when looking for a place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal for the Money”
Reviews.Author: TouringSam
Reviews.Content: They are currently doing construction outside the hotel and to be honest, the entrance a bit obscure. When looking for it, I turned the corner from Madison to Wabash and drove right by the valet, which is RIGHT around the corner. Had to go around again. Couldn't even see the hotel because of the construction fences but the valet pointed us to the hotel, thankfully. Doormen were very friendly, though they didn't seem very informed. We asked them where we could buy a day pass for the El and the first doorman told us a place to try. Then he said, "Well, they might not be open," and then he asked the other doorman. That man gave conflicting information entirely, and finally they decided to call the front desk. No one answered so we went up to find out ourselves. Again, we got different information than either of the doormen gave. In the end we opted to pay the $2.00 fare for a one way ticket. Positives: Rooms were clean. We opted for a suite, which was only a few dollars more than a standard room. We were happy with the choice and happy to have a little extra room. Big bathrooms. Warm blankets. Peggy at the front desk is very helpful and accomodating. Previous reviews say that the El is noisy but we had a room on the inside and it was generally quiet. The whoosh of the El was still heard but it wasn't clanging like other people claimed. I'd ask for a room on the inside and you'll be fine. Location is great! El is right outside. There is a bakery one block down, a pizza place one block up, and Millenium Park is practically across the street. Walk about 5 blocks and you get into Michigan Avenue shopping. How can you complain about that for the price? A few of the negatives: a phone in the room didn't work, a light in the room didn't work. When I called Housekeeping using the "Housekeeping" button on the phone, they said they would bring me two more towels as I requested. 25 minutes later, no towels. I called Housekeeping. No answer. I called the front desk and repeated my request. Towels were brought to me immeadiately. If you're in Chicago for Business or to see a show, this hotel is right in the heart of it. If you want to shop, you might try to get a little closer. If you don't mind walking a little, you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff”
Reviews.Author: kathysong
Reviews.Content: My brother works in Chicago and recommended this hotel. It was our first visit to Chicago and we felt immediately welcomed by the staff there. It's in the loop, with great restaurants all around and very convenient to all public transporation. You don't need to struggle with transit maps, just ask the doorman for help getting to any part of the city. Two blocks away you can have coffee at Centennial Park, two blocks more and you are on the "Magnificent Mile" (though I don't know what's so great about it-- while the architecture is beautiful it's nothing more than an outdoor mall). The bed was perfect, the bathroom large and clean, the evening dessert buffet (free Mon. thru Thurs.) delicious and the concierge extremely helpful. Only problem would be if you had a room in the front of the hotel, as those rooms look out over the elevated train which is very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!!!!”
Reviews.Author: litthome
Reviews.Content: I was so thrilled with my stay there last weekend I had to make sure I put in a good word for this hotel! We went there expecting less than perfection but I can't make one complaint about it unless you count that the entry into the hotel is a little hard to find with the construction fence at the curb. I had to call the front desk to find the valet parking across the street but once I did, it was a piece of cake. Everyone there is friendly, courteous and helpful. All I can say to those who had negative things to say about the staff is maybe you get what you give. We paid an extremely low price based on a Travel Ticker special ($89!) and I expected to get not the best room. Instead of a king room we had a suite (similar to Embassy with a much bigger bathroom) on the 5th floor. It was overlooking the construction and the el but the soft whoosh of the el was not in anyway disturbing. Everything in the room was clean and fresh and the fridge with bottled water was a nice touch. I thought the Mission style was perfect and very relaxing. Even though there was a family with small children on our floor we never heard any noise from other rooms. The hotel location is superb ...tons of shopping, theaters and restaurants just a short walk away. I had to drive several times and never had a bit of trouble getting my car out when I needed it. I really love this place and I have stayed at several nice Michigan Avenue hotels in the last few years. If I can get anywhere close to the price I paid (instead of the $229 quoted on most sites that list this hotel) I will pack my bags again! I LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Silversmith Hotel. I love this hotel. It is located one block from Millenium Park, Michigan Avenue, Lots of Shopping. Super comfortable rooms and beds. The Cheesecake Dessert at night in the lobby is fantastic, and FREE! The staff is very friendly. NOTE: There is a lot of construction going on directly in front of the hotel, but once inside you hardly knew anything was going on. I paid just over 200.00 for my room, ( AAA discount available ) and compared to the other chain hotels in the area like Hilton, Sheraton, etc, they were all over 300.00 and more. Be sure to request a room away from the Train for a good nights rest. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: emcentar
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the Palmer House Hilton this May. The conference rate for the Palmer was more than my employer was willing to pay ($250). So my travel agent found the Silversmith, just around the corner, for a much lower price (about $130). I was prepared for a more 'budget' experience, perhaps even a somewhat seedy one given the price differential, but I was pleasantly surprised. The Silversmith is a very a nicely appointed hotel, and a considerable bargain in that neighborhood. My room was lovely - large enough to get some work done in, a nice comfortable bed, a huge bathroom. It was both larger and considerably nicer than a similarly priced Comfort Inn I'd stayed in on a previous business trip to Chicago. Unlike other reviewers who have complained of noise, I didn't experience any disturbances. The location is great - right in the Loop, and right under the El - excellent access to public transit. I also had no difficulty catching a cab. Overall a great experience for the price, and if I was returning to Chicago again for work, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Once Past The â€œWowâ€� Factorâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: SN1752
Reviews.Content: The property sucks you in & then, when given a little time, the flaws start to show. I was at the Silversmith from 27-29 July 2007 for a wedding in the city (though no festivities took place in the hotel). The Silversmith is no doubt a beautiful hotel, especially in the common areas. The woodwork in the lobby is very nice. My room (# 314) was spacious but had a rather unfortunate view of a back alley (instead of the noisy El), which meant that trash bins were being clanged around at all hours of the night. Once you have a little time you realize that itâ€™s not as spectacular as you thought when you first entered. You notice that the blankets are a little frayed around the edges, that a button or two wonâ€™t work on the TV remote, that some of the finish work in the bathroom needs touching up, that the concierge gives you wrong directions to a restaurant, that the heavy drapes donâ€™t quite block out all the light from the spotlights in the alleyâ€¦ One thing you would expect in such a hotel would be a nicer restaurant than what is on site. â€œAdaâ€™sâ€� is just what it advertises â€“ a deli, & one with decent food. However, there is no quiet place to sit with a drink of have a quiet conversation or a knock-your-socks-off meal. I guess the Silversmith gave up on trying to compete with Michigan Ave for the food scene â€“ what a shame, as they could charge more, get better reviews, & actually compete with other hotels in the area like the Palmer House & the University Club. I would strongly recommend the bar in the hotel called the 14 Karat Lounge. Though loud & packed with people, itâ€™s a welcome respite from a hard day in the city. Tom is a phenomenal bartender who can mix a heck of a drink, give better directions & suggestions than the concierge, & gives you all the courtesies of a regular after you place your first order. I, like others, had some issues with reservations. After they failed to email the reservations 3 times I insisted they fax the reservations to me. It was received shortly thereafter & there were no problems at check-in. I would stay at the Silversmith again, but the price would be a consideration, as there are other hotels in the area that may not be as nice but offer similar amenities at a reduction in cost. The location of the Silversmith is ideal, with Michigan Ave one block away & a public parking garage a half block away on E Monroe saves you from the $37+tip valet fee you would be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Happily Surprised”
Reviews.Author: rn2001
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline, so I didn't choose the hotel when I booked, it got assigned to me, which always makes me a bit worried! And then I had read mixed reviews here, so I wasn't sure what to expect. But I must say I was very happy...my room (404) was huge...I guess it was a suite, though that isn't what I had booked. They had ran out of baby cots, so they sent someone out to another hotel to get us one! The noise from the EL was there as others had noted, but didn't bother me as I had brought earplugs...other then that, it was absolutely quiet, clean and in a great location. Great breakfast at the Corner Bakery next door, plus the EL stops right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: chersolly
Reviews.Content: In Chicago for the LATE RIDE midnight 25-mile bicycle event, we wanted a hotel that was affordable and close to Grant Park, where the course begins and ends. We also wanted a hotel that wouldn't have a problem with us bringing our bicycles into our room. (Yes, last year, the hotel we stayed at would not let us bring the bikes into our room and we worried about them being stolen the entire time.) We booked a King Suite and were upgraded to a King Whirlpool Suite at check-in. After the bicycle ride, I was so grateful for that free tub! We absolutely loved the hotel's Frank Lloyd Wright motif. Our only "problem" was a long line at check-in. The problem was that the woman infront of us was upgraded, free of charge, to a better room and she couldn't understand that it was actually free. Yes, lady, this is something that hotels sometimes do because they overbook. Take the room and move on. We had our *active* toddler daughter with us, so after hearing this woman debate the free room issue for 15 minutes, we just wanted to get our key card and get it to the room. The room - WOW! We've traveled a lot and we've never had a room this nice for what we paid. The ceilings and windows were high. Breathtaking. We didn't want to leave the room come check out time. Hell, it was larger than our first apartment. The bathroom was huge. Shower, whirlpool tub, robes, thick and juicy towels. Bed was comfortable. I would have liked more blankets, but that's because I am a blanket person. No complaints from my daughter and husband. Room service was expensive, but it is at every other hotel as well. Free bottled water in mini-fridge was a nice touch. Great door men at the enterance. This is our hotel from now on for ALL our Chicago trips. (We come down often for cycling events.)

Reviews.Title: “Our Downtown favorite”
Reviews.Author: bcirish
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Silversmith for several years and have found it to be a great place to stay. The location is close to everything. We usually go 2-3 times a year and park the car til we leave. Everyone is very helpful. The rooms are not huge but are well appointed and we are not in the room. It is close enough to walk to shopping, use the trolley for the museums, walk to the theater, walk to the lakefront or a restaurant. We live in the suburbs and know the downtown area and we choose to go to Silversmith when we want to spend time in the city. We have been there at all times of the year and have never had a complaint. The area is very safe at night too.

Reviews.Title: “great location but bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: chicagogirl19
Reviews.Content: got this hotel for $80/night. it had a great location, only 1 block from the art institute and very close to the taste of chicago food festival. it's only 1 block to the "el" for anyone needing public transportation. the staff was very courteous and the room was larger than what we've stayed in before. the bathroom was large and the towels were fluffy. if i had any complaint, it would be that you can hear every door shutting and that was very annoying to me as a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another mishap with the reservation”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra4
Reviews.Content: Because of other reviewers' recommendations, we asked for a room away from the El. We had arrived at 1pm and had to wait until 3pm for a room to be available (understandable). At 3pm, we were given a room that hadn't been cleaned (bed not made, towels scattered on the floor in the bathroom). The room was also dark and dinghy. The front desk clerk was not very nice about our returning to the desk for a cleaned room. After 30 minutes of waiting we were given a clean room. Upon checkout, the front desk had lost all record of the group (corporate) credit card that had been used to secure the room and was presented on the day of arrival by the corporate cardholder, and wasn't able to process the payment unless we gave them our personal credit card (room was part of a conference and the corporate group paid for the room). No manager was available either in person ("he didn't come in today"), or by phone for 3 hours. We had to get someone to come to the hotel (from the conference at another hotel) with the corporate credit card (for the second time) to pay the bill. The clerk kept saying, "there's nothing I can do." This is unacceptable given the $250 a night conference rate. This hotel needs to figure out how to have a functioning computer system.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Dingy, Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Gaychoo
Reviews.Content: We had a similar experience another guest did on this site - we arrived from Los Angeles in the evening and when we got to the hotel the room we were promised had been given to someone else but would be available the next night. When I said we had a confirmed room and showed the woman at the desk our confirmation number she shrugged and said "we can't guarantee the rooms". THEN WHY EVEN BOOK THEM? This woman was unhelpful, quietly rude and didn't care in the least. They finally found a room for us and it was horrible. Dingy, dark, gloomy and the window stared right out at the EL and this was a $400 room!. We went out to dinner and checked out The Hard Rock which was fantastic but booked but their rates were $100 LESS and the place was fantastic! In the morning we decided to leave (and found a room at the Chicago Athletic Club - an affiliate of the Los Angeles Athletic Club where we are members so it was great). The Silversmith had promised to charge us the same rate we were quoted when I made the reservation but when we checked out they charged us $50 more and couldn't take it off the computer. We had to wait for 1/2 an hour while they tried to figure out how to fix this. And to top it all off, our daughter left a shoe in the room and when we called the next day they said they didn't have it. I'm not sure they even looked for it. Anyway, this hotel was really horrible. We couldn't wait to get out of there and practically fled with our luggage as soon as we could the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Indianaboy
Reviews.Content: Everthing started off well with this hotel until we checked out. The morning valet did not show up for work causing us to wait 1 hour to get our car. This caused us to miss a committment when we got home. Booked this hotel throught hotwire and when I checked my CC account on-line, the hotel had charged us for an additional 2 nights. The hotel claims that they never received payment from hotwire and hotwire claims that they were paid soon after I made the booking. The hotwire price was about half the amount that the hotel overbilled us for. This issue has not been resolved yet. I am not sure if I will stay at this hotel again or whether I will use hotwire again. However, I have used hotwire a few time and this is the first problem I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “The Silversmith - Chicago's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSpank
Reviews.Content: + Arrived at O'Hare airport and took the Blue line CTA train to the Monroe stop (2 blocks from the hotel) for $2 + Hotel is walking distance to Grant Park, shopping, museums, restaurants, night life, Chicago river, Sears tower, John Hancock building, magnificent mile, Water Tower, boat rides, etc. + Rooms are well maintained and clean + Large bathrooms with marble countertops, lots of hot water + Great security! Elevators do not work without the guest's key cards + Thermostat in room kept temperature constant + We reserved using Hotwire and paid only $114/nite

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Helpful and Nice Concierge and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: brandier
Reviews.Content: The Silversmith Hotel was excellent, the rooms are very comfortable and while not super contemporary very nice and inviting. The beds were super cozy we really enjoyed our stay over memorial day weekend. We arrived well before check in time at 3pm - arrived about noon - however our (upgraded) room was ready and suprisingly better than the actual standard room we booked (Thanks to the very corteous desk clerk.... )Also the concierge, Peggy, was super friendly and very helpful booking us last minute reservations for the comedy club ZANIES, which was awesome. This is a great hotel .. great location... great time....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Arts & Crafts Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsavant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights Nov 2006 & had a very good experience but since then management has changed so not sure what else might have changed too. Had a 1 bedroom suite that was lovely & spotlessly clean. Very large bathroom. Whole suite was beautifully decorated, including great prints/artwork & very comfortable bed. Only negative, not much natural light, as I choose to go with room at the back vs. front, which overlooks & hears the El. Very good italian restaurant across the street, food to-go or dine in. Pro: loved hotel decoration style, historic building, close to EVERYTHING (due to EL), 1 block from Fine Arts museum, M Park + suites are really nice, good price Con: rooms at front have natural light but very loud; ones at back are dark but quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: SCworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Arrived late due to flight delays. Even though I had confirmed directly with the hotel a couple of days prior, I felt compelled due to an earlier review to call the day of arrival after I realized we would be arriving really late. Spoke with front desk and they said I was guaranteed and not to worry. So at check-in around 10:30pm, I was surprised when I was informed that the room we had reserved(exec.,2Dbl beds) was not available; however, she did accomodate us with an exec., king suite( 1 bed and a sleeper sofa- my 2 sons didn't appreciate that). She did offer to switch us the following morning, but we decided to stay put. Also watch your bill. We were charged $30 for parking each night and we did not have a car. After several phone calls, I believe it was resolved-I haven't checked my bank statement yet. Besides the above two aforementioned problems, the rest of the stay was pleasant. It was relatively quiet. Actually what train noise I did hear was more like white noise and was restful. Note, since they are no longer a Crowne Plaza hotel, they no longer offer the CD, ear plugs or eye mask or atleast that is what I was told. The breakfast, though limited, was delicious. The croissants to die for. cereal/hot oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, coffee/hot chocolate, fresh juice and milk and individualized preserves. Rooms clean and comfortable size. A little dark, but the high ceilings and large windows helped. Turn down service with cookies at night, great touch. Felt safe, esp. with the keycard and security on the ground level. Lobby on "lobby level "was cozy with fireplace and piano. My boys enjoyed playing when we returned in the evenings. Self serve coffee throughout the day. Conveniently located to millenium park, Ford theatre, restaurants, and shopping. Everything else including airport, easily accessible with train right outside your doors. The blue and red line approx. 1-2 blocks away-easy stroll. I would definitely stay here again, esp. for the $115/night rate received.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, adjoining rooms”
Reviews.Author: NCpersnickety
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Silversmith Mar 29 - Apr 4. The hotel staff was always courteous and helpful, especially Peggy the concierge. When I called the week before our visit to confirm the reservations (orig reservatns made in Dec), I told her that we were celebrating my daughters' spring birthdays. She arranged a surprise of balloons and a plate of cookies in their room the evening of our arrival. Also, Peggy suggested and arranged a flat rate limo for us from O'Hare to the Silversmith. The difference in cost for 4 passengers to take an airport shuttle vs. the limo is negligible, and it was wonderful to stretch our legs in a limo after being crammed in an airplane and crowded airport most of the day! It is difficult to find the hotel if you are not looking for it , but that was part of it's charm. The Silversmith feels like a club or private hideaway. We had asked for adjoining/quiet/non-smoking rooms and were placed on the 10th floor. The king room was spacious, with a roomy bathroom that had a large granite countertop and granite tile floor, the windows in the room were very tall and had deep sills that my daughter used as a window seat. There is no extra charge for in-room internet hookup, the refrigerator is empty for our personal use (no honor bar/weighing crap like at other hotels) and Mon-Thurs there are cookies and cheescake in the lobby. The hotel was in excellent repair, no peeling wallpaper; everything looked freshly painted; the hallways, rooms and bathrooms were pristine. I loved the Arts & Crafts decor; the rooms each had old fashioned desks with wooden chairs on rollers; armoires with usable drawer space. The crisp white duvets and linens and very high ceilings also make the rooms appear roomier. The adjoining double/double room was on the small side, but had the same large windows, high ceiling and large bathroom as the king. The location was great, too! We were first time visitors to Chicago and were delighted to find that we could easily walk to the Art Institute, Oriental Ford Theatre, Macys(formerly Marshall Fields with Tiffany dome!), the Bean, and Giordano's Pizza. We also felt very safe at the Silversmith and the adjoining area. You must have an electronic card to go past the lobby on the elevator and the card only lets you get to certain floors (for instance, my card wouldn't let go to the 3rd floor only mine and the floor below.). The El is located right outside the hotel, but that was never a problem. It was a novelty, not a nuisance, to see the El cars go by at night outside the lobby windows. I would recommend asking for a quiet room if you think the noise might be a problem. Cabs are easy to catch outside the hotel, also. I wasn't sure what to expect based on the conflicting reviews on ths site, but I absolutely loved the Silversmith. I called several boutique hotels before I made reservations at Silversmith, and I can tell you that the Silversmith has many amenities that others did not offer, including adjoining rooms on top floors (other hotels only had adjoining rooms on lower floors facing construction), free in-room internet access, free refrigerator, and because we were on the top floor we had complementary breakfast each morning. I can't wait to visit again!! (and I'm very picky)!

Reviews.Title: “guaranteed reservation? With a conf #? Ha!”
Reviews.Author: DCbiztravel
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Silversmith on 3/12 at 8 pm. My travel agent had made the reservation on March 1. I had a confirmation code and a print out saying that the reservation was "guaranteed." But the "reservation" had "not yet gone through the system," according to the sole front desk person (who made a phone call unrelated to my situation and helped another guest, all while I was waiting for her to resolve the problem). My colleague's reservation, made through identical channels after mine was made, had somehow been received by the hotel. The manager was not available -- he had "gone home." I was told that I was being moved to a hotel more than a mile away and across one of Chicago's rivers. This was distressing to me as I had selected the Silversmith because it was walking distance from my meetings the next day. I explained this inconvenience, but the Silversmith told me that I could not be moved to any other hotel in Chicago except the Hilton Garden Inn that they had selected for me that was, as I said, inconveniently located. I was handed $8 in cash to pay for the cab ride there and then summarily sent on my way. I think I got one mumbled apology.

Reviews.Title: “That was a Crowne Plaza?”
Reviews.Author: Stacey&Ian
Reviews.Content: I had nothing but problems with this hotel. While booking online, I called the hotel to get more information and the pushy phone personnel insisted I book over the phone, not online. When they screwed up my reservation, I had only their word against mine, and the customer in this case was not right. I don't know who taught this place about customer service, but it was the worst I've ever experienced. The desk clerks accused me of lying, and even argued with me about how many towels were supposed to be in a room, since we were short of towels. Honestly, just send up another towel, why argue with me? After speaking with the assistant manager about the fact that my 2 night reservation was only made for 1 night(and that wasn't the ONLY problem, just the biggest one) he graciously offered me a room for way more than I had paid for the first night, knowing my itinerary left me too little time to change hotels. When I left the hotel later, I came around the corner into the lobby in time to overhear him making fun of me to the valet staff. He had the courtesy to turn red and at least stop talking while I walked out of the lobby. That was the most unprofessionally run hotel I have EVER stayed at and I will never be back. If you choose to stay there, get your confirmation in writing to back you up, and you'd better hope you don't run into any problems, because they will not be resolved. You may also want to take into account that the train is running right outside the door, and it's rather noisy. The supposed 'Frank Lloyd Wright' theme falls way short and feels like an excuse to have an outdated, worn-looking interior. For what I paid to stay at that hotel, I am shocked. I can't believe they call themselves a Crowne Plaza. They do not live up to the wonderful customer service and quality I have enjoyed at their other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Shower”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Cyclist
Reviews.Content: I only ask two things from a hotel: bed and a shower. When you pay $300 for a night and can't get a hot shower, well you aren't going to get a good review from me. Had they given me a hot shower, I would have rated the hotel as above average. And offer of a free breakfast didn't balance out in my book with the very cold shower we both had to suffer through.

Reviews.Title: “very quiet room”
Reviews.Author: vegasgambler
Reviews.Content: Asked for a quiet room away from construction. Got room 814...which had no view, but was VERY quiet. 11' ceilings are wonderful. Had a long entryway with a wall blocking noise coming from the hallway. It's also in a corner, so not a lot of people walk by. The bed was very comfortable, as were the pillows, and the bathroom was a nice size. It was nice to have a mini fridge, too. Received a complimentary bottle of water each night (that was put in the fridge...nice touch), and turndown service with a couple of chocolates. The only problem was an inconsistent knocking sound coming from the bathroom sometimes. Closing the door helped somewhat, but could still hear it. Loved having to have a key card to get the elevator to go past the lobby, but like some others on here, had to have the card key remagnetized twice the second day because it wouldn't work. All of the employees were very friendly. Called about 1pm the day I arrived and was able to check in early. Was very handy to Garrett's Popcorn, Pizano's Pizza (try the buttercrust thin crust), and the Randolph St. station for the South Shore commuter train. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Movadoman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have arrived back in the UK after a five night stay at the Crowne Plaza Silversmith in Chicago at the end of October and into early November. If you forgive the irony, this is an absolute gem of a hotel located in the jewellery quarter right in the heart of the financial district and in the Central Loop, 1 block south of the Marshall Fields Department Store (now Macy's). It provided us with an ideal and safe base from which to explore Chicago as tourists. After a lot of research and poring over countless Chicago hotel reviews, we decided to back the judgement of others and book the Crowne Plaza Silversmith via its own ICH website. What a great choice of hotel we made and one that is fully deserving of its high ranking on Trip Advisor! We think you will struggle to find a city centre (downtown) hotel anywhere with such spacious, quality and affordable rooms, backed by high cleanliness standards, attention to service detail and superb, polite but not over-effusive staff. For our part, we feel competent in assessing if staff attitudes are forced rather than natural. There wasn't a single staff member at the hotel, who did not acknowledge us on eye contact, smile when necessary and provided what we wanted when called upon. Truly remarkable! We decided to pay extra for a room with a seating area, having been the victims previously of undersized accommodations in San Francisco and Washington DC and we were allocated a spacious, yet tastefully decorated room on the fifth floor at the back of the hotel. It was spotlessly clean and well equipped and had a big comfy bed, superb bathroom with walk-in shower and marble sink surround, efficient airconditioning, and was a lot less noisy than we expected. We hardly heard the "EL" below and never once heard our hotel neighbours eirther side or above, even though the hotel was full every night. Two good restaurants are close by: 1 - Italian Village - 4 blocks away - great food, superb decor, supreme service and all at a sensible price 2 - Millers Pub - 1 block away - good food and service, extensive menu, excellent prices and a great atmosphere as well We will certainly visit Chicago again in future and stay at the Crowne Plaza Silversmith but during Summer next time.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but noisy”
Reviews.Author: govtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown Plaza in September 06 and should have heeded a tripadvisor review to get a room away from the L. It is a very nice hotel, very comfy room, but there is the regular whooshing sound of the L. The complimentary bag of sleep aids, including earplugs are a nice touch, and they did help. However, I would only go back if I could be assured of a room away from the L.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Find, but Worth it”
Reviews.Author: DWGriffith
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for downtown Chicago events. Suite was lovely, and reasonably priced. But as usual: ask the desk clerk for discounts until you get what you think you should get. The Frank Lloyd Wright motif went throughout the hotel, and the coordination was rather soothing, but the uniform brown was monotonoujs. Except you'd really have to take it up with Frank Lloyd Wright. Only problem was the restaurant downstairs, which was frankly not good food. But the pizza parlor across Wabash was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Wyomingirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was centrally located to attractions and within easy walking distance. Enjoyed the beautiful room and the turndown service. If staying go to the Italian Village, a short walk, the food was awesome. Would definitely stay her again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: kcplaza2001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza this weekend, Sept. 15-17. We were amazed how good the hotel was, from the location (next to the L) to the great service and rooms. After looking to find a hotel we choose this one by the user feedback on this site and couldn't have been happier. We got a rate of $189 a night!! Location: Next to the L and a block from the Millennium Park. Also a 10 minute walk to Michigan Ave. Couldn't pick a better spot in terms of walkability. Another plus is there's a restaurant across the street that's open till 3AM, which we tried when our flight was delayed and got in at 11PM. A nice bonus. Room: We requested and got a room towards the back so we wouldn't be bothered by the L. The room was very clean, very comfortable bed, and large bathroom. The room was very quiet and comfortable. Service: Very good. Fast check-in, helpful in getting directions, and coffee in the lobby in the morning for those early departures to the airport. As far as I'm concerned, the best value in Chicago and I will not stay anywhere else in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: taschenck
Reviews.Content: It is rare for a hotel's service to exceed expectations. I make a point of selecting hotels based on comments made on TripAdvisor, and as a result, set high expectations.
