The Silversmith exceeded my high expectations. They deserve my time to stop and make an endorsement. The hotel's overall facility, rooms, and bathrooms are upscale and in very good condition. Relaxing classical music is played in the lobby and the staff covers every detail in making sure you get a quiet night's sleep as part of the Crown Plaza Hotels Sleep Program. Our requests for amenities were addressed promptly and courteously by every staff member we met. In summary, it is a First Class hotel. The Silversmith is also perfectly located for walking access to Milennium Park, Grant Park, Marshall Field's, the gorgeous waterfront and it's walking path to all of the major museums including the Art and Field Museums. There are also plenty of fine dining and quick bite establishments surrounding the hotel. For anyone seeking a great place to stay while touring downtown Chicago, The Silversmith is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DarrenMac
Reviews.Content: We booked the Silversmith to meet up with family whilst staying in Chicago. Location is good, but right on the loop, so best to request room at the back of the hotel - it must be noisy at the front. Easily walk to most of the attractions, but station is right outside for those further afield. Rooms were excellently presented. We had a suite, and had plenty of room to stretch out. Bathroom was very clean. There is no bar, but Millers pub is only 1 block South, and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else? (Unless you have to)”
Reviews.Author: GreginSantaBarbara
Reviews.Content: Positives: Peggi T conceirge is the soul of the hotel - inspiring, big hearted. Good value for quality product, much better stay here than Iâ€™ve had at some Chi megahotels. Free high speed internet access at this hotel - at some hotels this is $13 extra Free access to 800 numbers, unlike at Starwood hotels where thereâ€™s often a $2 per call access fee Cordless phone in room is appreciated. Nice, tasteful Prarie style decor, refreshingly not generic, no cookie cutter look to the hotel. Real oak furniture and doors, comfortable look in room, good lighting. CD player, clock radio wasnâ€™t as tinny as most hotels. Good sized bathrooms with close up make up mirrors, granite countertops. Location located right at the â€˜elâ€™ subway stop - extremely convenient and I took the ride from the airport one transfer right to the hotel for under $2. Within two blocks find Art Inst, dept stores, many restaurants, kinkos/Fed Exp. Personnel that ask â€˜How is your stay?â€� you have a chance to respond and get resolution then and there. Employees at the hotel are alert, hospitable, good communication with all levels of hotel empoyees Bathrooms had comfortable robes, Bedspreads looked clean without a â€˜historyâ€™ Patrice Brazil, all the conceirges and front desk employees good. Peggi T, the conceirge youâ€™ve read about on this site, i-s inspiring, and helpful, â€˜soul of the hotelâ€™ - we didnâ€™t need special services but we were enriched by her presence and comments. Good quality in room coffee and coffee maker, fridge thatâ€™s quiet, Free in room safes that Four Points hotels sometimes donâ€™t provide - helpful for storing passport, IDâ€™s, laptop. Excellent security - one needs hotel guest key card to access your floor Enough staff on duty at front desk unlike some hotels. No signature fragrance in public areas, as Starwood hotels has done Clean, fragrance free environs - no disguising hotel odors Doormen are very efficient, they pay attention Housekeeping staff really good - supervisors check, follow up Negatives: Shower head doesnâ€™t release strong torrent of water - it's ok. Adaâ€™s Restaurant downstairs - best to skip this food thatâ€™s an embarrassement to the taste buds - huge portions, reasonably priced, not very good food - with maybe the worst coffee weâ€™ve had, food has too much deep frying, the corned beef tasted like turkey or ham corn beef, the noodle krugle overkilled with sweetness. Needed: a fresh menu of fewer, higher quality choices. Service is good. Executive guest floor breakfast has uninspired pastries and breads, a toaster to warm bagels/rolls should be on public view instead of in the kitchen area hidden from view. Loud, intrusive TV in small breakfast lounge on 10th floor. Room closed after breakfast. Hotel doesnâ€™t list how much local calls are or 800 numbers, No tongs with ice buckets. Lobby could use a little more personal touch - such as magazines, newspapers, fresh flowers for friendly ambience. Overall, good find that we wouldn't known about unless tripadvisor reviews told about it - thanks everyone! A very good hotel overall. Why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: SDHDTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Chicago, but our first staying downtown (in the Loop). The Silversmith Crown Plaza was an unbelieveable. We arrived the weekend before the 4th of July. Starting with checking in, we were completley taken care. The hotel staff could not be beat!!! They were the best staff I have seen at any hotel I have ever stayed at and being in the military for 23 years, I have stayed at quite a few. The rooms were large with very comfortable beds. There was a turndown service everynight, with chocolates my kids looked forward to. The bath rooms were huge for hotels. The intricate tile floors and high ceilings spoke a lot of the quality of this fine establishment. The concierge was extrememly helpful for directions, places to go, etc... I wish I would have listened to her when she told me how to get to the Science and Industry Museum. She gave me the bus routes to get dropped off at the front door of the museum. I decided on my own to take the El and found out the museum was 3 miles from the stop in a VERY rough part of town. All the time we were waiting for the bus to complete our trip, I was thinking "I will ALWAYS listen to the concierge from now on"! The rest of the staff are just as helpful. When we left we discoverd our van battery was dead and the staff jumped through hoops to find jumper cables and a vehicle to get me on my way at 0430 in the AM. THEY ROCK!!!!! There are absoluty zero downsides to this hotel. You are a fool to stay any where else unless you have money to burn. bob

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, couldn't have been more pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my chances with a priceline 3star search in the Grant Park area and ended up here for $140. Couldn't have been happier since it was a "Taste of Chicago" weekend and every price I saw on the web was $200+ for a hotel within walking distance to Grant Park. The 12 foot ceilings are great (you just don't see that anymore, thank goodness for old architecture). The room was very comfortable with a nice and very large bathroom. Free internet access was also a plus. Staff was extremely helpful, no problems whatsoever. I asked for a room away from the train tracks and was given a room on the 5th floor...I could barely hear the train go by, it wasn't a problem at all...but it's right outside the front door of the hotel if you need it! I read some poor reviews of Ada's (Deli adjacent to the hotel) but my family had breakfast there on Sunday morning and loved it. I used the valet parking and didn't have a problem with that either (it's expensive but you'll find that anywhere in the heart of the city). I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to be close to all the action in the Millennium/Grant Park area. We even walked to Navy Pier from this hotel but it was a bit of a hike. You don't pay top dollar at Crowne Plaza Silversmith but you definitely get the quality of a 3-4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No ComplaintsW”
Reviews.Author: redhead8811
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Crown Plaza Silversmith and purchased the "Art of the City" package through the Art Institute. We mapquested the route and had no problem finding the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful from the doorman to the front desk and consierge. We were very pleased with the room as well. It was absolutely spotless with a huge bathroom and lovely arts and crafts decor. We were on the 5th floor and the El was right below us but we agreed that we'd stayed in hotels with a/c units that were louder! It was not a factor at all and we slept great. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Silversmith.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: skinnerja_mn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED our stay at the Crowne Plaza Silversmith over the Memorial Day holiday. We stayed two nights and paid $161/night + tax + valet, through a discount broker in Chicago. The hotel was a little hard to find at first - our online map showed that the hotel was on the east side of Wabash, but it's on the west side. Heading south on Wabash, look to the right for flags between Madison and Monroe. I thought the location was great, if you want to stay in the Loop/Theatre District/Grant Park area (and just a 5 minute CTA ride to River North). A taxi ride from Navy Pier cost about $8. The neighborhood is great, not seedy, as it's in the North Loop area, but it does feels more "downtown" than Michigan Ave's "uptown". When we got in, the front desk staff asked us if we'd stayed with them before, and as we hadn't, they upgraded us to a Suite (retails at $529/night). Absolutely beautiful room. We had asked for a high floor because of the El running parallel with Wabash at about 2nd/3rd floors. We still heard the El at night, but not too bad, sort of like a whooshing noise. The bed was doublesheeted and we had white robes to wear. The two TVs, ethernet connection and refridgerator were excellent amenities and the bed was super comfortable. Our tall windows let in a lot of light and had a window seat too. The view was of another building though. We ordered room service for lunch one day, and although many reviews thought the attached restaurant Ada's Deli was bad, the pastrami sandwich we ordered was fabulous. The gal who answered the room service phone wasn't very pleasant though. Also, our valet took coins from our car - they tell you to remove valuables but I guess that translates to "or else". It was only 90 cents, but it put a damper on our experience. Everything else about our trip was dandy though and we feel like the hotel is our home away from home in Chicago - especially if we can get that rate again.

Reviews.Title: “adequate but poor location”
Reviews.Author: rbw141rbw141
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on a last minute trip. While the cost seemed comparable to Michigan Ave, the location leaves a bit to be desired. This hotel has an entrance below the elevated train, and really appears to be a nicely converted office building. We actually thought the GPS on our rental car was wrong and drove by the entrance twice before finding it. The neighborhood was a bit seedy, but we were able to find a nice Italian resturant a few block away (Tratttoria 10). The rooms are very nice, unique, and not at all like a generic chain. There are NO views. The staff are nice. They've done a nice job with what they've had to work with, but due to the location, we would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: trippin_it_up
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Silversmith while in town for business and pleasure. This was one of the top Crowne Plaza hotels I have stayed at. The rooms were nicely decorated with oak trim, oak beds, and oak wardrobe/entertainment center. I had a King premium room, which was nice sized for downtown standards. The location was good - about 1/2 mile from Michigan/Chicago River and a block from Millenium/Grant Park. The L stops right outside and it is fairly convenient to the McCormick Place. Most of the good dining is North of the river, so a 1.5 mile walk or short cab ride will get you there quickly. I have stayed at the Palmer House, Hotel 71, Grand Hyatt, and some of the other 3* hotels in the area. This was far superior to those in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brendcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a birthday weekend of theatre and shopping. We were very pleased. The staff from valet to desk to housekeeping was friendly and helpful. Peggy, the concierge, was excellent and had wonderful recommendations. The room was very nice with the high ceilings and very large bathroom. We did not hear the train hardly at all. As others have noted, the deli downstairs isn't the best food, but staff was pretty good. This would be one of my first choices next time we stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: faranghusband
Reviews.Content: As expected, the taxi driver from ORD didnâ€™t know where this hotel is located so be sure to have the street address at hand. Staff at the second floor lobby was friendly and helpful. We had booked a suite on the executive floor. Suite 1005 has the best view of the lake, but the view is across some black roofs and I wouldnâ€™t fight for it. The noise from the train below was not disturbing at all but the refrigerator was far too loud for the poor guy (me) who had to sleep on the sofa bed. The rest of the room was very nice and practical. There was even a microwave and a sink â€“ very useful for preparing baby food. Our suite was not very large, in fact it was rather cramped when the sofa bed was in use. Also, there is no window in the â€œliving roomâ€� and no door between bedroom and living room. But there are two TV sets. Continental breakfast at the club lounge was ok. There are only two cocktail tables and eight chairs in the lounge although we were always lucky with space. While both the suite and the executive lounge were nothing to write home about, it must be added that the surcharges for â€œsuiteâ€� and â€œexecutiveâ€� were minimal. So at the end, it was a great value for a family of four. A very comfortable place and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware on ground floor”
Reviews.Author: squirrelgardens
Reviews.Content: Beware of pickpockets in the lobby and front of the hotel..The Hotel Lobby is not on the Ground Floor and you enter into a smallish entrance. I have stayed here before but this was a red flag for us not to return. Hotel management were told of the problem but seemed to be annoyed with us not the pickpockets.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: flightoffantasy
Reviews.Content: Great convenient location. Helpful staff. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Ada's restaurant/deli/bar connected on the ground level was good with pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: Maine-ah
Reviews.Content: 3-night stay over Veteran's Day weekend. Got a 10th floor executive room with breakfast coupons for Ada's next door, average price $229 a night (Thurs-Sun.) Ada's food is lousy, we ate there the second morning because the continental breakfast offered to 10th floor guests was in a small, uncomfortable room with a TV blasting. (Another disappointment: I assume an "executive lounge" would be available evenings and whatnot - it's not, only open for breakfast.) The desk staff was borderline rude when we arrived an hour before official check-in time, and had us trudge back downstairs with our suitcases to give them to the bellman. Our terrible first impression was fortunately mollified by the quality of the room once we were allowed in. The construction is solid; we never heard a sound from either occupied room next to us. These are not rooms for families, but they're perfect for a couple. Location is good, with easy access to subway, El and buses. Millenium Park and Art Institute are only a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Close to Theater and shopping”
Reviews.Author: tlannan30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the more reasonably priced ones in the area around the theater district. The hotel is one block from Michigan Ave. and only a couple blocks from the theaters! Our room was ready when we asked to check in early. Our room was gorgeous. The beds were comfortable and I love all of the products that they offer in order for you to get a good night's sleep! The bathroom was HUGE!! I loved it! The shower head was disappointing. It was one of those massage ones set on a horrible setting and I couldn't reach to fix it. Housekeeping came and asked if we wanted turn down service. We could hear the train, of course, but it was not that bad. The desk clerk who checked us in was not exactly friendly but she wasn't rude either. She got the job done quickly and efficiently. The concierge did not seem friendly but we did not actually talk to her so I can't say for sure. Most of the bellhops/valets were very friendly and they are the first people you encounter when entering the building. We will definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for more...”
Reviews.Author: Jakey450
Reviews.Content: My sister recently came to visit from England for a visit. I chose the Silversmith because of the great reviews on this site! A few days before our stay I called Peggy the concierge and made a few requests. As it was my sister's birthday I wanted the stay to be memorable. When we arrived at the hotel our suite was ready! Not only were all of my requests met, but there was a bottle of white wine chilling with a birthday card for my sister! I couldn't have asked for better service! All of the staff and ammenities were perfect. My only complaints: 1. I called the hotel before booking online because I wanted a two room suite (one bedroom with a sleeper sofa behind the french doors.) Upon checking in I found we only had a one room suite. This was a bit of an upset as we had three people sharing the room and wanted a little bit of privacy. However, it was nice anyway. 2. We had breakfast at Ada's next door. The coffee was weak, the hashbrowns were cold and they didn't care. My main portion on breakfast, the Beneditct Arnold was perfect, but I'll never visit again. There's a 'Corner Bakery' one block south next to the Palmer House Hilton. Go there for breakfast, save yourself $5.00 per person and be much happier!

Reviews.Title: “I am down-grading my rating, but still a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Nicci
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay here, and I'm a little disappointed about this last trip. First, prices have gone up significantly; it's still a fine "value," but our "suite" was on par price-wise with a nice room at the Renassaince/Westin-types. When we landed at the airport, I called to ask the El Stop to detrain. I was calling on my cell. The woman who answered said, Yadda, yadda, "I'm with a guest now, please hold." So I held. 5 minutes later, I hung up. I tried again, same thing. And I held. I called again later, as we were now getting closer to downtown and I was a little nervous. Same answer, so I shouted out "I just have the quickest question," and she started arguing with me! You can tell I'm peeved about this. It's b/c service here used to be so wonderful, and there were always plenty of staff in the past. I had chalked it up to a single problem until I was at the desk later that day and the staff person did the same thing. I told her it was okay with me to attend to the caller, which she did (I have no idea if it was the same person). This was our first stay in a "suite" here. True, two rooms, which was our goal. However, and I guess this is in keeping with Prairie style, the wall between the two rooms is 3 feet shorter than the ceiling. This defeated the purpose of having a separate work space for me apart from my husband. Too loud. Gym is 3 aerobic machines. Not a big deal in nice weather, as you are a block from the walking areas, but that's 6 months of the year that are touch-and-go. Business Center is $5 to use (each time), and only one computer prints. If you stay on 10th floor with the breakfast room, the servers are TOTALLY stressed out on weekends (but they're sweet). Bagels weren't even bagels, stale bread in square bagel form. But the zucchini bread was awesome. Coffee very good. Location is still prime, prime, prime. And not nearly as expensive as the Palmer House. I had felt the pleasure of staying here was in part the service, and I found that lacking this time. Hopefully, it was just a passing phase.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: profriars
Reviews.Content: Three night stay for a conference, cute room with a little nook with a desk area. The train was right below my window but I couldn't really hear it, the windows are double panes, just sounded like a woosh of wind now and again. A good experience all around, and the train is actually a great benefit, took it in from midway airport and the stop is directly outside the front door of the hotel. Bathroom was larger than most hotels, rooms were spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Easy from the airport and close to the Park”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: Great for the money and very well situated to go to Millenium Park and to take the train from O'Hare. It's not as good to get to Miracle Mile and that area, but there are plenty of cabs. As compared to other hotels of its quality, it's far cheaper. The concierge was just great and got us on the Architectural Tour about 15 minutes before it left. She was amazing. The whole Chicago experience was a brilliant one.

Reviews.Title: “Still An Excellent Hotel for the Monay”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights this month and were not disappointed during our second visit. Room was clean, well appointed and the staff was excellent. Restaurant was very good for breakfast, lunch and dinner (if you like a diner-type New York-deli style food -which we do). Crowne Plaza also now offers ear plugs, eye shades, lavender linen spray and a relaxation CD in the room so any EL noise is a moot point. Only complaint is there is no parking (not that I would normally rent a car in Chicago but I had to drive to Milwaukee for a day) and the valet parking available was expensive and inconvenient since they park the car several blocks away. I waited about a half hour for the car and I called ahead 10 minutes before. What a waste of time. Otherwise the staff is excellent and the room is definitely a good deal in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out! This hotel double billed my credit card!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Orbitz. I Had a nice stay at the hotel but when I got home there was a little surprise when I got my credit card statement. This hotel had double billed my credit card! Orbitz billed me for the room and so did the hotel. So far I have not gotten a satisfactory response from this hotel or Orbitz. I have spent hours on the phone being put on hold, trying to get this issue resolved. Be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Content: The staff is what really sets this hotel apart from other downtown Chicago hotels. They are always cheerful and helpful. Our room on the 10th floor even had a minor lake view at no extra charge. Most hotels (i.e. The Drake) would charge extra for a sliver of lake view. Not here! The "El" train outside the front door just adds to the downtown Chicago experience. You can hear it in the room but it's not very loud at all. The area seems very safe as long as you use common sense. We recommend The Big Downtown restaurant one block south. Millenium Park was great! Many of the reviews say the same thing but I would like to comment on a few minor negatives for you: The wall dividing our suite into 2 rooms only went about 75% of the way up to the ceiling (for air circulation?!). Provides privacy but not sound insulation between the two t.v.s. Also the lack of a pool is a bummer if you have kids. The cable t.v. channel selection is poor also; not even the Disney channel! If a hotel doesn't have a pool for the kids at least have the Disney channel! There was no bedding for the sofa sleeper in our room. Usually it is found in one of the drawers, some hotels will even have the bed made up in the sofa when you flip it out!. Had to wait 20 minutes for it to be brought up. Our floor had a lounge with a continental breakfast which was just pastries and juice. Overall a GREAT hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago with my mother for three days -- the sole purpose of our trip being a U2 concert. I chose this hotel primarily based upon this sites glowing reviews, and it's close proximity to the United Center. We were both incredibly pleased. As I'm lazy and did not want to drag luggage on the El, we opted for the airport shuttle service, which I believe was 30 dollars per person (the price varies slightly according to hotel, and since the silversmith is downtown, it was one of the more expensive stops). Although we arrived at the hotel three hours prior to check in (my genius self forgot to allow for the hour back time change), the staff promptly lead us to our room. About an hour after our arrival, we recieved a call from the concierge asking us if we were pleased with our room. We were in the back on the 4th floor. While we faced a brick wall, we didn't have any problems with noise from the El (although, as I live in Manhattan, I can pretty much sleep through anything). The rooms were spacious (high ceilings were a nice touch), and I only wish I had that bathroom in my apartment. There was a good size desk in the room (good for business travelers), and free high speed internet (as my laptop is glued to my hip, this was a much appreciated amenity). We also recieved evening turndown service, even though we didn't request it, and the front desk was very prompt in replying to my request for feather pillows. We ordered room service for breakfast one morning, and as noted by another reviewer, their potato pancakces were excellent. The portions were also very large -- a little too large. The concierge also called up about five minutes after our food was delivered to ask us if we were pleased with our meal. Unfortunately, as we weren't there for long, we didn't have time to do much site seeing. We did walk to Millenium Park one night, which was quite lovely. I never felt unsafe walking around the surrounding area of the hotel -- as with any large city, just exercise common sense and stay alert. A bus to the United Center also stops diagonally across the street from the hotel. There was a young female concierge there who was definately on too many happy pills -- her ear to ear smile was just a little too eager to please. We did recieve a reccomendation for a pizza place from her (Giordano's -- not bad, but I'm still partial to NY pizza ;). It was also Mother's Day weekend, and they had some free desserts in the lobby for all Moms. I certainly hope to return to Chicago soon, and will most definately stay at the Silversmith. It was an absolute pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Superb room, location, and service”
Reviews.Author: stl_cardinals
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous hotels in downtown Chicago: Essex, Palmer House, Almafi, Intercontinental, Club Quarters, Hyatt Regency, Best Western, Holiday Inn, Hotel 71, and a few others I can't recall. The Silversmith is in the top of the group in my opinion. A group of 8 of us arrived at 9:00am on a Friday morning and all were able to check-in to our 3 rooms that early. On top of that, we were each given an upgrade to a king suite at no extra charge. Another group came later and received a regular king room. The regular king room was spacious with high ceilings. The king suite I was in had 2 seperate rooms with high ceilings. The bed was comfortable. I was next to the L on the 6th floor. I could hear it, but it wasn't loud enough to keep me awake. Maid service was good. The bellman were very helpful with advice on blues clubs, bars, restaurants, and transportation. Friendly guys. There is a restaurant/bar downstairs open until 3am on the weekends. Good food (according to a few members of our group). A block south is a Corner Bakery with great breakfast. A block north is a Garretts popcorn for the best popcorn anywhere. Different L stations are very close enabling quick/easy travel nearly anywhere in the city. Only problem with the hotel occured when I came home and there was a charge on my card. It took a few calls before I found out I was charged for a robe. Took a few more calls to finally get the charge taken off. The robe had been thrown in with the dirty towels. Understandable mistake but became difficult to get the issue resolved. Although, it was resolved in the end and I thank the management for resolving the issue. Could happen at any hotel. I am really glad they took the charge off because I didn't want to have a reason to not go back to this great hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: ToastyReward
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent! We only stayed one night at the Silversmith and then moved to the Four Seasons (that was on someone else's dime) for the next three nights...and, I liked the Silversmith better! It was $300 less per night too. The staff was so friendly, they let us check in early, held our bags for a few hours after we checked out, and made a fuss over our kids. The location is pefect. We walked to the museums and Millenium park. We also walked to the restaurant district, but that's not close, or you can take a cab for $6. Oh, we took the El from the airport (The El is $1.75 or a $45 taxi ride) and the stop is right at the door of the Silversmith, couldn't of been easier. You can hear the El sometimes (we were on the 10th floor) but after awhile you don't even notice. The breakfast had something for everyone, the room it was served in was just a little small. Silversmith also provided nice terry robes and turn down service. I highly recommend this hotel and we will stay here the next time we come.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the silversmith”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite on the tenth floor. The room very quiet and spacious and the service was superb. The breakfast that came with the room was very good and the complementary cheesecake was delicious. The hotel is definitely as good as any four star hotel I have stayed in and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality makes the stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a hotel where I have been treated so nicely, and where the staff is accomodating and genuinely interested in helping you and making sure that you have everything that you need. Form early checkin to directions to wherever we wanted to go, the staff was ready and able to assist. The hotel is very nice, clean, and located close enough to anywhere you want to go. The Chicago experience involves the train and walking through beautiful downtown, and the location of this hotel gives you a chance ot experience the city that way. There are an abundance of local, non-chain restaurants within walking distance so you won't go hungry! The hotel also has its own restaurant that serves a delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: hathorlive
Reviews.Content: For visitors looking for an exciting offbeat vacation, the Silversmith is definitely the of the best hotel options in the city. If you are looking for cookie cutter rooms with bland furnishings, this is not the place for you. However, if you want to stay in the heart of the city, move with the people who live in this great city, this hotel offers a wonderful location and great staff. Several points to some of the other reviews: 1) This isn't a Mich Ave hotel. It's in the business district and as such, isn't as touristy a location. However, you get a wonderfully restored, historic building designed by one of the city's master architects. The furnishings are nice and clean and very relaxing. 2) Yes, the el is right in front of the hotel. As in, you can stand on the L platform and see the entryway to the hotel. But this isn't a problem, if you want to go anywhere in the city. It's a great attribute for those people who don't need taxis to get around an urban setting. 3) Noise...we stayed on the 8th floor in the back of the building. Despite some noise the first night, no earplugs were needed. The beds are very comfy and the bathrooms are something I could only wish I had at home. The hotel was VERY quite in general, though you can hear the slight noise of the urban setting. 4)This is NOT a bad part of town. I was with two other females and we walked everywhere at all times of the day and night. It's not as glitzy or busy as Michigan Ave, but you certainly don't need to freak out about walking down the street to go to a club or for dinner. Yes, there are a couple of people who work the lobby on the first floor/street level. But they are working, not bouncing the street in front of the building. They are getting luggage, helping customers and generally doing things that people pay huge bucks for in expensive hotels. I never once thought they were guarding the lobby. 5) Early check in--- We arrived in the city via the L at 10am. We were helped inside (the doormen could hear us clanking down the steps of the El with our suitcases and were quick to help out). The doorman were excellent, offering a lot of advice for us since we were going to see the "Cubbies". The receptionist not only gave us an early check in (we'd asked for a place to store our luggage for the game)...but gave us a great room. In fact, I've never been in such a flexible hotel before. They definitely epitomize the word "accomodating". The staff in this hotel is unreal. When we left, the awesome doorman (one who carried two of our suitcases UP the L stairway when we voiced concerns about them being too heavy) always greeted us and offered umbrellas and advice without hesitation. The concierge was very helpful and so cheerful it was almost like being at cheer camp. But everyone in this hotel was awesome, friendly and helpful. I had a nice time just talking to them about the city and local places to visit/see. In comparison, we were sent to the poshest hotel on Mich Ave to get L passes from their gift shop. After waiting 20 minutes or longer in line at their conceirge desk (just to ask where the gift shop was)...we realized that spending more money on a hotel doesn't mean better service. If I had paid that much for a room and had to wait that long for someone to help me, I'd be mad. You will never wait more than a couple of minutes for anything at this hotel. Overall, this was a great trip. We looked forward to coming back to the room and resting between site seeing. And it's location to the lake front, shopping and museums means that you can go for short trips and the hotel is always just a few blocks away. If you have small children who need naps or just want to dump your shopping and go back out, this is the place to stay. We ate breakfast at Ada's several times. The meals were good and fairly priced, even if the staff seemed less than outgoing at times. But if you are looking for a quick start to the day with a wide option of meals, this is a good place to start. I have to say that I will probably never stay in another hotel while in Chicago. The quirkiness of this place is endearing. And trust me when I say that the best way to wind down from an exciting day is sitting in the lobby at night, munching on cheesecake, sipping the variety of coffees/teas and chatting with fellow guests. An excellent touch with great lighting, a soothing piano and really, a relaxing end to the day. I am a picky traveller and a picky sleeper. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. You can't do much better than this hotel. Trust the ratings and stay here. It was a wonderful urban experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location (and a great place, too)”
Reviews.Author: SocksandSox
Reviews.Content: We chose the Crowne Plaza Silversmith for 2 main reasons: 1) Location: within blocks from Millennium Park, Grant Park, Art Mus., etc. Since the weather was so nice we walked everywhere - Navy Pier, Water Tower, Sears Tower, Aquarium/Field Museum, Theater, etc. Marshall Fields is just blocks away as well as the Red Line subway/EL that takes you to Wrigley Field. EL is right out front that we did use a couple times since so convenient. 2) Style: Arts & Craft/Mission style throughout the hotel. Great touches throughout lobby, halls, and into rooms. Bathroom very large w/ marble floors & counters. We had 2 room mini-suite with parlor with separate TV, desk, coffee table and sofa. 12 ft. high ceilings gives added appearance of spaciousness. Our huge windows even had a little view of Lake Michigan. So nice to see the sailboats and tour boats on the water. We tossed around the idea of staying closer to the Magnificent Mile area, but we are glad we didn't. It was nice to be in the heart of downtown, yet so close to the lake front and the parks. The Silversmith is a quaint, historic hotel with top notch staff. We always enjoyed being greeted by the bellmen & doormen whether we were coming or going. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay here on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Chicago hotels!”
Reviews.Author: YpsilantiTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just stayed three nights at this fine, beautifully appointed hotel. Small suite on the 10th floor, wonderful furnishings, nicely served continental breakfast just down the hall. It is a small and perfectly situated hotel in the Loop area, walking distance to the Art Instititute, the new Millennium Park, and much more. It was a safe and busy neighborhood even until midnight, shopping, decent restaurants and theaters nearby. A lovely lobby and small but excellent fitness center just off the lobby (clean and comfortable, windows out on to the street, treadmills, elliptical trainer and universal wieght machine and more.) Super friendly staff, too. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Chicago, and this is definitely one of my favorites, for families or business, whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lolly1925
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for an executive room on the 10th floor. Our room was large with king size bed, lovely addition of a turn-down maid service each night with chocolates left on our pillows. Room was also supplied with earplugs, nightmask, lavendar spray and relaxation CD but only one kit - not that this was a problem. There was two bathrobes provided in the bathroom. We paid the additional rate for the room as included in the rate was continential breakfast - pastries, bagels, cereals, juices, tea/coffee which was supplied on our floor in a small meeting room. We could not see the L train from our room, as we were facing the back so did not have much of a view at all but at the same time we were not bothered by noise. The hotel is within walking distance of the main attractions of Chicago (well we walked to them!) and although not a particularly pleasant sight returning to the hotel at night-time but if you walk a block east, you come out by Grant Park which is wonderful and you do not feel like you are in the same city. We did not use any of the other facilities at the hotel nor did we get chance to sample the free cheesecake (but would have loved to) as we were still out at the time (and it is only served mon-thurs). Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

HotelInfo.Name: The Silversmith Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 10 S Wabash Ave, Chicago, IL 60603
